loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 35 years old and is married with six children. Her business is well-organized and she sells sorghum in sacks.  She has 1 year of experience and her business is open every day. 

With the new loan she has requested, Vestine will be able to purchase more sorghum in sacks for resale, which will help her to earn more profit and to expand her business. With the expansion of her business, she hopes to employ neighbors in the community so that they can send their children to school. She also hopes that once this business grows, people in her community will be able to buy groceries and she will be able to pay school fees for her own children.

loans.use: To increase her business by buying more quantities of sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school (one is still too young). She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a retail business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments from those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding into a wholesale shop in the future.

With her KES 5,000 loan, Lucy wants to purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour and paraffin. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour and paraffin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is from the village of Patara Lilo, Gardabani District. He is 50 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Maka, two daughters (7 and 5 years old) and his parents. 

Mamuka is a truck driver. He works as a contractor on a local sand-pit. He transports the sand. He gets 500 Laris per month. Mamuka’s parents are managing the dairy farm owned by the family. They have 4 milk cows and produce yogurt from the milk, which is sold in grocery stores in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Maka is a housewife. Mamuka and Maka’s elder daughter goes to school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. The family's total average income is 1500 Laris. 

Mamuka has requested credit for changing the tire-covers of his truck, as the old ones are in bad conditions already and may cause danger to the driver. The new tire-covers will serve him for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase tire-covers for the truck.

loans.name: Christine  Joyce

texts.en:
Christine Joyce is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store.
Christine Joyce has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sadar Jaya Group

texts.en:
Agus is 33 years old, married, and has four children. He has an 8 year old, a 5 year old, and 3-month-old twins. 

He has been a florist for five years in a local market. His business has been doing well, but he wants to use the loan to expand it by buying more flowers and different types of flowers so he has more variety in the stall. In the future he hopes to have a large flower store.

The income from the stall helps pay for educational expenses and health care for his children. His hope for his children is that they all can go to school.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to resell in his stall at the market.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 19 años, es soltera y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en casa de sus padres, situada en la ciudad de Santa Rosa y lo que más anhela es seguir estudiando y obtener una carrera. Ella se destaca por se una joven muy trabajadora, y eso lo demuestra en el restaurante de su tío, donde recibe una remuneración considerable. Pero su prioridad es estudiar la carrera de agronomía, de esa manera pueda contribuir con los gastos de su familia, pero para ello debe prepararse. Es por ello que trata de esforzarse en su trabajo, ahí refiere sentirse cómoda, pues tiene la oportunidad de socializar con varias personas. Este es será su tercer crédito con MFP y ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos anteriores y espera beneficiarse una vez más conla ayuda de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Con el dinero que solicita, le será de gran utilidad para pagar la matricula de la isntitución donde empezará a estudiar.
texts.en: Nora is 19 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives in her parents' house, situated in the city of Santa Rosa, and her greatest wish is to continue going to school and have a career. She is known for being a very hard-working young woman, and she demonstrates this in her uncle's restaurant, where she receives a good salary. But her priority is to study for a career in agronomy. In this way she can contribute to the family expenses, but to do that she needs to prepare herself. It is for that reason that she tries to exert herself in her work. There, she relates that she feels comfortable, since she has the opportunity to socialize with a number of people. This will be her third loan with MFP, and she has been very punctual in her past payments. She hopes to benefit once more from the help of all of you to reach her goals.  The money that she is applying for will a great help in paying the matriculation fees of the institution where she will begin to study.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in agronomy

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 55 years old and a married woman who has four grown up children. She has operated the school canteen for eight years. She is thankful because her profit increases. Every day she is able to earn about P1,000. With the profit she generates from her business, she is able to improve and buy additional products needed by the children within the school.

Her husband is a private driver. The couple support one another to sustain their needs. Aside from her retailing business, Prescila has also been engaged in a hog raising business. She enjoys her daily routine because this is the main source of income for the family. 

Prescila would like to maintain the school canteen she manages to improve their living conditions. With the profit she generates from her retail shop and the help of her husband, they are able to put up another variety store within their community. 

She would like to continually improve the school canteen she operates through borrowing additional capital in the amount of P30,000. This amount will be used to purchase groceries and school supplies such as paper, bond paper and ballpoint pens for her retail business. She believes that she could make her retail store more profitable through her hard work and patience in dealing with her customers.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and school supplies, such as paper, bond paper and ballpoint pens for her retail business.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel, 35 years old, is married and they are blessed with three children. Rodel has been growing corn for almost 15 years. Last growing season his net income was 42,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. 

Future loans from KIVA would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of his business toward financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos  dos quais 4 frenquentam a Escola. Fez o nivel medio e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus pais enviando dinheiro para dispesas corentes. 

Trabalha no ministerio da Justica afecto no Distrito de Boane ha mais de 13 anos e tem um salario de 7.857.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimo noutros bancos (BIM) distinados para inicio da sua obra e pagou sem dificuldades, mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um colega que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao da sua casa (janelas, vidros, cimento, tinta areia, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua obra.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Anselmo was born in the city of Maputo, located in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom attend school.  He attended school through high school but stopped due to a lack of financial resources.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he also supports his parents by sending them money for expenses.  

He has worked in the Ministry of Justice in the Boane District for more than 13 years and has a salary of 7.857.00mt monthly, which he uses for household expenses and saves a bit in his bank account (BIM).

He previously had a loan in other banks (BIM) which he used to start construction and he paid it without any difficulty.  Later he learned about Hluvuku through a colleague who is also a client.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction materials for his home (window frames, panes, cement, textured paint, beams, etc.) in order to continue construction.  He promises to make payments on time.  In the future he plans to finish his home and will request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build his home (windows, panes, cement, textured paint, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La socia  Justina continua administrando su negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, la socia ha crecido mucho y tiene sus clientes frecuentes y en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de materiales como arena, cemento, cascajo, entre otors para implementar su negocio y mejorar sus ventas ella desearia crecer aun mas y poder ser mayorista esto le daria mas desarrollo economico y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Justina continues to manage her business of selling construction materials. She has grown tremendously and has frequent customers. On this occasion, she wants to invest a loan in the purchase of materials such as sand, cement, gravel, and other products so that she can keep her business in operation and improve her sales.

Justina wants to grow even more so that she can become a wholesaler. This will help her to develop financially and provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, and other products.

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
En su humilde casa ubicada al oriente de Medellín en el municipio de Marinilla, el señor John Fredy tiene su propio cultivo de frijol y pimentón. El señor John aprendió de su padre la labor de ser agricultor y desde hace mas de diez años todas las tardes luego de llegar de su trabajo alterno en un cultivo de flores, el señor John se dedica a las labores de la agricultura.
Debido a la ola invernal, el señor John necesita reforzar su cultivo con abonos y riegos que le permitan seguir creciendo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y pequeños hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad.
A sus 30 años de edad y con la mentalidad emprendedora que lo caracteriza, John ve a su negocio con un futuro prospero que le permita generar empleos directos en su municipio.
texts.en:
At his humble home, located to the east of Medellín in the municipality of Marinilla, señor John Fredy has his own field where he grows beans and chili peppers. John learned farming from his father. For more than ten years he has worked in his field every afternoon after returning from his job at a flower farm.

Due to a cold spell, John needs to restore his field with fertilizers and irrigation that will permit him to continue raising his crops and in this way generate greater income and improve the quality of life for his wife and his two small children, ages 8 and 3. At 30 years of age with a characteristic enterprising attitude, John sees a prosperous future for his business which will allow him continuous employment in his community.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural resources such as fertilizer and irrigation.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, con muchos deseos de progresar, es conviviente con Max, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hijos gemelos de 6 años de edad, vive en compañía de sus padres, instalados cómodamente en la casa de sus padres. El negocio que tiene Lilia es la venta de jugos de frutas naturales que lo realiza por las mañanas hasta las 10:00am. Además de vender gaseosa durante todo el  día, ayua a suegra en el cuidado de la casa. Por otro lado, también trabaja como personal de limpieza en un motel hospedaje desde las 11:00am, logrando así tener barios ingresos e económicos. Le gusta sentirse ocupada y productiva, además de tener dinero para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de agente de seguridad, muchas veces no le alcanzaba, ahora teniendo muchas ganas de ahorrar para poder comprar su propia casa y abrir en ella una bodega de venta de abarrotes. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores.  Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas en mayor variedad para surtir su negocio, así como también de gaseosas, para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en: Lilia, who is 35 years old, is a hard-working and dynamic woman with a great desire to advance. She lives with Max, and they have 6-year-old twins.She lives with his parents, comfortably settled in their house. Lilia's business is selling natural fruit juices, an activity that she carries out in the mornings until 10 am. In addition to selling soft drinks during the entire day, she helps her mother-in-law take care of the house. Furthermore, she works as a  cleaning person in a motel from 11 am on, thus managing to have a variety of sources of income. She likes to be busy and productive, in addition to having money to help her partner with the expenses of their children, since his salary as a security guard often doesn't go far enough. Now she has a great desire to save to be able to buy their own house and open a little grocery store in it. This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and for that reason she awaits their collaboration to be able to continue with her objectives. On the other hand, she promises to make her loan payments as she did with her previous loans. In addition, she feels comfortable with her community bank, since she considers the other members to be responsible and united. She will invest the 2000 PEN that she is applying for in the purchase of a greater variety of candies to stock her business, as well as soft drinks, to thus have better profit margins.

loans.use: to buy candies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has eight children.
 
Concepcion has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Concepcion has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and married. To earn a living, he does shoe repairs. He has employed one person in his business. John has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

John has requested for a loan of 85,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoe soles and leather for repairing shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoe soles and leather.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 26 year old woman. She lives with her husband and three children. Two of her children study in school while her youngest one is not in school yet. 
Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He has been driving his rickshaw for over 12 years. He provides transport services to passengers by dropping them at their designated places. He is a very good driver. He is very honest and fair and charges his passengers by distance traveled.
She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will repair the engine of his rickshaw because it is causing problems for him while driving. If it doesn’t get repaired soon there is a chance it will get seized. 
Shahnaz is quite hopeful that on time financial support will prove beneficial to her husband’s business and allow him to continue working.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw engine

loans.name: Awaot

texts.en: Awaot is 35 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling food from a stall located in Bor, South Sudan. She is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy sugar and oil to sell to her customers. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar and oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jeffa

texts.en:
Jeffa is 29 years old. He is married and he lives in his own house  in the district of Kwale, Coast Province in the town of Tiribe. Jeffa runs a barber shop. He has about 12 years of experience. His shop is located along the busy street that leads to the market, in a place that has been specifically equipped for his activity: he has no immediate competition in the area and the shop is strategically located. 

Thanks to the money he earns from his barber shop, he is able to pay for his family’s expenses.

Jeffa wants to buy supplies, such as shampoo, for his barber shop, and to buy a new shaving machine. For this reason he has asked for a loan of KES30,000, in order to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as shampoo, for his barber shop, and to buy a new shaving machine.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine  is married and the mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She also cares for her younger brother, and earns a living by selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for half a year and is requesting a loan for 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. This is her sole source of income, and she works six days a week selling retail in a local market. Her major challenges include the seasonal nature of her business and thieves. Her goals for the future are to become a wholesaler and earn enough money to buy a plot of land on which she can build a house. She currently lives in her family's home and has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding her family and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Âgée de 35 ans, Colette n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Colette est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Martin. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Colette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Pour cette raison, Colette vend du gâteau à son domicile depuis quatorze ans. De façon secondaire, Colette vend aussi du riz et de l'huile végétale ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Colette s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Colette devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Colette sollicite pour la huitième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is a very active lady of 29 years from Koraput district, Odisha. She is a responsible mother of a school going son, studying in class 3. Manju's husband runs a grocery shop in their locality. He purchases varieties of grocery items and products of daily use from the wholesale market and sells them in his small shop. He sells items like rice, sugar, oil, eggs, bread, biscuits, detergent etc, in his grocery shop. Manju also assists her husband in this business after managing her household activities.

Now, Manju and her husband aim to expand their business to obtain better income and to attract more customers. Thus, she applies for a loan of 35,000 INR. The objective for her loan is to invest in buying more grocery items, so that she can give financial support to her family and provide better education to her son.

loans.use: to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, soaps and detergents in bulk to resell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old and lives in Monterrey. She was born in San Luis Potosi, which is in the center of Mexico. Teresa is married and her husband constantly works away from the city due to his job. She has five children. Two of them live in United States and the other ones live in Monterrey. Her smaller son Abraham is 19 years old, works with her assisting the clients but he would like to continue studying to find a good employment. She began her business with her bigger son\'s help, who gave her the initial capital and little by little Teresa has gone growing. She has a internet cafe and every day her business has been growing.

She requests a loan of $475 USD to the maintenance and remodeling of her internet cafe, Teresa hopes with this loan her business will be bigger and better, because she will have a better image and more attraction of her clients. In a term of 5 months she plans to return the loan.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Teresa tiene 32 años de vivir en Monterrey, nació en San Luis Potosí la cual se encuentra en el centro de México. Doña Teresa es casada, su esposo constantemente esta fuera de la ciudad debido a su trabajo y es madre de cinco hijos. Dos de ellos viven en Estados Unidos y los otros tres en Monterrey. Su hijo menor Abraham de 19 años, trabaja con ella atendiendo a los clientes pero le gustaría seguir estudiando para encontrar un buen empleo. Ella comenzó su negocio con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, quien puso el capital inicial y poco a poco Teresa ha ido creciendo.

Solicita un crédito de $475 USD para el mantenimiento y remodelación de su local, Doña Teresa espera que con este préstamo su negocio se beneficiara porque tendrá una mejor imagen y de esta forma atraerá más clientes. En un término de 5 meses ella planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Maintenance and remodeling of her cyber coffee

loans.name: Do

texts.en:
Do lives with her niece and nephew, who have one son who is 11 years old. She helps to support the family by running a small business. She does not have a stall, and hangs the few items for sale on the frontdoor and puts the rest on a chair.

This is one of the poorest households in the village, and they live on only $6/person/month. The local authorities have given them a small house.

Do has run her very small business for the last 5 years. She is requesting a loan of $50 which will increase her sales and income.

loans.use: Small retail shop selling school books.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 36 years old and the mother of three children, ages 7, 13, and 15. She is married, and her husband Alvaro left to work in the United States four years ago. The family has had difficult moments because he didn't find any work, and in order to obtain the necessary resources to support the children and pay their school fees, Sandra decided to start her own business selling clothes. She started out selling used clothes in her living room. Later she was able to also get new clothing and sell it in the open-air markets near her home.

Fortunately, sales and orders from clients have increased. In order to meet the demand for her products, Sandra needs a loan in the amount of $475, which she promises to return over a period of 4 to 8 months. You can improve the conditions of this family's life. The are grateful for your generosity and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Sandra tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos de 7, 13 y 15 años de edad, es casada y su esposo Álvaro se fue a trabajar a Estados Unidos hace cuatro años, la familia pasó momentos difíciles porque él no encontraba un trabajo y para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostén de sus hijos y solventar los gastos de la escuela, Sandra decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, empezó vendiendo ropa usada en la sala de su casa, después logró conseguir también ropa nueva y venderla en los mercados que están cerca de su hogar.

Afortunadamente las ventas se han incrementado y los pedidos de sus clientes, para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos, Sandra necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475, mismos que se compromete a retornar en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her charcoal selling business

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
"I have unfinished construction and I need to build another room as welll as put up a fence for protection. It has been a little difficult for me due to the lack of money, but I am working a lot to earn it and increase my quality of life." I am requesting $1000 to make another room and build a protective fence.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar y necesito hacer otro cuarto así como poner una barda y las protecciones, me ha sido un poco difícil por falta de dinero pero estoy trabajando mucho para lograrlo y ampliar más mi vivienda” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para hacer otro cuarto, poner una barda y protecciones,.

loans.use: Construct a room and a security fence.

loans.name: Zaida Marcelo

texts.pt:
Zaida is a single mother of three children. The eldest is on the second grade while the other two have not reached the minimum required age yet. She will enroll them as soon as they do. She wants to use the money to purchase vaccines and feed for her chickens. She foresees appplying the profits to build a house for herself and her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Zaida e mae solteira. Ela tem 3 filhos. O mais velho estuda na segunda classe, enquanto os dois mais novos ainda nao tem idade para ir a escola. mas logo que les atinjam idade escolar ela os ira matricular. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de vacinas e racao para os frangos. Com os rendimentos ela pensa investir na construcao de uma casa para ela e para os seus filhos. .

loans.use: Zaida wants to use the money to purchase vaccines and feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj was born in 1983. She is single and lives in Khachmaz region, in the village of Hulovlu. She has sold mincing machines, electric irons, perfumery, etc. for 6 years at retail. Now she needs a loan of $950 to buy goods for improving her business.

loans.use: Buy goods

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en:
I am Rasheeda M. N.. My husband trades vegetables in a local vegetables market. I am a mother of seven: four boys and three girls. Three of my kids are married and live separately. My husband and I both desire our kids to complete their education and hence polish their futures. I embroider and sell clothes at my house for my neighborhood women. My husband last year took a loan for his vegetables business and made decent profits. This year he again needs a loan. He has a nine years experience in this field.

I am a group leader for a few other women and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans. Akhter B. needs a loan to buy a cow. Halima B. requires a loan for their grocery store. Rizwana B. also needs a loan for their grocery store. Nagina B. will invest the loan to improve her clothing sales business. These women are my neighbors and are very honest and responsible.

loans.use: Expand vegetables business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in baking ingredients and also complimentary goods he sells

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Mrs. Puth M., 59, raises pigs and sells porridge, earning approximately three dollars a day. Her husband is a garment worker and earns about three dollars a day. They have seven children, two of whom are employed by a garment factory earning two dollars each per day.

With this loan she will purchase more pigs to increase the number that she can breed and sell. She will also purchase a motorbike to deliver her porridge and help her husband and daughters commute to work. This will save expenses because the cost to hire a motor-taxi for the children to get to work each day is quite expensive .

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for breeding and purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em H., 34, earns about $4.33 per day selling second-hand clothes at the Baray Market. Her husband, Lim Pailen, is a journalist and earns $2.66 per day. They live with their three children in Or Suosdey Village, Kampong Thom Province.

Mrs. H. seeks an $800 loan to increase her stock of second-hand clothes, as well as to purchase pigs to raise. She hopes this loan will help further her children’s education. In the photo, the woman is Mrs. Em H..

loans.use: To increase her stock of second-hand clothes and to purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase yarn for traditional weavings, resell traditional and American-style clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tools to construct more rooms and decorate existing rooms

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane E. is 46-years-old and is married with six children. She lives in Benin City with her family where she runs a hardware store. She worked in this field for two years and started her own business in 2002. Jane is asking for a loan to buy more building materials and hardware products  for her store. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more building materials and hardware products for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL Andina.

Isabel lives in the community of Ninachiri, in the sector of Laja, in the province of Los Andes (3 hours away from La Paz).

Her husband, Basilio Huanca, is a farmer. Together, they have six children (ages 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12).

This is the first loan Isabel requests to Impro; she will use it to buy more cattle. The loan evaluation that was realized, qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, es así que produce leche, la cuál es vendida específicamente a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Isabel vive en la comunidad Ninachiri, sector Laja de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz (ubicada a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz.), tiene un esposo (Basilio Huanca, agricultor) y seis hijos de 6 hijos de 12, 10, 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad respectivamente.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro (el monto será destinado para la compra de ganado), la evaluación realizada califica favorablemente su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cattle and produce more milk

loans.name: Chin Thi

texts.vi: Năm 1994 chị Chín tham gia  Quỹ Tình Thương và được vay 300.000 đồng.  Với số vốn này  chị đã đầu tư mua được 100 con gà và ngan về chăn nuôi. Vạn sự khởi đầu nan, từ 100 con gia cầm ban đầu đó sau 6 tháng anh chị đã thu được cả gốc lẫn lãi 2.800.000 đồng, thấy hiệu quả kinh tế cao anh chị lại tiếp tục vay thêm vốn mua gà, ngan với số lượng nhiều hơn, chăn nuôi ngày một phát triển, kinh tế gia đình ngày càng ổn định. Anh Tiến chồng chị là một người đàn ông  tháo vát tính toán làm ăn giỏi, chịu khó học hỏi kinh  nghiệm làm ăn, với số tiền tiết kiệm của gia đình và nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ, năm 2001 anh chị mạnh dạn chuyển đổi đất làm ruộng sang làm kinh tế theo mô hình trang trại để chăn nuôi lợn, gà , vịt, làm cây cảnh. Hiện trang trại của chị có hàng ngàn con gia cầm và hàng trăm loại cây cảnh có giá trị cao, riêng loại cau vua có hơn 100 cây. Ngoài ra chị còn trồng các loại rau quả cung cấp cho nhân dân trong vùng. Hàng tháng thu nhập từ trang trại của gia đình chị từ 5-7 triệu đồng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào trang trại.
texts.en:
In 1994, Mrs. Chin joined the TYM fund and borrowed 300,000 Vietnamese Dong. She used this money to buy 100 poultries to raise. 6 months later, she made a profit of 2800 Vietnamese Dong. Acknowledging the high return, the couple kept borrowing money and bought poultry in larger numbers. The business flourished, and the family’s financial situation gradually became stable. Mr. Tien, her husband, is a skillful and curious man. He spent time studying business. In 2001, when the family’s savings had accumulated, the couple started to build a modern farm on their old fields. They raised chickens, ducks, and pigs. They also planted bonsai. Soon enough, there were thousands of poultries on the farm and hundreds of valuable bonsai. A select 100 of these bonsai were of the Cau Vua type, a particularly valuable tree in Vietnam. They also planted vegetables to deliver to the local market. The family’s income is from 5,000,000 to 7,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to make the next loan of 19,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in the new farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investing in farming

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame O. B. Mariam est née le 31 décembre 1966 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle s’est mariée à un pauvre mécanicien et est mère de 6 enfants. Presque la totalité de la charge de la famille repose sur elle seule d’autant plus que son mari a un revenu irrégulier. Elle a pour activité principale la restauration du riz dans son quartier. Elle a commencée cette activité depuis l’année 2002 et tire un revenu acceptable. Elle accueille beaucoup de consommateurs et leur rend un bon service.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de riz et 6 bidons d’huile végétale.
texts.en:
Mariam O. B. was born December 31, 1966 in Sokodé in central Togo. She is married to a struggling mechanic and is the mother of six children. Mariam is nearly the sole support of her family since her husband cannot count on a regular paycheck. Her primary field of endeavor is the supply of rice to her neighborhood. She began this business in 2002 and earns an adequate income providing good service to her many customers. This, the first loan she has requested, would permit her to buy ten sacks of rice and six drums of vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and vegetable oil

loans.name: Zenelia

texts.es: Zenelia  es una mujer emprendedora, humilde, trabajadora, y muy responsable con los créditos que se le han otorgado; tiene 2 hijos que estudian la educación primaria.  Tiene un pequeño negocio de pulperia, el cual le brinda los ingresos con los cuales mantiene los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijitos,  cuenta con el apoyo del papá de los niños; actualmente solicita su crédito para comprar productos como granos básicos que son los que mayor rotación presentan y reforzar el inventario del mismo, y de esta manera seguir trabajando para lograr que sus hijos puedan continuar con sus estudios y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Zenelia is an enterprising, humble, and hardworking woman; she has been very responsible with the previous loans that she has been granted. She has two children who study in primary school. She has a small local store, which offers her an income to keep up with the household costs and study costs of her little children. She works with the support of the father of the children. Presently she is requesting a loan to buy products like basic grains, which are always sold and need restocked, and to increase her present inventory. In this manner she will continue working to ensure that her children can continue their studies and be someone in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and increase the inventory of her local store.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista tiene 23 años, es conviviente vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, viven en la casa de sus padres. Se levanta a las 4.00am para prepara el desayuno, a las 8.00am ya está listo el almuerzo, de ahí tiene que irse a la chacra a unos 4 kilómetros de su pueblo, es por ello que madruga, desde niña realizó esta actividad, y ya se acostumbró, y le es rentable, dice que para la chacra hay que dedicarse a tiempo completo para que produzca muy bien, de ahí cotiza sus productos en el mercado a un buen precio. La dificultad en la chacra es cuando las diversas enfermedades atacan a las plantas, para evitar ello tiene utilizar preventivos y fumigar cuanto antes para tener una buena cosecha. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará los productos llamados Ditani y Atoc para fumigar cada 8 días, se usa de 2 a 3 cucharadas para cada litro, esta inversión será un aproximado de S/. 850.00.
texts.en:
Evarista is 23 years old, lives with her partner and 2 sons in her parents home. Evarista wakes up at 4am everyday to prepare breakfast, and by 8am lunch is ready. By that time she has to go to the small farm about 4km from her town. That is why she wakes up so early. She has been doing this work since she was young, so she is used to it. The farm work she does is profitable. Evarista says that working on a farm you have to work full time so that the farm produces well. She is then able to sell her products in the market at a good price. The difficulty of the farm is all the different illnesses that affect the plants. To avoid these illnesses she has to take several precautions and fumigate in advance, to ensure a good harvest. This is Evarista's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money from the loan she will buy the products (named Ditani and Atoc) to fumigate her farm. She has to use these products every 8 days, using 2-3 spoonfuls for every liter. The investment needed for these fumigation materials is 850 soles

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Staff Member

loans.use: Purchase of insecticide for her farm

loans.name: Marcos  Roberto

texts.es: Sr. Marcos tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua  llamado Villa Sur, casado, su esposa es promotora de venta, tiene un hijo de 7 años que esta  estudiando. Los planes que tiene para su familia es asegúrales un patrimonio mejor para su esposa y hijos. Don marcos se desempeña como taxista desde hace diez años, abecés la ruta esta mala y andamos por toda la ciudad buscando cliente, los días buenos son los días de pago,  sus objetivos económico es comprar otra unidad de taxi, aumentar sus ingresos, aspirando a un mejor trabajo y seguir con el progreso de su vivienda, en estos momentos necesita comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques .hierro  hacer su casa de concreto ya que la que tiene es de tabla  y esta en mal estado  y insegura Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra que su casa este segura y sus familia protegida. Para nuestra empresa  es importante el desarrollo de nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Marcos is 42 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Villa Sur in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is married, and his wife is a product demonstrator. He has a son who is 7 years old and in school. His goal for his family is to assure his wife and children a better heritage. Don Marcos has held a position as a taxi driver for ten years, although sometimes the route is bad and he walks through all of the city looking for clients. The good days are paydays. His economic objectives are to purchase another taxi car, augment his salary, and aspire to a better job in order to continue the progress in remodeling his house. To do this he needs to buy construction materials like cement, blocks, and iron to re-make his house out of concrete, since his house is currently made of wood and is in bad shape and insecure. Thanks to loans from Afodenic, a partner of Kiva, he will obtain a secure house and a protected family. For business the development of clients is important.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer su casa de concreto

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide E. is married and has no children. The highest level of education she has received is senior high. 

Adelaide sells pharmaceutical drugs in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. She uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses. Adelaide will use the loan to buy more and better quality drugs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adelaide will save towards a building a house with her husband for the family.

loans.use: to buy more and better quality drugs for resale

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil A. is 52 years old and is a married man with four adorable children. As an aspiring and hard-working man, he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he chose livestock breeding, he decided to become a successful businessman one day. He has been engaged in this business since a very young age, because his father was a farmer, too.

Being a school teacher, Kamil was receiving a very low salary and this pushed him to start his own business. He saw a new business opportunity: rearing calves, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. With this loan, Kamil will purchase calves and feed for them to expand his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Lazaró René

texts.es: Lázaro René C. R. reside junto a esposa y sus pequeños hijos en San martín. El tiene su propio negocio el cuál consiste en la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en los diferentes mercados y plazas de San Martín, a pesar que su mayor ganancia la obtiene de esta manera, también sabe vender por pedidos previamente realizados. Es por ello que el deseo de Lázaro René, es de obtener un préstamo a través del cuál pueda ser capaz de comprar más telas de diferentes colores de manera que tenga la capacidad de aumentar sus ventas y poder brindarles un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lázaro René C. R. lives together with his wife and young children in San Martín. He has his own business selling clothing on a roaming basis in the different markets and plazas of San Martín. Although this is his main source of income, he also makes sales based on previous orders. It is for this reason that Lázaro René wishes to obtain a loan to purchase more fabric in different colors, and thus have the capacity to increase his sales and offer his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fabric to increase the production of his business

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Курбонова Раджабгуль проживает в районе Джилликуль. Возраст 42 года , замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Уже пять лет работает в сфере торговли. Имеет магазин , который находится рядом с ее домом . Торгует продуктами питания. Хочет расширить бизнес , путем ввоза нового ассортимента товара. Это даст возможность больше заработать. Для этого он планирует получить кредит. Погасить его он сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabgul Q. lives in the Djillikul region. She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has been working in trade for the last 5 years. She owns a grocery store that is located close to her house. She would like to expand her business by purchasing additional inventory. This will give her an opportunity to increase her income. To accomplish this, she would like to obtain a loan, which she plans to pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty S., 25, and his wife, Sovanary Khan, 29, were married in 2002 and have two sons who are syoung. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Ty has been selling sandwiches on baguettes in his village for five years. His wife is a garment factory worker. The couple also grows rice. Ty’s is requesting a loan of $200 to repair his house.

loans.use: Repair his house.

loans.name: Masae

texts.en: Masae M., 28, is married and has 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the grocery business. She sells to the village community & to the general public. She has had 7 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Samoan Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Masae’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a box of noodles, soy sauce, box of herring, toilet rolls, twisties, lollies, beverages and laundry powder.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una trabajadora madre de familia, el esfuerzo que realiza está basado en las ganas de progresar y educar a sus hijos, a quienes siempre  trata de cuidar y proteger. Hace 10 años que es comerciante, su principal actividad es la compra y venta de verduras en el mercado que está situado cerca de su casa, pero para conseguir sus productos tiene que salir de madrugada al mercado central de la ciudad donde los venden a costos más bajos y al por mayor. Nancy abre su puesto a partir de las 6 de la mañana hasta el medio día, horas de arduo trabajo, pues hay gran demanda y nota que le es necesario conseguir un ayudante para atender a sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y espera acoplarse rápidamente a su grupo, el cual viene trabajando hace más de 5 años en la institución. Los 1000 soles que solicita son para la compra de mercadería y la mejor ambientación de su puesto.
texts.en:
Nancy is a working mother; she works in order to progress personally and educate, care for and protect her children. Over 10 years as a businesswoman, her primary activity has been buying and selling vegetables in the market near her house. In order to buy her products she must leave the house at dawn for the city's central market, where they are sold wholesale and for the lowest prices. Nancy opens shop at 6:00 AM and works hard until noon. Due to high demand she has realized that it is necessary to hire a helper to attend to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes to settle in quickly with her loan group, who have worked for 5 years with the institution. The 1000-sole loan will go toward purchasing merchandise and improving the setup of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to increase sales

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea M. is in the business of selling beer. She is requesting a loan to buy more beer to sell.

She is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a security guard. She has two children who go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Andrea hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

----------------------------------- BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.es:
Filiberto es casado tiene 62 años  tres hijos de 34, 32 y 17 años que esta terminando sus estudios en la escuela estatal.
Filiberto estudio tecnología educativa y aprendió hacer materiales didácticos juegos lúdicos  para los escolares, le gustaba y vio que era rentable y se dedico a  vender Juegos lúdicos y vende libros.  
Desde que Filiberto esta en Finca aprendió a ser puntual, por que el es un trabajador independiente, y no tiene horario  fijo.  
Filiberto necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de material educativo, libros de psicología y terapia
El sueño de Filiberto es poder distribuir material didáctico en el ámbito nacional.
texts.en:
Filiberto is married, 62 years old, and the father of three children ages: 34, 32, and 17. His 17 year old is finishing up his high school studies. Filiberto studied pedagogy and learned how to create fun, educational games for school children. He liked doing this and saw that it was profitable, so he began to sell diversionary games and books. Since Filiberto has been with Finca, he has learned to be on time because working for himself he does not have a regular schedule. Filiberto needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy educational materials, and books on psychology and therapy. His dream is to be able to distribute his educational materials on a national level.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ra de material educativo, libros de psicología y terapia

loans.name: Bien Fait Plus Group

texts.fr: Katshaya L. vend des pièces de rechange automobile au sud-ouest de Kinshasa. A côté de la vente, il a aussi des champs de manioc qui produisent du manioc qu’il vend à Kinshasa. Il a débuté ses activités respectivement en 2002 et en 2005 avec un capital initial de $50. De 2002 – 2008, l’augmentation du stock de ses marchandises ainsi que leur valeur, ont démontré la prospérité de l’affaire.  En juillet 2008, Katshaya a décidé de joindre un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Bien fait » dans le but de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un magasin des pièces de rechange automobile à Kinshasa et de devenir fournisseur. Il a reçu trois fois les prêts de Hope qu’il a remboursé correctement. Le prochain crédit lui permettra d’acheter des boutures de manioc (high bread seeds) en vue de produire une grande quantité de manioc sollicité par beaucoup de gens dans son quartier. Katshaya est âgé de 46 ans, marié et père de cinq enfants âgés de 4 à 25 ans dont le plus âgé est indépendant. Les quatre autres vivent avec lui et deux seulement étudient à l’école primaire.
texts.en:
Katshaya L. sells auto parts to the southwest of Kinshasa. Along with this activity, he also has a field which produces cassava that he sells in Kinshasa. He began these businesses in 2002 and 2005 respectively with an initial capital of $50. From 2002-2008 his stock levels increased, as did the value of the merchandise, demonstrating the business’s profitability. In July 2008 Katshaya decided to join one of the groups of Hope RDC called “Bien Fait,” with the aim of achieving his dream of one day opening an auto parts store in Kinshasa and becoming a supplier. He received three loans from Hope which he repaid as required. The next loan will enable him to buy hybrid cassava seeds to produce large quantities of cassava, which is requested by many people in his neighborhood. Katshaya is 46 years old, married and the father of five children aged between four and 25, the eldest of whom is independent. The four others live with Katshaya and two are at primary school.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cassava cuttings with a view to producing cassava in volume to then sell

loans.name: Assanansio's Group

texts.en: Assanansio K. is the leader of the Mpara group in Mubende. She is 32 years old and married with 6 children, ages 12 to 2, and she cares for 2 dependents. She has had a business of selling clothes from the daily markets of Mubende and Mityana for over 10 years now, and she wishes for her business to grow much stronger. She hopes to buy a car and start a hire service so as to reap big rewards. Assanansio needs to buy more clothes with the loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha dedicates herself to a variety of different business ventures. She and her husband have a spare parts shop for motorbikes and motorcycle taxis in the city of Pucallpa. Martha also has a shop in the distant town of Contamana. Finally, she sells shoes. She plans to use this loan of 2500 soles to buy Brazilian shoes for sale. Martha’s shoe sales business has been doing very well.  

Martha is 41 years old and married with three children. Martha has been working with Kiva's partner, Manuela Ramos, for about four years and belongs to the communal bank “Las Colinas” (The Hills). With the help of her loans, Martha has been able to get ahead in her own business and support the family’s spare parts shop. Martha’s goals are to eventually have her own shoe store and to help her children get a good education.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Kathya De La Cruz

texts.es: Kathya de 29 años de edad es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive junto a su mamá, quien le dio un pequeño terreno para construir un cuarto el cual tiene bien acondicionado, repellado y el techo con perlines gracias a los creditos que AFODENIC le ha brindado, actualmente esta solicitando su 4to credito para continuar mejorando su cuarto pintandolo, reparando el baño y los perlines que no quedaron bien ajustados y cuando llueve se le moja un poco.  El mayor sueño de Kathya es poder tener su cuarto con lo necesario para cuando ella se case y tenga sus hijos ofrecerles una vida digna.

loans.use: Pintar su cuarto, reparar el baño y perlines

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: Patrice A. est un jeune homme de 30 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il tient depuis 4 ans un magasin d’alimentation général à Kpele Konda, un village d’environ 160 kilomètres de la capitale du Togo, Lomé. Patrice désire avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son entreprise et par conséquent augmenter ses revenus pour un meilleur devenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Patrice A. is a young man aged 30, married and the father of three children. He has run a grocery store for four years in the village of Kpele Konda, located about 160 kilometers from Lomé, the capital city of Togo. Patrice wants to use this loan to expand his business and thus increase his income and offer his family a better future.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Janechit

texts.en: Janechit R. is one of PMPC's micro entrepreneurs who prepares and processes a Filipino food delicacy known as longanisa, a meat processed viand which is usually served for breakfast. She is a resident of Catadman, city of Ozamiz, and married with two school-age children. In this business, she earns an income of 1,600 pesos a month. Last August, 2009, Mrs. R. joined PMPC because she likes their programs and the services PMPC offered to her. Right now, she is applying for her first loan of 5,000 to use as additional capital to purchase more ingredients and meat for her longanisa processing. Her future plan for her family is to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and meat for longanisa processing

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
The Promise Group is a group of three borrowers led by Johnson A.. He is 50 years old and married with six children, who are aged 11-34 years old and whose educational levels range from 5th grade to university senior.  He is a 10th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. Johnson and his family live in the V.M.H.S. community in downtown Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Johnson's business is pit sawing. He saws logs, cuts them into timber and sells them in the Voinjama main market. He has been running this business for nine years and hopes to improve it by establishing a wood workshop. With hard work and commitment, he believes he can reach that goal.

John has been facing some financial difficulties with his business but because he sells good timber to customers, they are always encouraged to continue buying from him, which makes his business go forward. He needs this loan in order to purchase sawing materials like gasoline, engine oil, etc., to improve business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase sawing materials like gasoline, engine oil, etc., to improve business

loans.name: Djiguifa Group

texts.fr:
Djiguifa est un regroupement de femmes toutes mariées, vivant majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, 3 enfants et habitent  le quartier Djaka (Kirango) de Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, d’amitié et exercent la même  activité génératrice de revenus à savoir l’achat vente du poisson sous ses diverses formes (frais, séché, fumé, frit etc.)
Le groupe Djiguifa est à son 5ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les quatre précédents avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 72 paniers de poisson frais et 100 barres  de glace (fournies par les transporteurs venant de Bamako). Elles s’approvisionnent  en poisson frais sur place au bord du fleuve Niger. Tandis qu’une bonne partie de ce poisson est séchée soit sur du gravier soit sur de la paille ou sur des « seccos », l’autre partie est vendue sous toutes les formes: les poissons frais se vendent sur place à Kirango et à Diamarabougou Markala, le frais  conservé dans de la glace se vend à Ségou (au marché château) et Bamako, le poisson séché dont une partie est conservée jusqu’à la décrue et à l’hivernage où elles gagnent plus d’argent  est surtout vendu à Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango, Boussin et à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou, le poisson fumé est essentiellement vendu à Ségou. Les ventes se font généralement au comptant, sur place au bord du fleuve, aux marchés de Kirango et de Diamarabougou (Markala) ou en ambulant à travers les quartiers du village à une  clientes diverse et variée.
Elles estiment pouvoir réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 60.100 FCFA qui servira à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux et à participer aux évènements sociaux. 
Leur ambition est  d’acheter des animaux afin de construire dans l’avenir pour soi et pour les enfants car une maison paternelle appartient à tous et n’est propriété de personne.
texts.en:
Djiguifa is an association of women who are all married and in large traditional families.  The women average 31 years of age and 3 children each living in the Djaka district (Kirango) of Markala (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and friendship, and they operate in the same revenue-generating business, namely the buying and selling fish in all its various forms (fresh, dried, smoked, fried, etc.) The group members are on their fifth solidarity loan after having repaid the four previous ones with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  They intend to use this new loan to buy 72 baskets of fresh fish and 100 bars of ice (furnished by transporters coming from Bamako).  Supplies of fresh fish are gotten locally on the banks of the Niger River.  While a good portion of this fish is dried (whether on gravel or on straw or on seccos), the other portion is sold in any of its forms:  The fresh fish is sold locally in Kirango and in Diamarabougou Markala. The fresh fish kept on ice is sold in Ségou (at the Château Market) and Bamako.  The dried fish (part of which is reserved until the waters recede and until the off-season when the women earn more money) is sold especially in Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango, Boussin, and at the weekly fair of Ségou.  The smoked fish is essentially sold in Ségou.   Sales are made generally in cash to a diversity of customers locally along the river, at the marketplaces of Kirango and Diamarabougou (Markala), or door-to-door through the districts of the village. The group members think they'll be able to realize an average monthly profit of 60,100 francs CFA that will be used to cover sundry family needs and to assist with societal events.  Their ambition is to buy animals in order to build a future for themselves and their children, since a paternal home belongs to everyone but is not the property of anyone.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
One of Cherry's guiding beliefs is that only through sacrifice can one find success in life. Cherry is a industrious wife and mother. She is married and she and her husband Mario are blessed with three children, two of whom are married and have families of their own. Jacky, their 23 year old daughter and a high school graduate, is still single.

Cherry sells cosmetics in the village and also raises hogs and owns a fish pond. She is thankful because her business is improving but she would like it to grow further to help her youngest child. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase cosmetics, products to increase the productivity of her fish pond, and food for her hogs. Cherry hopes that her businesses will be profitable.

loans.use: Merchandise for her business, food for her hogs, products for her fish pond

loans.name: Ailina Julia

texts.pt:
Ailina Júlia Parkin nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, tem 26 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 3 e 1 anos de idade. Continua estudando a 12ª classe. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos, e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane em casa dos pais e trabalha como caixa nas bombas de combustível da GALP na vila de Boane há Maios de 3 anos. Esta actividade aprendeu a 5 anos, num posto de abastecimento de combustível PETROMOC. Faz cerca de 14 horas de tempo de trabalho por dia e tem um salário mensal de 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no banco comercial BCI.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar materiais de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior também foi no valor de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
 Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua obra e ainda construir um murro de vedação.
texts.en:
Ailina Júlia Parkin was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of Maputo. She is 26 years old and is a single mother of her 2 children, ages 3 and 1. She continued her studies through the 12th grade. She lives in her own home with her children and does not support anyone else. She left Maputo for the city of Boane with her parents. She has worked pumping gas at a GALP gas station in Boane for the past three years. She learned this job five years ago while working at a PETROMOC gas station. She works about 14 hours a day and earns a monthly salary of 3.000.00mt that she uses to pay her househould expenses and saves a small amount in the commercial bank BCI. She has never had loans with other banks and she found out about Hluvuku through friends that are also Hluvuku clients. This is her second loan for 15.000.00mt that she will use to buy construction materials (cement, bricks, sand, and others) to continue working on her project. Her previous loan was for 15.000.00mt that she used for the same purpose. In the future she would like to apply for more loans in order to finish her project and to build a retaining wall.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en:
Modupe is 52 years old and is a widow with seven children. Her youngest child is 18 years old. Modupe is a friendly woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. 

Modupe has a stall where she sells foodstuffs and groceries at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually neighbors, residents and friends. She is requesting a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Modupe is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Astrid Lorena

texts.es: Astrid Lorena P. L. de 20 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su madre y su abuela de 90 años de edad. Astrid trabaja junto a su madre vendiendo pupusas, jugos, café, chocolate y golosinas, en las afueras de La Unidad de salud de Ciudad Arce. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de las pupusas, ingredientes como maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles entre otros, lo cual le permita poder vender mayor productos. Astrid desea poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que de estas depende la estabilidad económica de su hogar, ya que su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
Astrid Lorena P. L., 20, lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her mother and her 90-year-old grandmother. Astrid works with her mother selling pupusas [Salvadoran stuffed dumplings], juice, coffee, chocolate and candy outside the health clinic in Ciudad Arce. She is seeking this loan to buy more ingredients for pupusas, such as corn, rice, cheese, and beans, among others. This will enable her to sell more products. Astrid would like to improve her sales, as the income is necessary for the economic stability of her home. This is their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for pupusas

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita B. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 55 years old. Carmencita is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmencita owns and operates a hog fattening business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Carmencita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $44 a month from this activity.

In 2006, Carmencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carmencita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 45 años, vive acompañada de sus dos hijos Carlos (24) y Gerardo (15) en una casa modesta de un barrio populoso al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde los 22 años trabajó muchísimo, realizó un sin número de oficios con el fin de brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Su meta era crecer y tener un negocio propio, lo cual ha logrado obteniendo un terreno donde construyó  su casa poco a poco, a base de mucho sudor y sacrificio.
Ahora vive de los alquileres de las habitaciones de su casa, eso le ha permitido ser una mujer autosuficiente, por eso sabe que no debe detenerse y proseguir con los acabados respectivos de su vivienda.
Julia está muy orgullosa de lo que ha logrado y ahora quiere construir otros pisos para obtener mayores ganancias con las que pueda pagar los estudios de sus hijos y de ese modo también cumplir otro de sus grandes sueños, que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo cumplida con el pago de sus cuotas. Ella estima mucho a sus compañeras de grupo, pues son personas muy responsables y eso le da seguridad de seguir trabajando con préstamos, ya que para ella éstos son indispensables para su progreso. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará cemento y mayólicas para el acabado de los servicios higiénicos de sus inquilinos, para que de ese modo se sientan más a gusto en su casa.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years of age. She lives with her two sons Charles (24) and Gerardo (15) in a modest house in a populous district south of Lima. From the time she was 22 years of age, she has worked a great deal, and has made countless trades in order to provide the best for her children. Her goal was to grow and have her own business, which has managed to do, as well as built a home gradually, based on a lot of sweat and sacrifice. She now lives in her home and rents some of the rooms, which has allowed her to be self-sufficient. Now, she has come to know that she cannot stop the momentum and needs to continue with the repairs/finishes of her home. Julia is very proud of what she has achieved and now would like to build other apartments for higher profits, which will help her pay for her children's education and realize another one of her big dreams - to see her children become professionals. This is Julia's ninth loan with MFP credit and she promises to remain compliant with the payments of her loan. She finds her other peers (other women entrepreneurs) are also very responsible people, and that gives her a sense of security in continuing her working with loans, since this has become essential for her progress. With the money she is requesting now, she plans to purchase cement and tiles for finishing the toilets in her tenants' flats, so that they can feel more comfortable in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejora de los servicios higiénicos de las habitaciones que alquila (To fix/add finishes to the toilets in the rooms she rents)

loans.name: Sengly

texts.en: R. Sengly, 24, is a garment factory worker, making US$2 each day in the Takeo province. She is married but has no children yet. Her husband, pictured here, sells salt and makes approximately US$3 every day. R. Sengly would like a loan of US$1,000, which her husband needs to purchase a motorbike so that he can transport salt to sell from house to house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for selling salt

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a young hardworking woman. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver in Asaba, Delta State. Her children are excelling in their school.

Mary sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is doing well in her business but her greatest challenge is funds and she hopes to overcome that challenge. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

Mary hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Kanya

texts.en:
Kanya M. is currently in the business of designing and selling bedsheets and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell.  Kanya is 30 years old. Her husband is a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine for designing.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Julio Jose

texts.es: El señor Julio Cáliz tiene 36 años es padre de familia, tiene 3 hijas, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la periferia del poblado, la actividad económica del señor Cáliz es la elaboración de artesanías, realiza la actividad de manera manual. Hace más de 12 años tiene este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y a sus hijos una educación. El señor Julio empezó trabajando como ayudante y luego aprendió a fabricar piezas de barro. El financiamiento es para compra de materia prima y elaborar artículos de barro, para cumplir  sus deseos de tener dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio y dar una estabilidad emocional y económica a su familia.
texts.en:
36-year old Señor Julio Cáliz is the father of three daughters. His home is located on the outskirts of the village. Señor Julio earns his living by making crafts by hand. He has done this work for more than twelve years because he needed to provide a steady income for his family and educate his children. He began working as an assistant and subsequently learned to make pieces out of clay. The loan will be used to buy basic materials for making the clay artifacts. It will allow him to achieve his wish of having enough of his own money to invest and give emotional and economic stability to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao T., 51, is married and lives with two of her children. She works as a farmer in the Siem Reap province typically making US $1 each day, and she is supported by her husband who is a construction worker. Mao T. would like a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ismael's Group

texts.en:
Ismael V. is from the village of Anquiray, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 22 years old. Ismael is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ismael is single. To make a living, Ismael owns & operates a business selling kitchen supplies & products to tourists and local community members. Ismael has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ismael joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ismael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. Ismael is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ismael from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kazinga Development Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
In the village of Kazinga, deep in Kihihi, exists a hardworking B. Benon who has run a rice business in Kihihi town for close to three years. The happily married father of six children has maneuvered through tough times before getting to where he is now; as a matter of fact, determination has brought him this far.

This loan will help Benon to do more research on better qualities of rice and to restock his business in order to match his customers’ demand. With an improved business he will be able to earn more revenue and be able to cover his family's needs including his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his business

loans.name: Mrs. Neth Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 13 people living in Chheu Teal village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Neth U. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for a variety of purposes.  Born in 1969, Neth works at home as a weaver to earn some money to support her family. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are studying in local public school. Her husband, Mr. Sophorll Ouk, is a farmer who owns a small piece of  land upon which he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. Since her business is going well, Neth wants to expand and so is requesting a loan to buy more silk.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La ciudad de Rayanniyoc se encuentra media hora de la ciudad del Cusco y a una hora de la ciudad del Urubamba. Los pobladores de la ciudad de Rayanniyoc se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería.

Saturnina, tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores y la venta de hortalizas y verduras. Ella lleva sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco al mercado de Wanchaq los días jueves y sábados.   

Saturnina pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
