Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales críos como por ejemplo ovejas  que cuestan 150 soles o 180 soles y después los engorda para venderlos en las ferias de las comunidades.  

Saturnina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The city of Rayanniyoc is found a half hour from the city of Cusco, and an hour away from the city of Urubamba. The residents of the city of Rayanniyoc work in agriculture and livestock production. Saturnina, 50, is married and has 3 children. Her main economic activity is raising small animals and selling vegetables and produce. She takes her products to the city of Cusco to the Wanchaq market each Thursday and Saturday. Saturnina belongs to the communal bank "Villa Rayanniyoc," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She has already participated in this communal bank for a number of years, and it is going very well because she is a responsible person who is punctual with her payments. She needs a loan to buy animals to raise such as sheep, which cost 150 to 180 Peruvian soles. Later she fattens them to sell in the markets in the community. Saturnina is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals to raise, for example, sheep

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan T. M. L. is 36 years old. She grows rice and keeps 300 ducks and two cows. She is married with two children. Her husband is a farmer, too. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 dong (VND). She has worked with SEDA since 2006. The last time, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and has completely and punctually repaid this amount. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for ducks and cows.

loans.use: To buy food for ducks and cows

loans.name: Vis

texts.en: Mr. Vis Y. is an old man whose wife appears in the photo. They have been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than four years. They sell fish that they get from their wholesale supplier and other fishermen. The couple currently lives with their five single children. Their other two children are already married and live independently. Vis Y. always uses his old motorcycle to transport the fish to the market to sell. Unfortunately, his motorcycle breaks down frequently, and his income has been affected. To solve the problem, Vis Y. has requested a loan of $500 in order to replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace his old motorcycle.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Alicia tiene 60 años, es una trabajadora mujer, vive en compañía de su esposo, ya que sus hijos son adultos e independientes. Es una mujer muy activa y siempre debe estar realizando alguna actividad productiva, es por ello que tiene dos trabajos, la primera, es la venta de productos de belleza y la segunda, es la venta de comida en el comedor popular de su barrio, en asociación con sus vecinas. Lleva casi 3 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien gracias a su buen trato con las clientas y la gran administración de sus ingresos. Alicia se siente contenta con sus actividades ya que se siente útil y productiva, espera en un futuro consolidar su negocio poniendo un bazar o un restaurante en su propia casa, ya que las dos actividades le encantan y aún no se ha definido por alguna de ellas. Es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser puntual como lo fue en su crédito anterior. El crédito que solicita, lo empleará en la compra de productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock puesto que ya  tiene varios pedidos, con los cuales debe cumplir y además en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Alicia, 60, is a hard-working woman. She and her husband live alone now that their children are grown and independent. Alicia is very active and always working at some money-making activity. That's why she has two businesses: the first is selling beauty products and the second, which she operates with some neighbors, is selling the kinds of prepared foods that are popular in the neighborhood. She has 3 years of experience and the businesses are thriving thanks to the level of service she provides to her customers and to her careful administration of the income from the businesses. Alicia is happy with the businesses because they make her feel useful and productive. In the future, she wants to consolidate the businesses by setting up a stall in a market, perhaps, or a restaurant in her house. She likes both businesses so consolidating them makes sense to her. This is Alicia's third MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time, just as she did the loans before. She will use the money to buy beauty products so that she can fill some existing orders and build a stock for future orders. She will also buy ingredients to make the prepared dishes she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
There is a piece of farmland which Mrs. C. uses to farm different types of crops. C. and her husband have been spending their life in this sector since before they had children. This couple right now has three kids who attend school. 

C. is concerned that a lot of thick grass is growing on her farm field and the crop growth has been affected. To solve the problem, C. needs a loan to hire laborers to cut the grass from her land.

loans.use: To hire laborers to cut the grass from her land

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young man from Palestine, he is married and has no children yet. Mahmoud is a Palestinian National Authority employee and a technician. Mahmoud owns a workshop where he fixes and does maintenance to electrical engines. Where Mahmoud lives, electricity cut off a lot which increases demand for his services.

Mahmoud came to FATEN to ask for a $1,000 loan to buy engines spare parts that he needs in his job. Mahmoud hopes to have a better life conditions and improve his life financially besides being able to have a bigger workshop and employee more technicians.

Mahmoud is fixing an engine in the picture here.

loans.use: Electronics engines maintenance

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena, who is divorced with two children, sells clothing at one of the markets in Berdyansk city, earning a monthly net income of 3,000 Grivnas. This enterprise is her only source of income. In this business for 10 years now, good pricing policy, good client service, and a strong desire to go forward have helped Olena make her business a success.

Olena would like to borrow 10,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment she has to sell. The additional income will be spent on her family's needs: food, medicine, some clothing, etc.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of clothing for sale

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is an ambitious woman from Jenin and wanted to start a poultry farm with her husband and brother. Maha is a mother of three sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee and has a small number of chickens he raises and sells. Maha wanted to expand the project and have a farm.

Maha took a $1,000 loan from FATEN to purchase stalls, chicks and feed because the space is available. Maha wants to create a stable source of income for her family as well as for her brother, who appears in the picture because she is not comfortable with having her picture online.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang S. is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Kandal village in Kandal province. Eang and her husband, Mr. Kong Muth, are farmers who work very hard to support their two children. One of whom is a tailor and the other is a seamstress in the garment factory. 

Eang and her husband cultivate corn on their vegetable field. They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to buy pesticides to kill insect, so Eang decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides and the rest of the loan she would use to buy cultivate corn seeds for cultivating.
 
Eang was selected by the five members of this group to be the group leader. With their loan, each member of this group hopes to increase his or her income to improve their families' lives.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and cultivate corn

loans.name: Jumakul's Group

texts.en:
Jumakul, second from right, is a woman of 59 who is married and has three grown, self-sufficient sons. Five years ago the family started their own cattle-raising business. Additionally, Jumakul adds to the family income by working as a watchman for a private organization. Her husband is a pensioner who entirely devotes himself to farming. In order to build a house, the family intends to increase their earnings by purchasing more cattle to fatten and sell. A loan will make this plan come true.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team — Supporters of Kyrgyzstan — Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan P., 31, is a local farmer/rice cultivator who has been living Kompong Tom Province for many years. For additional income, he raises a few pigs in a stall at his home. He was married, but he divorced his wife 4 years ago, and has one child. Chan P. currently lives with his elderly parents. Chan P. uses cows to plow his fields and is concerned that one of his two cows is getting old and it cannot support his plowing process. So Chan P. is looking for a loan to buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new cow

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelly, de 32 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijas, ambas estudian la primaria, tiene 7 años de trabajar para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa, es técnica en Administracion de Empresas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar.

Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa, pues fue beneficiada con kiva para mejorar el techo de su cuarto, ahora pretende construir los servicios higienicos de su casa (sumidero, inodoro, baño, lavamanos) para asi de esta manera poder brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly is 32 years old, married and has two daughters who are both in elementary school.  Nelly has been working for the City of Juigalpa for 7 years.  She is a business management technician.  She has the support of her husband who takes care of their household expenses.

Nelly is requesting her 4th loan so that she can continue improving her house.  She used her previous Kiva loan to improve the roof of her room.  She now plans to build a bathroom in her home (drain, toilet, bath, sink) so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Augusta; ella tiene 64 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos como maíz molido y también se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallina y conejos,ella los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la ciudad de Cusco,la socia quiere tener un lugar donde pueda vender los animales y productos . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y animales como cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Augusta; she is 64, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business where she sells products such as ground corn, and she also raises animals such as hens and rabbits. She sells them in different markets in the city of Cusco. She wants to have a fixed place to sell her animals and products. She is requesting this loan to purchase corn and animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: This member is requesting this loan to purchase corn and animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Muhamamd

texts.en: Muhammad S., 22 years old, is a National Palestinian Authority employee. Muhamamd took a loan from FATEN in order to purchase a computer. He is an ambitious Palestinian; he wants to have a computer in order to start an online course and broaden his knowledge.

loans.use: personal computer

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family with three businesses: selling eggs and ducks, a small eatery and farming. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Yolanda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of 4,200 Philippine pesos (PHP). Yolanda is borrowing 19,000 PHP so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Yolanda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
Edwin un joven trabajador, casado, tiene su propio negocio una moto taxi, inicio con fondo propios siendo su principal fuente de ingreso, su proyecto a corto plazo es la construcción completa de su vivienda así su familia estará segura.   
Con este préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de hierro, paleta de ventanas. Para la puesta de dos venta en la parte de al frente de su casa. Obteniendo seguridad, protección y mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Edwin is a hardworking young man and is married. He has his own motorcycle taxi, a business that he started with his own money and it is his main source of income. His short-term project is to completely build his house so that his family will be safe.

With this loan, he will buy iron and window panes to install two windows in the front of his house. This way, he will have security, protection and will be more comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase materials for window installation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for gara cloth production

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
la sra. Ana Gabriela R. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Juancho de la ciudad de Nacaome, Ana se dedica a la venta de golosinas, tiene poco tiempo de haber iniciado su negocio, pero se nota que lo a sabido administrar ya que posee buen equipo para preparar sus comidas, su estufa es hecha especialmente para freir de todo tipo de comidas y trabaja con gas para el ahorro de energia electrica.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las comidas, desea comprar al por mayor para obtener mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a tener una cafeteria grande, que este bien acondicionada para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Ana quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Gabriela R. is 30 years old and lives in El Juancho, in the town of Nacaome.  Her business is selling snacks.  She hasn't been in her business for long but it is clear that she has known how to manage it because she owns good equipment on which she prepares her food.  Her stove is made especially for frying all kinds of food and she works with gas in order to save on electricity.

Ana will use her loan to buy supplies for preparing her food.  She would like to buy her supplies wholesale in order to make more profits which she needs to get her family ahead in life.

Ana's goal is to grow her business and own a large café which is well equipped, in order to provide her customers with a better service.  Ana would like to be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gas, chicken, potatoes, cassava, oil, butter, tortillas, cabbage, tomatoes, lemons, condiments, bread, soft drinks, sauces, chilis and juice

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 10 and 2, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in her sister-in-law’s yard. Her son goes to primary school while her daughter attends kindergarten. 

Bolormaa supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall at a local store with help from her husband. When she first began her business in 2007, she had 2,000,000 MNT in working capital. Today her business has grown so that her working capital is now 5,000,000 MNT and she sells many kinds of clothes. 

She wants to expand her business with this loan during this very busy shopping season. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase suits from Beijing, the capital city of China. Her family wants to improve the business so as to be able buy their own yard.

loans.use: to purchase suits from Beijing to resell

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum P. has been making and selling traditional Cambodian bamboo baskets with her husband in the province of Kompong Tom. She started the business many years ago after having learned the craft from her parents.  She has a regular customer base plus casual buyers in the market.

Her business is going better and better from day to day, but with a family of eight children, Oum P. is seeking a loan to purchase two buffaloes for breeding and feeding purposes.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes for breeding and feeding purposes.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María G. D. R. D. 29 años D. edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos que se encuentran estudiando. Ana tiene un pequeño negocio en el cual venD. tortillas, ubicado en el Municipio D. San Salvador del Departamento D. mismo nombre. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y desD. mucho tiempo trabaja duramente para colaborar un poco con los gastos del hogar y sacar junto a su esposo adelante a sus hijos que son todo para ella. Cuenta con buena clientela y cada día la demanda D. sus ricas e higiénicas tortillas aumenta. Esto ha motivado a Ana a solicitar a INTEGRAL este crédito que le permita invertir en las principales materias primas como: Maíz, agua, gas propano, harina etc. Con esta inversión espera y confía que obtendrá mayores ingresos que le permitirán seguir ayudando a su familia  y podrá brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida sobre  todo a sus hijos que cada día necesitan más para sus estudios.
texts.en: Ana Maria Gonzalez D. R. is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three small children, who are in school.  Ana has a small business where she sells tortillas, which is located in the municipality of San Salvador in the department of the same name.  She is an enterprising woman who has worked hard for a long time to contribute toward the household expenses and help her husband and children, who are everything to her, get ahead.  She has a good customer base, and every day the demand for her delicious and hygienically maD. tortillas grows.  This has motivated Ana to request this loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to invest in raw materials for her business such as: corn, water, propane gas, flour, etc.  With this investment, Ana hopes and expects that she will get better earnings which will allow her to continue to help her family and proviD. them with a better quality of life, especially her children, who each day need more support for their education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as: corn, water, propane gas, flour, etc.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie, 26 years of age, is still single. He operates a typical village store. He sells a variety of food products. He has been in this business for almost four years.

Freddie is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional grocery items to sell in their village. He earns PHP 9,000 a month for these activities. He also plans to renovate and expand his retail store to generate more income. He hopes that Kiva and ASKI will continuously support his business for the better future of their family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in the Makerere neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her old parents).    Hadjah has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for seven years and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.     She generates additional income through rental rooms. Her main business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to build more rental rooms.   She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La casa de Javier no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe. Su comunidad  se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera  y artesana.

Javier desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y aves de corral, sus corrales se encuentran en la parte externa de su casa, son apropiados y amplios. Javier alimenta a sus animales con comida balanceada para que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y así podrá ofrecerlos  a mejores precios. Las ganancias obtenidas son para solventar los gastos diarios de su familia. Adicionalmente, Javier cuenta con una hectárea de terreno (herencia de su padre) en la cual siembra limón para vender en los mercados de su zona.

Javier ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras con los ingresos que obtenidos podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  

Javier es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente.
texts.en:
Javier, 33, and his wife and children live in a house they own in Tambogrande-Piura.  The house lacks basic services: water, electricity, sewage.  The local people make their living farming, raising livestock and making and selling handicrafts.

Javier operates a business, raising and selling sheep and poultry.  He has a neat, spacious yard for the business behind his house.  He feeds the sheep and poultry a balanced diet so that they he can get the best price for them when they're ready for market.  The income from the business goes to supporting his family, as does the income from a small farm that he inherited from his father.  He sells the lemons that he grows on the farm at local markets.

Javier is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new soles loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--animal feed and fertilizer--for the business. The extra income will allow him to repay the loan and better provide for his family.

Javier is a responsible, hard-working man whose only wish is to grow his business so that he can improve the lives of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming and livestock business.

loans.name: Rouen

texts.en: Rouen, 56  years old is a vegetable seller.  She has three children and they are 23, 20, and 19 years old. All of them are working in a factory, They can earn $2 per day for each. Every month, Rouen has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent house fee, $20 on transportation, $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work. When she can save some money from selling vegetables, Rouen wants to build a place to feed chickens at home and also to send her children to school to get a specific skill so that they will be able to support themselves.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier, tiene la edad de 47 años, está en divorciado  y vive solo actualmente. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de materiales y herramientas para fabricar artesanías.  El actualmente cuenta con un pequeño taller donde las elabora y los vende a visitantes que vienen al parque. El quiere con esta compra de herramientas hacer sus labores un poco menos complicadas y darles a sus compradores un mejor acabado a sus artesanías para así tener mayor clientela y que el comprador quede satisfecho de sus obras. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Fracisco Javier is 47 years old. He is divorced and currently lives alone. He expects to purchase materials and tools to make artisan crafts with this loan. He currently has a small workshop where he makes and sells the crafts to visitors who come to the park. 

He wants to make the production process a little less complicated with this purchase of tools and give a better finished craft to his customers in order to obtain a greater clientele and make sure his customers are satisfied with his products.

This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans from state banks before. However, FUDECOSUR has provided him this loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy tools for artisan crafts.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel, age 41, is engaged in a farming production activity to support her family's needs. She has been involved in this kind of activity for three years and is grateful to be earning a monthly total of PHP 8,000.00 from her business. She and her husband live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, and have three school-aged children living with them.

Richel has requested  a loan of PHP 25,000.00 from GDMPC to acquire necessary fertilizers and pesticides, pay weeding maintenance costs, and purchase rice seedlings. She has been a member of GDMPC for two years now. She anticipates a bountiful harvest and intends eventually to grow other crops to increase her income.

loans.use: to acquire necessary fertilizers and pesticides, pay weeding maintenance costs, and purchase rice seedlings

loans.name: Maicel

texts.en:
Maicel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing business in the Philippines.

Maicel has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers. She has been in this business for two years.

Maicel would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El Sr. Jaime es soltero, vive en la casa de su hermano que se la ha dado a cuidar; él se dedica a prestar el servicio de transporte urbano en una moto taxi alquilada, el Sr. Jaime se levanta muy temprano para realizar su trabajo ganando a la semana S/. 300 nuevos soles, los cuales los utiliza para su sustento diario y así poder salir adelante. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de su propia moto. Su principal sueño es poder algún día comprarse su auto para prestar el mismo servicio. El Sr. Jaime está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Jaime is single and lives at home with his brother who is dependent on him. He provides urban transportation services using a rented motorcycle taxi. Sr. Jaime wakes up very early in order to do his job. He earns 300 PEN per week and uses the money to pay for his daily needs so that he can move forward.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of a motorcycle taxi of his own. His main wish is to someday buy an automobile to use in his service business. Sr. Jaime is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a hardworking 28-year-old businessman who is single. For the past two years he has been doing carpentry to make a living. He supplements his income from farming. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded his workshop. His dream is to be the carpenter of choice for the clients out there. He is requesting a loan of 30000 Kenya shillings to buy a saw, hammer, nails and wood. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: to buy a saw, hammer, nails and wood

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a mother of two children ages 2 and 6 years. She has been farming for six years, producing tea, maize, bananas, and milk for the local market. She is 24 years of age and also engages in the lumbering business.

Doris has requested a loan of 47,100 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the profit she gains from this loan will enable her to educate her children. She also plans add two more dairy cows and buy her own power saw for the lumbering business.

She says occasional hailstones are a threat to farming in the area.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Maribelt

texts.es: Rosa Maribel tiene más de 6 años en su negocio, que es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo, ella ofrece una gran variedad de productos como calzado, cremas, ropa en general, bolsos entre otros. Ella tiene que salir todos los días para ofrecer estos productos que sus clientes le solicitan. Es por eso el motivo de que solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Rosa Maribelt has had her business selling general merchandise for more than six years.  She has two children she is responsible for.  She offers a large variety of products, such as footwear, creams, clothing in general, and bags, among other things. She goes out every day to sell the products that her customers are looking for.

This is the reason that she is requesting the loan to buy goods for sale.

loans.use: to buy footwear, creams, clothing in general, and bags, among other things.

loans.name: Lyra Joy

texts.en:
Lyra Joy is 21 years old and she sells household goods and manages her homed-based store. She has been in business for two years and says that her business is doing well. She is thankful to God, because her previous loan helped her to increase her business and restock with a little more merchandise. She is now on her fifth loan cycle, and she is asking for additional capital of PHP20,000 to be used in buying groceries and dry goods such as kitchen utensils, hangers, bags and different kinds of blankets. She is hoping that she can obtain the loan amount she requested, so that she can provide for the needs of her family and satisfy the demands of her customers.   

In the future, Lyra Joy is expecting more development of her retail business and continued financial support of all the lenders, for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock and dry goods such as kitchen utensils, hangers, bags and different kinds of blankets for her retail business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 32 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child.

Julie has a snack vending business and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her business. 

Julie has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 42 years old and married to Bernard, and together they have three children aged 18, 14 and 7 years. She does poultry keeping and has been in the business for the past 3 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 32,000 from the business.

This is Ruth's third loan term with KADET. She paid his previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

She will use the anticipated profit to open a retail shop. Her dream is to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Alicia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Alicia, se decidió de nuevo a adquirir otro crédito, porque lo utilizara para comprar más materiales para la elaboración de carteras artesanales como: hilos, agujas, telas, el objetivo de ella es ofrecerles a los clientes más variedad y que sean mejores los ingresos.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron a conseguir más clientes y aumentar en sus ganancias, este le permitió mejorar en su familia y que se mantenga estable.
texts.en: Alicia is once again requesting a loan, which she plans to use to purchase more materials, such as thread, needles and fabrics, to make handmade purses. Her goal is to offer her customers more variety and thus increase her income. Her previous loans have helped her attract more customers and increase her revenue, allowing her to have stability and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles and different colored fabrics.

loans.name: Umbral De Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Umbral de Triunfo” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de leña, repostería, feriantes, chocolatería, corte y confección, alimentos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valdivia.
Elsa, presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un vestido estampado con colores Calipso, negro y blanco, encima lleva puesto un chaleco color beige, su cabello lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio y también presta servicios, se ocupa de estos dos negocios desde hace 24 años.
Prepara y vende productos de repostería entre kuchen y mote con huesillo (bebida refrescante chilena, sin alcohol), además presta servicios de banquetería para matrimonios, cumpleaños y otras festividades, ahí se encarga del coctel, platos de fondo, postres, torta y servicio de mesas.
La mercadería e ingredientes que va necesitando los compra en las ciudades de Temuco o Santiago. 
Con el crédito arreglará el carro con el que trabaja para ofrecer sus productos alimenticios. 
Las metas en su negocio son instalarse con un restaurante y una sala de eventos. 
Elsa vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños son ampliarse en su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza. 
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Umbral de Triunfo [Threshold of Triumph] and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, among which can be found the sale of firewood, pastry shop, people who make sales at the markets, chocolate merchants, sewing, food sales, and other services. All of them live in the city of Valdivia.

Elsa is the president of the communal bank. In the photo she can be found sitting in the first row, in the second place from right to left, wearing a print dress with Calypso colors, and black and white, wearing a beige jacket, and her hair is loose. 

She works in the field of commerce and also provides services and has been in these two businesses for 24 years.

She makes and sells pastries including tarts and mote con huesillo (Chilean soft drink without alcohol). She also provides catering services for weddings, birthdays and other holidays where there is a charge for cocktails, entrees, pastries, cakes and servicing the tables. 

She buys the supplies and ingredients that she will need in Temuco or Santiago. With the loan she will fix the car she uses for her work to provide her services. 

Her goals for the business are to establish a restaurant and an event room. She lives with her husband and one of her dreams is to expand her business.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that the Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business. Also, she feels very comfortable with the group she is a member of. They are united, with respect and trust.

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the area of Los Ríos. It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers of Chile, the Calle Calle. Valdivia has, as one of its principal economic activities, the shipbuilding industry, logging, paper, cellulose (Celco), brewing, and milling. Tourism plays an important role, and so do the educational university services, headed by the Universidad de Austral de Chile.

loans.use: to repair the car she uses for her work to provide her services

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Consuelo is a single mother. She lives in her home built with a simple structure, like others in her community, with two of her three children in the city of La Romana in one of the rural areas that are called bateys. Most bateys are located in a sugarcane field, and were built for the sugarcane industry workers.

Consuelo says her most favorites things to do are to take her children to eat ice cream and to the park. And her most important challenge is to continue growing in her life and business. Since two years ago, Consuelo started her clothing sales business with the money she received when she stopped working in a company. 

Consuelo is receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional and will invest this capital in her clothing sales business; this loan will be invested to buy new clothes and pants by the dozen. With her business profits, she will reinvest in her business. She dreams of having a nail and beauty salon in a better location.

Consuelo and her group are going to devote themselves to various areas of work such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes, beauty salons, grocery stores, etc. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy new clothes and pants by the dozen.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children.
 
Samuel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Samuel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Samuel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Saripa

texts.en:
Saripa works hard to support her family. Saripa is married and has an ambulant vending grocery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Saripa has requested a loan of PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Saripa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to by more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tanei

texts.en:
Tanei is 46 years old and married. She has been operating a livestock retail business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. This is her first loan with KADET, of 20,000 KES, which she intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to set up a dairy farm.
Tanei's hope is to venture into large-scale dairy farming in her area.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 47 years old, married to Monica, and they are blessed with four children. He has been practicing farming for the past six years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET of Kes 23,400, which he will use to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

 His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land for large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Sherina

texts.en:
Sherina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child and she goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn is 40 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling fish for over ten years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are still in her care and in school. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokhorn is requesting a loan of $800 to raise capital in her business for purchasing more fish for resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a small truck for carrying fish to sell and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business for purchasing more fish for resale.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, les 4 membres du groupe    BENKELEMA, vivent dans des familles polygames  avec en moyenne 36 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente de  céréales et d’habits et condiments alimentaires. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2er prêt solidaire.
Mariam, qui est la femme assise, est la vendeuse de condiments alimentaires du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 kilos d’ognons,  10 kilos de poissons fumés, 5 litres d’huile alimentaire et 3 kilos de pomme de terre  auprès des revendeurs du marché de Kolondièba. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame Mariam    espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge  certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The BENKELEMA group consists of four women who are all married and who all live in polygamous families.  On average, they are 36 years old and have six children each.  They all live in the town of Kolondièba and know each other through family, marriage or neighborhood ties.

They buy and sell grains, clothes and condiments for cooking.

In order to increase their businesses, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and this is their second solidarity loan.

Mariam, sitting in the front row, is the group member who sells condiments for cooking.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 10 kg of onions, 10 kg of dried fish, 5 liters of cooking oil and 3 kg of potatoes from resellers at the Kolondièba market.  She resells for cash or on credit to a customer base which mostly consists of women.  

With this loan, Mariam is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the activity, and also used to take care of some of the household's needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments for cooking.

loans.name: Muvulo

texts.en: Muthui is now applying for a KES 26,500 loan that will be used to purchase a 1500 litre tank for water harvesting during the rainy season. The project will benefit 4 family members and will take 2 weeks to complete.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is widowed with five children and three children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business of a pub and has been in this business for 13 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water and jerry cans of local gin.  She generates additional income from selling fried cassava. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked pub and also to buy a plot and build her own business premise. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent .

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water and jerry cans of local gin.

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
Fizuli is a refugee from the war-affected region of Azerbaijan Gubadli. In 1993, as the result of the Armenian-Azerbaijani conflict, he and 3 of his children found refuge in Sumgayit city and settled in a one-room dormitory. As he describes it “at that time I underwent all hardships of poverty and absence of hope”.

After trying his hand in a number of businesses in 2004, he decided to apply to Norwegian Microcredit (Normicro) – non-banking credit organization disbursing small loans to vulnerable and disadvantaged strata of population - and start up a cattle trade business. Since then he has been involved in selling cows, sheep, goats and other cattle. The first loan amount borrowed was 650 USD, followed up by the 2nd loan of 1000 USD. Within the period of his collaboration with Normicro, no late payments were available.

Now he’s planning to buy 3 cows to start up milk and cheese sales. Thus he’ll be able to increase his income and meet his and his family’s needs better. Fizuli looks ahead with hope and thinks he’s in good capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca C. and her husband Marco live on a small farm where they grow rice. On their farm they also raise chickens and pigs as a secondary source of income. Together, they have had three children who are already grown up. They rely on rice farming as their main source of income. Blanca has been a rice farmer for over 35 years, a skill she learned from her parents.

Communal Banking in Santa Lucia

Blanca is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Paypayales Communal Bank are part of a rice farmers cooperative in Santa Lucia named Dios Con Nosotros (God is with us). They will use the microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Dios con Nosotros Cooperative are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en: Mushviq M. was born and raised in the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He currently lives in Aghsu city with his wife and three children. He opened up a small tea house 11 years ago in order to support his family. Seeing the need to expand his business, Mushviq took out a loan from Normicro last year for $300 to make more food items available to customers. He is now requesting a loan of $575 to purchase tables, chairs and glassware for his growing business.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing tables, chairs and other needed items

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto lives in a rented place located in the Feliciano Kantuta Street, Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He is 31 years old and single. He owns an auto shop which Alberto started 2 years ago. He has an assistant which he pays on a weekly basis and Alberto's income is a moderate one. He earns enough to survive but wishes to become a professional in the near future. That is the reason he goes to school at night.

The loan that he is asking for will be invested in buying a computer to work on his college projects and assignments as well as to continue his studies with adequate material.

This is his first loan application with Impro and the performed evaluation qualifies him to obtain it.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Translator

Alberto vive en alquiler en la calle Feliciano Kantuta de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero. Tiene un taller de mecánica que funciona desde hace dos años y trabaja con un ayudante al cual le paga semanalmente. Los ingresos que el tiene son moderados. Le alcanza para subsistir pero el desea ser profesional en un futuro por tal razón por las noches estudia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora para efectuar sus trabajos universitarios y poder continuar sus estudios con material adecuado.

No tiene antecedente con Impro es su primer crédito, y la evaluación efectuada lo califica para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchasing a computer.

loans.name: Vaivasa

texts.en: Coming from a tailoring background, Vaivasa, aged 57, decided to join SPBD. She has two children, ages 13 and 15. Her husband died 5 years ago, and since then it has been hard for her to raise her children. Vaivasa had been sewing all her life, and from her first loan she was able to buy herself a sewing machine. With the help of her family, she's planning to build a spare room especially for her sewing business beside their home .

loans.use: To start up a sewing business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 55 year old refugee from the Zangilan region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now part of the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  Right now she lives in Baku with her family of her husband and six children.  She started her business of food stuff trade in 1992, right after being relocated because she had to earn a living for her family as her husband is jobless and it is difficult to find a job.  She rents a small space near the location where she lives.  At the beginning, she applied to Normicro Baku branch and borrowed her first loan to start her small business.  Now she wants to expand her business by buying a better booth or shop.  To do this, she has applied for a loan of $700.

loans.use: To buy a new booth or shop to expand her business

loans.name: Nancy L.

texts.es:
Client History: Nancy has a stand where she sells jackets by the dozen. Her home is located in the Pampahasi area and her stand is located on Tumusla Avenue in the city of La Paz. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan. The amount will be used to buy jackets and t-shirts. Her experience in her job allows her to be able to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Nancy tiene un puesto donde vende chamarras por docena y al detalle. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi y su puesto esta ubicado en la av. Tumusla de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de chamarras y poleras Su experiencia en la actividad que desempeña le permite acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mrs. Jane U. is 61 years old, married and with four children, and lives in Benin City. In Benin City, she has a store where she sells a variety of provisions, fruit drinks, wines and other items; she is soliciting a loan of $875 to buy more of these goods.

She learned this kind of business for three months, and after which she started her own business in 2002. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy additional provisions, fruit drinks and wine for sale

loans.name: Gairatjon

texts.en: Gairatjon K.  is 22 years old and he lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Mr.K. is engaged in the family business of  livestock raising and selling. It is the general business income that he has. He has a large flock of pedigree bulls. Now Mr K. requests a loan of $650 f to be repaid in 8 months for a mixed fodder purchase.

loans.use: a  mixed fodder purchase

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 48 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, aged 30, 27, 25, 20, and 8. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, aged 100 and 80. Mwanahawa is a tailor and a chips seller, a business that she started in 2007. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Mwanahawa now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in a salon, drinks selling, and cloth selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som N., age 53, is married and lives with her two children in Phnom Penh. She and her husband, Mr. Ban Boeun, 59, have a small business selling eggs and a variety of vegetables in a busy market. Typically, they earn a combined income of around $10 a day. One of their children is a student; while the other helps both parents in the market.

To increase their business growth, Mrs. N. would like a loan from Kiva to purchase additional eggs and vegetables to sell in large amounts since she has many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and vegetables.

loans.name: Suja'i

texts.id:
Suja'i, his wife and children live on Mertasari Suwung Street. Suja'i's business is in buying recyclables from the residents in his area and selling them to the recycle centers. Suja'i has already received one loan through Kiva/DINARI which he paid back on time. He thanks God that the last loan he received helped him grow his business. He really hopes he can receive another loan because he already has more customers who would like to sell him their recyclables, but needs more capitol to afford it. Suja'i uses the profits from his business to pay for his children to go to school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertempat di Jl.Mertasari Suwung, Suja’i tinggal bersama istri dan anak-anaknya. Usaha yang dijalani masih sebagai pemulung atau pengepul barang-barang bekas yang dibeli dari masyarakat sekitar. Sebelumnya Suja’i sudah pernah menjadi klien DINARI, dengan pembayaran yang tepat waktu. Kali ini merupakan pinjaman yang kedua, dan Suja’i sangat bersyukur karena dari pinjamannya yang pertama usahanya sudah mengalami perkembangan. Suja’i berharap kali ini bisa mendapatkan pinjaman lagi karena dia sudah mendapatkan beberapa pelanggan baru yang siap menjual barang-barang bekas kepadanya. Dia berharap keuntungannya bisa dipakai untuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya.

loans.use: to increase funding for his business

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en: K. Sohiba is 21 years old and lives with her parents. In order to support her parents, she runs her own business. Already for three years, Sohiba has been selling children's clothing and shoes in a local market. Her brother helps her with the business. To buy goods for sale, Sohiba travels to the neighboring town, Istaravshan. Over the past three years, she has managed to make her business stable and profitable, so that it generates sufficient income for Sohiba and her parents. Now Sohiba is planning to expand her business and, in order to do so, needs a loan to be able to purchase new children's summer clothing and shoes for sale. Sohiba is asking for US$600 for a term of 12 months. She promises to manage the loan with accuracy and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Expansion of a clothing sales business

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is Isatu S.. She has been in the salt/pepper/onions/tomatoes business for the past 9 years now. Isatu is 35; she was born in Moyamba District but now lives with her husband and 3 children in Makeni. Her husband works as a security officer and receives a very small salary, hardly enough to cater for even his own personal needs. Isatu contributes tremendously towards the family`s welfare. Isatu is seeking a loan of US$ 250 to add onto her business.

loans.use: Increase on the size of her business.

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Mrs. Rum T. and her husband are farmers in Preak Kranh village in the Kandal province. She has infertile soil in the plantation field. Mrs. Rum T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and more vegetable seed to grow in her field.

Mrs. Rum T. is 55 years old and the mother of three children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending high school. Mrs. Rum T. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and more vegetable seed to grow on her plantation.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Mr. Pok P. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. He is a motorbike taxi driver who can only make a meager income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Khiev Nara, is employed in a garment factory. Even though Mr. Pok P. and his wife have different businesses, they still cannot afford to fix up their house so Mr. Pok P. decided to ask for a loan for his purpose. Mr. Pok P. is 27 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only five. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 51 años de edad, su negocio principal es la venta de productos para le hogar como cubre camas, frazadas, cafeteras y estufas pequeñas.  Este negocio lo ha tenido por 8 años juntamente con su esposo.  Los dos venden sus productos a domicilio en diferentes municipios del departamento de Chimatenango.
Gracias a este negocio han sacado a sus hijos adelante, dándoles educación   También en su casa tiene una venta carne de pollo, y este ingreso le ayuda a cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar.   Actualmente solo tiene a su cargo un hijo el mas pequeño, y su deseo es darle una mejor educación para que él pueda salir adelante en la vida.  Ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos y aprovechar la época que vendrá de finales de año.
texts.en:
Olga is 51 years old, and her business is making home products such as bedspreads, blankets, small coffee pots and stoves. She has had this business for 8 years along with her husband. Both of them sell products door to door in different municipalities of Chimatenango region. Thanks to this business they have been able help their children get ahead by providing them an education. Also in her home she sells chicken and this income has helped her meet their household expenses. Today she only has her youngest child to care for, and her wish is to give hi a better education so that he may be successful in his life. She needs a loan to invest in buying products and taking advantage of the upcoming end of year events.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business such as bedspreads, blankets and small appliances

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en el Jr. Iparía Mz. 145 Lt. 3-C, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como Policía de Transito. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de  Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de zapatos Grendha y a venta de productos de belleza (AVON, UNIQUE, EBEL Y NATURA). Todas las mañanas reparte sus productos a sus clientes y por las tardes se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará 3 docenas de sandalias y zapatos Grendha y productos de belleza Natura, Ebel y Unique.  

Carmen está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por brindarle su apoyo para demostrar su habilidad en los negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen belongs to the "Friends Always" Communal Bank located in the Jr. Iparía Mz. 145 Lt. 3-C, district of Yarinacocha, Colonel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and a mother of 3 children that still depend on her. She is married and her husband works as a Traffic Policeman. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Branches of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of clothes. Currently she is dedicated to the sale of products from Grendha shoes and beauty products (AVON, UNIQUE, EBEL AND NATURE). Every morning she distributes her products to her clients and in the afternoons she is dedicated to the care of her children. With this loan of 1,800 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 3 dozen sandals and shoes from Grendha and Nature, Ebel and Unique beauty products. Carmen is very grateful to Manuela Branches for offering her its support to show her ability in business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and beauty products for resale

loans.name: Buen Encuentro Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Buen Encuentro, todas somos mujeres y somos muy responsables y con muchos deseos de superarnos economicamente, somos vecinas y tenemos mucha experiencia en nuestras labores diarias, todas somos madres solteras. nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:
Lastenia O.: soy la coordinadora del grupo, tengo muchos años de dedicarme a la venta de cameras, ropa para camas, en este tiempo las ventas son muy buenas, mi producto lo vendo de contado y al credito, ahora necesito tener mucho producto para poder vender mucho en navidad, ya que hay que hacer los pedidos y esto se tarda unos dias y quiero que para antes del 10 de diciembre tener todo mi producto para empezar a venderlo.
Martha S.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de sopa de mondongo, tambien vende nacatamales, ella tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, ella para la epoca de navidad tiene muchos nacatamales encargados pero no tiene capital para comprar todos los materiales y por tal razon ella necesita el credito de lo contrario no podra cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
Vilma O.: ella vende productos de belleza como ser cosmeticos y tambien vende ropa para cama, tambien ella necesita comprar para poder estar preparada para la epoca de navidad.
todas nosotras necesitamos el credito para hacer nuestros negocios mas grandes y asi tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the Buen Encuentro group. We are all women and are very responsible with a lot of desire to better ourselves economically. In addition, we are all single mothers, as well as neighbors, and have a lot of experience in our daily business activities. Our group is comprised as follows: Lastenia O.: I am the group coordinator and I have many years of experience selling bed linens. Currently, the sales are very good and I sell my product with payment in full and on credit. I need to have a lot of merchandise to be able to sell a lot during the Christmas period, since I have to place my orders to my suppliers which takes several days and I would like to have all my merchandise before December 10th in order to begin selling it. Martha S.: She works making and selling mondongo soup as well as selling nacatamales (Central American tamales). She has her business in her house. She has many orders for nacatamales during the Christmas season, but she doesn't have the capital to purchase the material and for this reason she needs the loan; otherwise she will not be able to cover her clients' requests. Vilma O.: She sells beauty products as well and bed linens. She also needs to purchase items to be ready for the Christmas season. We all need the loan to make our businesses larger and thus earn good incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 53 años, vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. El es una persona muy trabajadora que no descuida la atención de sus hijos, es por ello que decidió abrir una tienda en la plaza de su localidad donde vende gaseosas y abarrotes, también alquila videos de películas, todo esto realiza para generarse ingresos junto con su esposa. Además, brinda sus servicios de armado de calzados para una de las tantas fábricas de zapatos que abundan en su localidad. Y como si fuera poco es también es agricultor, cada 6 meses siembra y cosecha los  productos nativos de su tierra, este esforzado padre es motivado diariamente por el gran amor que le tiene a su familia. Es la segunda vez que Don Edgar solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos el ciclo pasado. Esta vez comprará más mercadería para su tienda, víveres y cajas de gaseosa, además de películas de estreno para su negocio.
texts.en:
Edgar is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children. He is a very hard worker and never neglects his children. For this reason, he decided to open a new shop together with his wife on his local town park where they sell sodas and groceries and they also rent movies in order to make profit. He also provides services as a shoe maker for one of the many shoe factories in his town. And he is also a farmer, so every 6 months he sows and crops native products. This hard working father is motivated his great love to his family. This is the second time Edgar requests for a loan from MFP, and he has proven to be responsible with the payment in the past. This time, he will purchase products for his shop, suppies and sodas, together with new movies for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Одинаев Сафар проживает в районе Рудаки. Женат , имеет пятерых детей. Жена нигде не работает. Кредит запрашивает для бизнеса. Занимается он купле-продажей овощей и фруктов. Привозит товар из отдаленных кишлаков и сдает оптом своим постоянным клиентам. В связи с сезоном ему приходится закупать товар с запасом на длительный срок , поэтому кредит ему просто необходим. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safar O. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has five children. His wife is not working. He is asking for a loan for his business. He is in sales of fruits and vegetables. Safar brings his produce from remote villages and then sells it wholesale to his regular clients. Due to the season he has to buy the produce for a long term and this is why he needs the loan. He can pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase produce circulation

loans.name: Anselma

texts.es: Anselma está felizmente casada hace 23 años, cuenta con 57 abriles y tuvo 6 hijos, uno de ellos falleció y ahora vive con tres de ellos en su propia casa. Por el afán de subsistencia de su familia se ha dedicado a infinidad de actividades, pero por ser esposa de un agricultor está sujeta mucho más a las labores agrícolas; siembran café, cacao y plátanos. Hace 8 meses, en el tiempos que no está en la chacra trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras con una prima en su puesto del mercado, donde también ofrece sus propios productos. Anselma está feliz por la buena producción de los plátanos que ha tenido, pero ahora está notando que contando con un puesto es mucho más rentable vender ella misma sus productos que venderlos a los compradores que van hasta su chacra, por ello está muy motivada con en adquirir un puesto en el mercado y de ese modo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y también la primera vez que es parte de un banco comunal, y ha hecho un compromiso de pagar las cuotas en las fechas indicadas, además está con muchas expectativas acerca del trabajo en grupo. El préstamo que Anselma está solicitando es para la compra de abonos para su chacra de plátanos, también para adquirir dos sacos de papa que le servirá de capital para su negocio mientras espera la cosecha del café.
texts.en:
Anselma is 57 years old and has been happily married for 23 years. She has had six children, one of whom died. Now, three of her children still live at home. While the family has tried their hand at a variety of business over the years, they have always been farmers. A farmer's wife, Anselma has always shared in the agricultural work, planting coffee, cocoa and plantains. For the past 8 months, she has also sold fruit and vegetables at the market with her cousin, who has a stall there. Anselma has been happy with the income her plantain crops have been bringing in, but her experience with her cousin has made her realize how much more money she could make if she sold her crops herself, rather than selling them wholesale to the buyers that come directly to the farm. She has become very motivated to get her own market stall and in this way, increase her earnings. This will be her first loan from MFP, and also the first time that she has ever been part of a Communal Bank. She is committed to making her payments punctually and really looks forward to working with her group. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her fields and also, to buy some potatoes in bulk that she will use as capital until her coffee plants are ready to be cultivated.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potatoes

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Vicenta del Socorro P. B. tiene 37 años, tiene dos hijos. Sus dos hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Vicenta es la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, calzado, perfumes, cremas y bolsos. El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años. Doña Vicenta inicio este negocio por que tenía que ayudar a su familia y fue por medio de una amiga que le enseño y fue con pocos productos como ropa y cosméticos. Los propósitos de Doña Vicenta son de obtener ingresos con su negocio ya que este es el único medio de supervivencia. El financiamiento será utilizado para capital de trabajo de su negocio ya si podrá compra productos como ropa, cosméticos y calzado. Sus deseos son de establecer una tienda para que sus clientes observen la ropa. La cantidad que solicita es de C$22.000 córdobas a un plazo de 14 meses.
texts.en:
Vicenta del Socorro P. B. is 37 years old and she has two children, who are currently students. Vicenta sells general merchandise such as clothes, shoes, perfume, lotions, and purses. She has had this business for the past 10 years. Vincenta started with this business in order to support her family It was through a friend that she learned of this trade and she started off with few products such as clothes and cosmetics. Vicenta's goal is to earn enough income from her business because it is her only means of survival. This loan will be used to purchase more products for resell including clothes, cosmetics, and shoes. Her wish is to establish a local shop for her customers to see her clothes. The loan will be for C$22.000 cordobas to be paid off in 14 months.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sora

texts.en:
Sora  K. is 51 is years old. She is widow and the mother of three children. Sora works hard to ensure the best future for her children. 

Sora has been running her own small business for 12 years. She has a place in the central local market for selling foods, such as sugar, tea, sweets, eggs, and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. The business is stable and that allows her to improve her family's living conditions. 

Now Sora needs a loan to increase the range of goods that she sells. She is requesting 3000 Somoni for a term of 10 months. Sora and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
