Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To iIncreasing her stock and purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya has been a fruit-seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She belongs to the Mshikamano group loan (Group code 2016).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. She works at her business every day.  

She is requesting her third loan from the Kiva field partner, BRAC Tanzania, so that she can buy more fruit for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase, and she will be able to expand her business and save money for the future.

Raya is forty-seven years old, married, and has five children, ages twenty-six, twenty-four, nineteen, fifteen and eleven.

loans.use: To buy fruit for her business

loans.name: Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Tatu has been a soft drinks seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Each day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soda to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Tatu is 25 years old and married with a two year old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Rehema and Time. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more soda to add her current stock.

loans.name: Miliana

texts.es: Miliana tiene 28 años, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como ganadero, y es madre de 2 hijos, un varón y una mujercita. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tales como; leche, huevos, aceite, galletas, panes, entre otros. Acondicionó dentro de su casa una habitación adecuada para su negocio, donde atiende a sus clientes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y le es muy rentable porque obtiene ganancias regulares diariamente. Para más adelante, Miliana quisiera tener una tienda grande donde venda todo tipo de artículos. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son puntuales y responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos para implementar su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Miliana is 28 years old, she lives together with her husband that raises cattle, and she is mother of 2 children, a boy and a little girl. Since a year ago she has been selling basic products, such as: milk, eggs, cooking oil, cookies, breads, among others. She remodelled a section of her home for her business where she tends to her clients from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. She loves to work because she knows so many people and it has been very profitable for her, earning her a regular income. In the future, Miliana would like to have a bigger store where she could sell all types of articles. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she enjoys working with a community bank because all of the members are timely and responsible with their payments. With the funds she is requestions she will purchase more products to stock up her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Melkys Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Melkys del Socorro L. tiene 22 años, es madre soltera. Doña Melkys tiene un hijo a su cargo y todavía no estudia. La actividad económica  es la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios son se dieron porque tenia que mantener a su familia, lo mas difícil para Melkys es dejar a su Mama mucho tiempo sola, por lo que ella necesita mucho cuidado. Pero esto no le impide a Melkys seguir con su negocio. Y así decide solicitar ayuda por medio de Fundación León 2000 para la compra de materia prima como cremas, perfumes, lápiz labial y delineadores entre otros. El sueño de Melkys es que su hermano logre finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Young Melkys del Socorro L., 22, is a single mother. Dona Melkys has a son, not yet in school, who she supports. She works as a street vendor, selling cosmetics, work that she's been doing for more than 3 years. She started the business because she had to support her family. The thing that's most difficult for her is leaving her mother alone much of the time because her mother needs a lot of care. That doesn't stop Melkys from working, though. She's applying for a Fundacion Leon 2000 loan to buy products such as creams, perfumes, lipsticks, etc. for resell. Her greatest hope is that her brother succeeds in completing his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina D. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Celerina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Celerina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Celerina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Celerina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celerina has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 19500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Celerina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Fátima del Rosario M., tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el barrio Lomas del Gavilán, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen cinco hijos , ya todos mayores de edad y casados , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Fátima desde hace ochos años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas, ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su esposo .Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y mejorar la producción, con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias y poder cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Sra. Fatima del Rosario M., 44, lives in the town of Lomas del Gavilan. Her husband helps with household expenses. They have five children, all grown now and married. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions. Fatima has earned an income from farming for the last eight years. The most difficult thing for her are the "plagas" [could be "insects" or "diseases" that affect crops, but not clear]. She started the business with help from her husband. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to improve crop production and, in turn, she hopes, increase her earnings and cover expenses for the things that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and supplies for improving crop production.

loans.name: Felicita Regina

texts.es:
Felicita es socia del Bancomunal San Luís, es casada tiene 56 años y tiene cuatro hijos, el menor tiene 20 años y estudia en un instituto.
Felicita lavaba ropa pero era muy pesado, en su tiempos libres aprendió hacer mochilas  de peluche, y un día le regalo a una amiga por su cumpleaños, a su amiga le gusto y le pidió por docenas  para  venta, ella se dedica a la confección de mochilas y también a tejer carteras de hilo chompas, hace pedidos.
Desde que Felicita esta en Finca aprendió a ser mas sociable, era muy calada aprendió a esforzarse en el trabajo.
Felicita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra  de lanas al por mayor y de ropa de niños para venta.
El sueño de Felicita es de tener una tienda bazar.
texts.en:
Felicita is a member of the San Luís Communal Bank. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. The youngest is 20 years old and studying at an institute.

Felicita used to wash clothes for a living, but it was too much to handle. In her free time, she learned how to make plush satchels and gave one to a friend as a birthday gift. Her friend liked it so much that she asked to buy a dozen of them to sell. She now spends her time making satchels, as well as woven purses and sweaters upon request.

Since joining FINCA, Felicita has become more sociable. She was eager to learn as she put more effort into her work. Felicita needs a loan of 1000 soles, and will use it to buy wool at wholesale and children’s clothing for resale. She dreams of having her own store in the bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool at wholesale & children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Dario Paulino

texts.es: Dario vive con su esposa, tiene un hijo, viven en alquiler varios años en el mismo domicilio. Dario tiene un puesto de cortado de carne de res y su taxi con el que trabaja personalmente. La competencia en el mercado es media ya que existe bastante demanda del servicio de cortado de carne, por ser esta una zona  de alta demanda de los servicios por estar cerca de las venteras de carne. El destino de crédito fue para capital de operación mantenimiento de su vehiculo.  El cliente esta pagando su crédito con normalidad, tiene algunos retrasos debido a que viaja en ocasiones a otras ciudades. Finalmente se puede ver que el cliente a ido creciendo en patrimonio y negocio. A futuro tiene pensado comprar otras maquinas con lo cual estaría creciendo mucho mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Dario lives with his wife and they have one son. They have been renting their living quarters for many years now. Dario runs a butchering stand and owns a taxi that he drives himself. There is a fair amount of competition in the market because there is a great demand for beef meats. This region especially sees many butchers because they are close to the abattoir. The fund swill be used as working capital to perform some maintance on his car. He has been on time with his payments, although sometimes he has been late when he travels to other cities. It can be noted that he has been expanding his business and in responsibility. In the future he hopes to purchase other machiens to expand his business even further.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati C. T. lives in Khokhana-Dobato.  She has two daughters and two sons. Her older daughter is studying in grade 11 and her younger daughter is studying in grade 10. Her sons are in primary and pre-primary school.

Mrs. T. is married to Mr. Ram C. T., who owns his own microbus. Mr. T. drives the microbus from Kathmandu to Birjung. Unfortunately, he was in an accident and his bus was damaged. To repair the microbus, Mrs. T. is requesting  a loan of NPR 30,000. She has already repaid her first loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To repair microbus

loans.name: Blanca Isolina

texts.es: Blanca Isolina esta solicitando su 2do crèdito para construir una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia, en su comunidad es conocida por ser una mujer que  ha luchado por seguir adelante en sus labores, a pesar que es  madre soltera ha luchado  para que a su hijo no le falte nada  ya que desde que nacio ha luchado con su enfermedad,  es una docente muy responsable con sus deberes y es muy querido por sus alumnos y padres de familia, su sueño es terminar de estudiar la licenciatura en ciencias de Educacion, estabilidad laboral y ayudar a su familia  ya que son de escasos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Blanca Isolina is requesting a second loan in order to construct another room in her home and therefore improve the living conditions of her family. In her community she is known for being a woman who has fought to advance her goals. As a single mother she has struggled so that her son's needs would always be met, in spite of an illness he has had since birth. She is a teacher who is very responsible with her obligations and loved by her students and their families. Her dream is to finish her studies and become a fully licensed science teacher, to find stable work and to help her family since they have few economic resources.


Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites D. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, in Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years-old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Marites has recently started opened a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

In 2009, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for her store. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for general store

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Concepción M. cuando se casó, aprendió de su esposo el tejer alfombras, negocio con el cual sacaron adelante  a sus 4 hijos, ella tiene su pequeño taller en casa y cuando tienen suficientes productos su esposo los vende en la ciudad de La Paz, ahora necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar lana, hilacha e hilo, materia prima con los cuales confeccionan las alfombras, ella trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 7 años aproximadamente y le gusta sobre todo la atención que brindan en el consultorio.
Las demás integrantes del grupo 25 de Julio que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, también tienen sus negocios como la costura de polleras (faldas), el tejido de  prendas de vestir, atención de librería, venta de juguetes y ropa. Necesitan el préstamo para comprar  materia prima  y mercadería.
texts.en:
When Concepción M. got married she learned how to weave rugs from her husband. This business enabled her four children to get ahead. She has a small shop in her house. When she has enough products her husband sells them in the city of La Paz. She now needs a new loan to buy wool, thread, and yarn. These are the raw materials she uses to make the rugs. She has worked with Pro Mujer for approximately seven years. Above all, she likes the consultation services that they offer. The other members of the 25 de Julio group, which belongs to the German Busch community center, also have businesses like making “polleras” (skirts), weaving articles of clothing, working in a bookstore, and selling toys and clothes. They need the loan to buy raw material and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Subhiyya

texts.en:
Subhiyya is a Palestinian women living at Al-Yamoun village near Jenin with around 17,000 inhabitants. She is married with seven children: five girls and two boys, five of them still at school while the elder ones are studying in the university. Subhiyya’s husband is an employee at the Palestinian National Authority and he helps her in managing her business in the evenings.

Subhiyya established her business two years ago, and it is located in a lively neighborhood in the village. She sells kitchenware and equipment, glasses, pans, gifts, etc.

Subhiyya needs 1,500 USD in order to buy new products for her shop. In the photo, she appears at her store with her husband.

loans.use: To buy new products for her shop

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem K.,48, is a rattan cupboard maker and widowed mother caring for six children. Two of her children are employed: A son is a carpenter and is also hired by villagers to help with plowing their farms; and a daughter is a worker who sews clothes. Since 2007, Sem K. has owned a small rattan cupboard sales point. Sem K. requested a loan to purchase a trailer and old motor, which she will use to transport her rattan to sell door-to-door. Sem K. and her son are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and old motor

loans.name: Merei

texts.en: A. Merei is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Khovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Her three children, two daughters and one son, all attend a local secondary school. Merei operates a vegetable trading business at a local market in her town. She started her business in 1995 and has built a stable operation over the years. She attributes her success to her hardworking nature and good personality. Merei hopes to continue her success and expand her business in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase vegetables to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The women of the Esperanza committee will invest their loans in the purchase of vegetables, breads, milk, eggs, linens, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

The committee is in its 5th loan cycle, continuing to grow and work at their shared ideals of hard work, prosperity and a secure future. 

Diana S. sells haberdashery.

Marina T. owns a pantry.

Rosalba B. cooks and sells food at a canteen. 

Hermelinda F. cooks and sells food at a canteen. 

Estela V. owns a candy store.

Alejandra R. cooks and sells food at a canteen. 

Antonia G. sells haberdashery. 

Isidora A. is a nurse. 

Mirtha Town sells jewelry.

Primitiva A. sells shoes. 

Francisca F. sells haberdashery. 

Maria A. sells perfumes. 

Sixta A. cooks and sells food at a canteen. 

Sebastiana R. sells clothes. 

Isidora S. owns a pantry. 

Aida I. sells clothes. 

Sonia M. cooks and sells food at a canteen.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha B., 45, and her husband, Mr. Dy Nhean, 47, have been married since 1981. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. Their two daughters weave silk at home and the two sons assist their father in a farming business. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River.

Chantha has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Dy Nhean is a fisherman.

Chantha is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste B. is from the village of Dicayas. She is 29 years old. Celeste is married and has two children.  The elder child is school age while the other child is an infant.  

To make a living, Celeste owns a service-based business where the main source of income is primarily from providing transportation services such as motor cab in the local community. Celeste has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Celeste joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celeste has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase construction materials for house repair. Celeste is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose in continuation of the previous project. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Celeste from PMPC, and this is her second time with KIVA. She plans to give her family a comfortable shelter in which to live. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Elena De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Elena D. Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 74 años y 07 hijos ya independientes. La Socia presenta Primaria Completa.

Elena D. Jesús, lleva varios 5 años dedicándose a la costura y al tejido, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, fue idea propia  se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa un lugar acondicionado, donD. atienD. a sus clientes.se dedica a arreglar blusas y vestidos , también teje vestidos D. bebes , manteles , etc. Y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, trabaja con pedidos D. sus clientes anticipadamente. Con su primer crédito D. 300 Nuevos Soles, compró telas en diferentes colores y tamaños y parte del dinero lo invirtió en lana, hilos D. diferentes especies para su tejido.
En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuD. a su casa para realizar sus trabajos, es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones, hilos D. diferentes colores para su tejido.

Elena D. Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the community bank called "Honesty and Work" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is a widow of 74 years of age and has 7 independent children. This bank member completed her primary education.

Elena has spent about 5 years working as a seamstress and crochet maker. Little by little she was able to generate her own income and to save her money. Her business is located in her own home in a comfortable place where she can attend to her customers. She repairs blouses and dresses, and also crochets baby clothes, tablecloths, etc. She tells us that she is doing very well and has advance orders from her customers. With her first loan of 300 Soles, she bought fabric in different colors and sizes and she invested part of the money in wool yarns of different types for her crochet.

She is currently continuing to run her business and she has loyal customers who come daily to her house with their orders, and she attends to them personally with her characteristic kindness.

With this loan of $425, she will buy cloth maD. of various fabrics by the meter, crochet tools, needles for hand- and machine-sewing, pins, buttons, and different colored threads.

Today, Elena feels herself to be a very accomplished woman with more drive to acheive and realize her dreams. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her business and also for helping many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric by the meter, wool, thread of different colors

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A. sells bags of maize at retail prices to his customers. Maize in Nigeria is used for various food preparations. It can be eaten roasted, boiled, or ground. The demand for it is high. John hopes to be a major maize distributor in the future.

John hopes for a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more bags of maize to sell. He is itching for expansion in his business.

John is married and his wife sells tailoring materials and they are blessed with 4 children. The eldest child is 15 years while the youngest child is 6 years old. His children attend school and they are excelling in school.

John says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Modieré Dite Mamba

texts.fr:
Madame Modieré dite Mamba D. est une femme mariée de 35 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier  Hérémakono-Centre de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Nantie d’un diplôme de médecine de son état, Modieré a passé quelques années dans une clinique, mais finit par se spécialiser dans l’achat et la vente de produits pharmaceutiques  au niveau d’une pharmacie sise au quartier Dilanikoro de Bougouni.
Avec 5 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité et est très sollicitée et appréciée au niveau de Bougouni et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de produits appelés D.C.I. (c’est à dire des produits génériques), à Bougouni et effectuent sa vente dans sa pharmacie à une clientèle  composée de toute la  population locale.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui  lui permettra de d’améliorer sa pharmacie et payer les intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Ms. Modieré, who goes by the name of Mamba D., is a 35-year-old married women and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in the Hérémakono-Centre district of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Bestowed with a medical degree, Mamba spent a few years in a clinic but ultimately became specialized in buying and selling pharmaceutical products at a pharmacy located in the Dilanikoro district of Bougouni. With five years of experience, she has a command of her business. She is in high demand and much appreciated in and around Bougouni. Concerned about satisfying her clearly-growing customer base, she decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan. She intends to use this loan for buying a major quantity of products called D.C.I. (that is, generic products) in Bougouni. She makes her sales in her pharmacy to customers composed of the entire local population. Mamba envisions making a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will enable her to improve her pharmacy and to cover the Soro Yiriwaso loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Jogoo Group

texts.en:
Grace K., 49, is married with three children aged 27, 22 and 16. She has a flour milling business which she started in 2006. She works from 9am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $88.

This will be Grace’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a new loan to increase her stock by buying more maize.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group, Jogoo, which has 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the photo, Grace is in the front row in a white t-shirt.

loans.use: To buy more maize for milling

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de año y medio de edad, vive junto a su madre en el caserío Calazán del distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la crianza y comercialización de animales, ella cría cuyes en un ambiente de su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona y a algunos vecinos que eventualmente adquieren los animales que cría. Los cuyes son animales domésticos de carne muy estimada y cuyo consumo se extiende a nivel nacional desde tiempos remotos.

Margarita desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cuyes para criarlos y venderlos, asimismo desea comprar el alimento balanceado que estos necesitan para lograr un desarrollo optimo. Por este motivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Margarita es una mujer bastante responsable y muy entregada a su trabajo. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es poder darle a su menor hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old, and she is a single mother of a small boy who is one and a half years old. She lives with her mother in the rural community of Calazán in the Monsefú district, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 3 years she has worked raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs in an area of her house, in order to sell them to the traders who frequent her area and to some neighbors who acquire them for breeding purposes. The guinea pigs are highly valued for their meat; they have been consumed throughout the country since ancient times. Margarita wants to expand her business by purchasing more guinea pigs to raise and sell. In addition, she wants to buy nutritious feed for them so that they will grow optimally. For this reason she has seen the necessity of coming for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles that will help her achieve these goals. Margarita is a responsible woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem, and consider her to be a trustworthy person. Her main wish is to be able to give her small boy a quality education that will ensure him a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and nutritionally balanced feed to expand her business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander M. is from the village of Puntian, Quezon Bukidnon. He is 47 years old. Alexander is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alexander owns & operates a business selling gasoline in the local community. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alexander joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alexander has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alexander is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alexander from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ergashova Marpathon Group

texts.ru:
Эргашова Марпатхан 56 лет. Она замужем и мать 1  сына. Ее супруг находится в РФ на заработках. Сын работает работает менеджером в компании FedEx. Клиент занимается земледелием, выращивает обычно хлопок. В бизнесе помогает сын. Кредит нужен для закупа цемента и древесины для ремонта дома.

Гулхумор, 38, замужем. Супруг также на заработках в России. У нее трое детей: дочери 18 лет, сыновьям 14 и 11 лет. Дочь помогает по хозяйству, сыновья учатся в школе. Клиентка занимается животноводством. Цель кредита - закупить бычка для откорма и реализации.

Гулзадахон, 36, разведена. У нее 3 детей: сыну 12 лет, дочери 9 лет, также с ней проживает ее мать - пенсионерка. Гулзадахон занимается оптовой реализацией овощей и фруктов. Цель кредита - увеличить товарооборот в виде овощей и фруктов.

Ферузахон, 36, разведена. У нее 2 сына, оба учаться в школе. Клиентв этом году посадила хлопок, первую прополку сделала, также в огород посадила помидоры, огурцы и лук. Кредит нужен для закупа минеральных удобрений для хлопчатника.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Marpatkhon E. is 56 years old. She is married and is a mother of one son. Her husband is now working in the Russian Federation. Her son works as a manager in FedEx. She is in agriculture and grows cotton. Her son helps her in this business. She needs a loan to buy cement and wood to repair her house. Gulhumor is 38, she is married. Her husband also works in Russia. She has three children: her daughter is eighteen years old and her sons are fourteen and eleven. Her daughter helps her in the household, her sons go to school. The client also does animal husbandry. The purpose of the loan is to buy a calf for feeding and resale. Gulzadahon is 36, she is divorced. She has two children: her son is twelve and her daughter is nine. Her elderly mother also lives with her. Gulzadahon does wholesale of fruits and vegetables. The purpose of the loan is to increase the sales of fruits and vegetables. Feruzahon is 36, she is divorced. Her two sons go to school. She has sown cotton this year, has done the first plow and also sowed tomatoes, cucumbers and onions. She needs the loan to buy mineral fertilizer for the cotton.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and wood

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
Narissa C., from the village of Linao East, Tuguegarao City, is 37 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Narissa owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Narissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 30000 PHP from ASKI, she is now requesting a new one, her seventh, of 20000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Tasneem's Group

texts.en:
Tasneem lives in Multan, Pakistan with her husband and children. Her husband sells bangles, while Tasneem takes care of her family by staying at home. 
As Eid (Muslim celebration, which comes after Ramadan) season is coming near within few months, her husband wants to buy more varieties of bangles. 
Tasneem has applied for a loan which will enable her husband to offer more variety of bangles to his clients, particularly on EID season, which can make a lot of money for them.

loans.use: To purchase bangles for reselling.

loans.name: Carol Ivette

texts.es: La Señora Carol Ivette tiene 25. La actividad económica es la venta de productos de belleza. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio vendiendo pan, tamales, leche agria por lo que las ganancias de estos fueron invertidos en su negocio ya que los ingresos de la pulpería disminuyeron, es así como decide establecerse con el negocio de la venta de productos de belleza. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues siempre está pendiente de su negocio. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de más productos.
texts.en:
Carol Ivette is 25 years old. She has been earning a living by selling beauty products for more than six years. She started off selling bread, tamales*, and leche agria** and invested the profits from this activity back into her business. As the income from the grocery store decreased, she decided to set up business selling beauty products. This is not the first time she has taken out a loan, as she is always focused on her business. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy more products. * a traditional staple made from a starchy dough and steamed or boiled in a leaf wrapper ** a sour, semi-solid fermented milk dish

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 59 years old. Teresita is married and has three grown-up children. To make a living, Teresita makes and sells food. Her primary occupation is selling dried fish in the market. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store located at her house. She hopes to expand her store. Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also has savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Treas

texts.en:
Mr. K. has been spending his life cultivating crops, which is a skill he learned from his grandparent when he was young. He is now married and has four school-aged kids. His wife frequently works in the farm fields alongside him.

Growing crops is an annual action with which K. has had great success. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The growing season is approaching and he is pursuing a loan of $800 to be used to grow green beans.

loans.use: To grow green beans

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Luzmila vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Luzmila tiene una tienda donde vende productos agro veterinarios como por ejemplo abono que sirve para los terrenos de cultivos y también tiene  un hospedaje con cinco cuartos. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana en su domicilio. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo que Luzmila va recibir S/. 2000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar urea. 

Ya son tres años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas.
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luzmila was born in the city of Ocongate, in Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department, and she belongs to the “Las Margarita Ocongate” Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa Cusco. Currently, Luzmila lives in her hometown together with her husband and their four children. (The city of Ocongate is located two hours from the city of Cusco). Luzmila has a shop where she sells agricultural and veterinary products like fertilizer, for example, which is for the fields, and she also has a five-room hostel. She can be found at home seven days per week. With this loan, she will receive 2000 new soles. She would like to use the loan money to buy urea. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years now, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the confidence of her companions and the punctuality of the payments. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy urea

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim R. is a low-income citizen living in the province of Kompong Cham; she appears in the photograph above. Kim and her husband are farmers. In addition to their farm work, Kim also distills rice wine to sell.

Kim is taking out a loan to purchase a pump to irrigate her crops. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will buy piglets. She will raise the piglets with any leftover distilled wine.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand and progress her business

loans.name: United Sisters Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “United Sisters” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 400,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Adama S.. Adama is age thirty; she was born in Magburaka. She is married with three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools.  

For many years now, Adama has been selling market food – pepper, salt, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), etc. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy pepper, salt, palm oil, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Tseveensuren

texts.en:
Tseveensuren J. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in Darhan-Uul province of  Mongolia. She and her family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her middle daughter attends university, while her youngest daughter studies at the local high school. Her husband operates a transportation service business to supplement his family income, and her eldest daughter helps out with Tseveensuren's business.

Tseveensuren has been operating a shoes trade business in a stall at the new market since 2001. She provides a variety of shoes to satisfy their customers' needs. She owns a stall in the market where she sells the shoes.  After some years of positive growth for her business, she has gained not only a wide range of customers, but also a lot of experience as a businesswoman. Her working capital has exceeded 1,800,000 MNT.

Today, she enjoys a stable operation with the businesses and is focused on opening one more stall for her shoe retail trading business in the near future. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a new van for her husband. She currently pays her daughter's tuition fees with her earnings as well. She works hard to expand her business. Tseveensuren is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to open one more stall in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To open one more stall.

loans.name: Bathuu

texts.en:
Bathuu D. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, capital of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. He has two children who are attending university and another child who attends a local school. Bathuu is disabled with a paralyzed leg.

Bathuu operates a grocery store. His wife helps with his business. He started his grocery trading business in 2000 with a small shop and has since expanded his business into grocery store. Unfortunately, his first business was not successful and he had to close it in 2008. Bathuu did not give up on his plans to own a business, however, and purchased a place next to a trauma hospital to re-establish his grocery store in 2009. Since then, he has built a stable operation and has managed to increase his working capital by selling all kinds of cellphone units in his store. He is already making plans to expand his shop by obtaining a license from the Professional Inspection Office. 

Bathuu is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to expand the number of products in his grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa A. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children and daughter-in-law in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Two of his children, aged 19 and 23, are university students while the other children stay at home. Isa operates a retail clothing business from a rented stall at the local market. He began his business in 2004 selling small accessories. Since then, he has been able to start a retail clothing stall. In addition, his sister has helped to sell his products in the Russian market. He usually imports his clothing items from China and keeps an inventory of between 4,000,000 and 5,000,000 MNT. After many years he has built a successful operation and his monthly sales have reached a level of 1,500,000 to 2,000,000 MNT, with 25-35% considered net profit. For the future, he wants to be able to pay for his children to go to university and get a good education. Isa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothing for his retail stall.

loans.use: To import more clothing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old, married and has two children aged 25 and 23. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale.
Gloria joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Paula Lorena

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Paula, ella mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores y uno de 16 años que estudia en colegio y vive con ella. Su marido es agricultor.

Tiene un negocio de venta de mariscos y legumbres actividad que la realiza todos los domingos en la ciudad de Rocafuerte en la cual tiene un puesto en el mercado, los demás días vende pescado por el lugar donde ella habita. El pescado lo compra todos los días bien de mañana a pescadores que llegan hasta las playas de los arenales.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, verduras y otros mariscos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta las charlas y los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The members of the “La Unión Hace La Fureza” (Strength Through Unity) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets that its inhabitants make.  The sweets are known throughout the whole country.

This is the place where we find Paula.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have three children.  Two of them are adults, and the 16 year old goes to high school and lives with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a business selling seafood and vegetables every Sunday in the city of Rocafuerte.  She has a stall in the market there.  The other days she sells fish in the place where she lives.  She buys the fish early in the morning every day.  She buys from fishermen who come to the Los Arenales beaches.

This loan is to buy fish, vegetables, and other seafood.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank.  She likes the talks and the loans.  Her dream is to have a well-built house.

loans.use: To buy fish, vegetables, and other seafood

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La siguiente persona que hableremos a continuacion sellama Leonor S. B., quien es soltera y tiene 26 años de edad, desde hace mas de 2 años Leonor empezó a dedicarse a la venta y recomendación de productos naturistas, ella a raíz de un padecimiento de salud fue el motivo por el cual inicio la venta de estos productos , primero ella los empezó a consumir, después los recomendó y es de esa manera como empezó con la venta de estos productos, ella es instructora de educacion inicial en una dependencia llamada CONAFE(comision nacional del fomento a la educacion), Leonor vive con su madre a la cual ella apoya economicamente.
Leonor solicito un credito para la compra de mercancia que ella vende mismos como; productos naturistas, suplemento alimenticio, vitaminas, calcio, malteadas, té, bebidas energizantes, fibra, tatamienos para diferentes padecimientos, como son aloe vera, compuestos de plantas medicinales.
A lo que aspira Leonor es a tener una casa propia, gozar de buena salud, tener un establecimiento en el acual pueda ofrecer de manera permanente sus productos, por lo pronto ella les da las gracias a los que apoyaron el financiamiento de sus credito a ellos le mada un afectuoso abrazo.
texts.en: Leonor S. B. is 26 and single. Over 2 years ago she started selling and promoting natural products. She was motivated by a health issue which got her started selling these products. She started off consuming them, then later recommended them and began selling them. She is an early childhood educator in a school called CONAFE (Comision Nacional del Fomento a la Educacion- National Commission to Promote Education). Leonor lives with her mother whom she supports economically. Leonor is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise that she sells such as: natural products, dietary supplements, vitamins, calcium, milkshakes, tea, energy drinks, fiber, and treatments for various ailments such as aloe vera and compounds from medicinal plants. Leonor aspires to having her own home, enjoying good health, and having a fixed location to sell her products. Right now she is grateful to those who will support the financing of her loans and sends you a warm hug.

loans.use: The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of the following natural products: milkshakes, fiber, vitamins, energy items, supplements, energy drinks and aloe vera products.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda I.'s main source of income comes from selling electronic products in her community. She is 55 years old, widowed and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Rosenda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling fish and shellfish. She lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental. Teresita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Teresita is borrowing 11,500 PHP so that she can purchase new equipment. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a pump boat

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a businessman who runs a posho mill.  It has been five years since he started the business.  He runs the business with one employee.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Benson has benefited through the loans.  He has improved his business and can now provide for his family.  He dreams of opening other outlets for his business in five years.  With the 80,000 Kes loan, he will add stocks of maize for his mill.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more assorted items for her shop

loans.name: .ernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ernestina;  La socia tiene 47 años de edad; La socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia  produce y compra diferentes trabajos, ella vende artesanía en la estación de Ollantaytambo la misma que se dirige a la ciudadela inka de Machupicchu, la socia tiene llaveros, mantillas, chullos, adornos, ceniceros, entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para el negocio.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (The Friendship of Ollantaytambo) community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Ernestina is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Her business is buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes and buys different items.  She sells her handicrafts in Ollantaytambo Station which leads to the Incan citadel of Machupicchu.  Ernestina sells keychains, mantillas (lace scarves), 'chullos' (woollen caps with earflaps), decorations, ashtrays and other items.

Ernestina is requesting this loan to invest in buying merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for her business

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is an agriculturalist living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, and he has been farming for ten years now.

He has been able to educate his children with the income he generates. His goal is to buy a truck to transport his produce to the city where he can sell at higher prices. 

Vicent would like a loan to buy beans and groundnuts for planting.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts for planting

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung C., age 37, is the devoted mother of five children. She operates a recycling business, buying and selling used goods. She goes around her community buying many kinds of old things such bottles, cans, plastic products, and electronic wires, and sells these to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. 

She is generating an income of approximately $3.50 per day to help support her family. The other source of family income is her husband’s taxi service. 

Soung C. is going to use her loan to repair the family home, an old house that needs essential repairs.

loans.use: to repair the family home, an old house that needs essential repairs

loans.name: Nancy Isabel

texts.es:
Nancy N. vive en el barrio Ciudad Modesto, ubicado al suroccidente D. la ciudad;  allí tiene un negocio donD.  comercializa mercancías,  especialmente calzado;  ella es una mujer casada que  tiene 6 hijos en las edades D. 25 a 35 años. Nancy inició su negocio en el año 2005,  buscando ingresos adicionales para mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia,  que hasta en ese momento estaban solo a cargo D. su esposo , asì ella comenzò vendiendo cervezas, con un capital inicial  que logró ahorrando D. los gastos del hogar, con el dinero  que le daba su esposo para el sostenimiento D. su familia.
Su meta es ampliarlo y lograr con sus utilidades mejorar las condiciones habitacionales  y aunque tiene poco capital D.  trabajo,  continua trabajando fuertemente para aumentarlo, generando con su actividad  una utilidad  neta del 26% y rotando sus cuentas por cobrar cada 10 días, porque ofrece su negocio a crédito y tiene una importante clientela que le compra en mayor volumen. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer crédito con a Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva comprará en volumen cervezas y también  mercancía  variada que tiene encargada por sus clientes, con motivo D. una D. las fechas más importantes para las familias colombianas y D. gran despliegue comercial:  "el día D. las madres".
texts.en:
Nancy N. lives in the Ciudad Modesto neighborhood located in the southwest part of the city.  She has a business there selling merchandise, especially footwear.  She is a married woman and has 6 children ranging in age from 25 to 35.  Nancy started her business in 2005 in search of additional income to improve her family’s living conditions which up to that point had been solely her husband’s responsibility.  She started out selling beer with an initial capital she saved from household expenses, money her husband would give her for family support.

Her goal is to expand it and use profits to do some home improvements.  Even though she has little working capital, she continues working hard to increase it generating a net profit rate of 26% with a 10 day accounts receivable turnover because she sells on credit and has a sizeable clientele that buys in large volume.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and will use her Kiva loan to buy a quantity of beer as well as assorted merchandise she has pending customer orders for due to the approach of one of Colombia’s most important family occasions that brings heightened spending: Mothers Day.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beer as well as asssorted merchandise she has pending customer orders for.

loans.name: Philisiwe Group

texts.en:
Thenjiwe is 50 years old and married with two children who are 14 and 27 years old. Her husband works for Capacity Factory Company and she cares for four relatives. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni, South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in this business for three years and she sells frozen chicken packs and cold drinks at her home. She also receives income from a child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers who pay on credit and fail to pay on time. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy frozen chickens in packs. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her stock and not have to depend on her husband. In the future, she hopes to see her business grow. 

She thanks WDB for lending her money all this time and helping her with her business. She hopes that Kiva will do the same.

loans.use: To buy frozen chickens and cold drinks

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sara; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes que trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y también en sus ratos libres la socia se dedica a realizar trabajos de salón de belleza como cortar el cabello o hacer teñidos, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también mejorar el servicio de salón de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y golosinas para la tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sara belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Sara, age 37, has a life partner and five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business, a grocery store.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  In her free time she does beautician work like cutting hair and dyeing hair.  Through these small businesses she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand her grocery store business, and she wants to improve her beauty salon service.  She is requesting the loan to buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and sweets for her grocery store.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and sweets for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad, Maria Gladys es una emprendedora consagrada a su negocio, donde vende productos por catálogo. El oficio lo aprendió hace 4 años gracias a una amiga quien le mostró los beneficios de dicha labor.

Maria Gladys es una luchadora incansable que espera tener mas clientes y mas posibilidades económicas para tener su negocio surtidos y con gran variedad. Esta emprendedora considera que su trabajo es una bendición ya que ella dispone de su tiempo y puede estar pendiente de su familia.

Actualmente Maria Gladys necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía y así incrementar su capacidad de comercialización mejorando proporcionalmente sus ventas.
texts.en:
At her 40 years of age, Maria Gladys is an enterprising woman dedicated to her business where she sells products by catalogue. She learned her trade 4 years ago thanks to a friend that showed her the benefits of the job.

Maria Gladys is a tireless fighter that hopes to have more customers and economic possibilities to have her business stocked with a greater variety of goods. She is hard working and considers that her work is a blessing since she sets her own schedule and is able to take care of her family.

At present, Maria Gladys needs the loan to buy merchandize and increase her business volume by improving her sales proportionately.

loans.use: buy merchandize from the catalogues that she sells.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Rebecca has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fish.

Rebecca is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish.

loans.name: Nelisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelisa; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado, ella vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Urubamba, ella por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de ganados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ganado y alimentos para los ganados como pasto.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelisa is a member of the "El Diamante de Urubamba" (The Diamond of Urubamba) community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Nelisa is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling livestock.  She makes her sales in the different markets in Urubamba district.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Nelisa would like to expand her business buying and selling livestock.  She is requesting this loan to buy livestock and feed for them such as fodder.

Nelisa is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed for them such as fodder

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 57-year-old woman. She is separated and living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Living with her are the four school-aged children who have helped her in running the sari-sari (variety) store. It is basically the means of living for the family. She has been doing this activity for one fruitful year already. Elizabeth earns 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this business. She decided to take a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional stock of canned goods, rice and sacks of rice bran to sell in the local community. She is getting one year of her membership with GDMPC. She hopes to expand the business and have an ample display of needed commodities to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of canned goods, rice and sacks of rice bran to sell.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Kunthea is a cake seller. Her husband sells vegetables. Their income is $7 per day. She has four children. Two of the children are studying and one more is a seller. Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a cow to plow her field. Besides selling cake, her family also does farming after they rest from their daily tasks. In the future, she wants to extend her husband's career by buying more kinds of vegetables to sell so that they can make additional income for the family and be able to help their children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing her field

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Mohamed est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié et a 02 enfants en charge.
Mohamed travaille comme vendeur de pneus depuis 1996. Il vend ses produits  à Agoé après achat au Port Autonome de Lomé. 
Mohamed a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pneus.
texts.en:
Mohamed is 28 ans, married, and raising two children. 

Mohamed has worked selling tires since 1996. He sells his products in Agoé after buying them at the Autonomous Port of Lomé. 

Mohamed has requested his first loan with WAGES in order to buy tires.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Veronic, who is in her late 30s, is a widow with two children, one of whom attends school.  She has been running a vegetable business for five years. She works from 5 a.m to 9.30 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her vegetable stock and pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to go upcountry and buy about 4 sacks of fresh garlic.  Her dream is to one day be able to have good capital and start another business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Lindi," which has 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To go upcountry and buy about 4 sacks of fresh garlic.

loans.name: Larkoh United Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the "Larkoh" group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 Leone (SLL) each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Yayah is the leader of this group. Born in Magburaka town, Yayah is married to a businesswoman and they have four children–two are in primary school, one is in secondary, and the youngest is not yet of school-going age. 

Yayah is a driver and has been in this profession for 15 years now. With the help of this loan, he is going to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jose has a pigpen and sells matured & grown pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for pigs.
Jose is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jose hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 29 years old and married. She has one child.

Alona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Alona has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and electronic re-loads for phones.

Alona aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 40, a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Leonido, a security guard, and the mother of one child. She enjoys performing her jobs as a wife, mother and a businesswoman. Her business is her way of helping her husband to meet the demands of their daily expenses. 

Josephine is in the garment business. She buys raw materials like textiles, buttons, thread, etc. She cuts and sews these into different patterns, depending upon the job order from her clients. There are round neck, v-neck, polo shirts and sometimes office and school uniforms. She caters to the needs of her clients and provides them a satisfaction guaranteed kind of service to have them repeat orders from her. Her business allows her to earn 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per day. 

Josephine is requesting a loan amounting to 11,000 PHP that will help as  additional capital. She will spend it to buy additional products she needs in her business. She will prioritize her purchases of the materials that she needs right now for her current order which is for polo shirts. She makes sure that the order is delivered on time as it will add additional points in her negotiations. "Meeting my clients demand, satisfaction guaranteed will definitely mean additional customers because they will refer me to other companies who need garments," she says.

Josephine dreams of having a more visible shop. Her business location right now is quite far from the highway, there are times when her clients have a hard time finding residence. She is praying to God that one day, she will be able to have enough income that will sustain her to maintain a shop in a more visible area. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to be a more God-fearing and God-loving individual. The fellowship lightens up the load she has, every time they gather together to share the word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Mable is a 38-year-old single mother with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is to build rental houses and educate her children. She has been selling produce for the last five years. She started with 500,000 shillings, but now her business has over two million shillings. Her biggest challenges are the constant price changes and her dream is to own a big food store. Mable needs the loan to buy maize grains for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize grains for selling

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es:
Daniel pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Daniel tiene 45 años de edad y está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Puno y desde hace 15 años que radica en la ciudad de Salvación. 

Daniel es Ingeniero Civil y trabaja de forma independiente, él tiene una pequeña oficina de consultoría de Ingeniería donde se realizan por ejemplo planos para construcciones y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
