En esta oportunidad Daniel requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de escritorio como papel, lapiceros, planos, tintes, y otras cosas más. 
 
Daniel agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Daniel is a member of the 'Del Futuro del Manu' community bank.  The bank's meetings take place once a month in the city of Salvación, in Manu province.

Daniel is 45 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship.  He was born in the city of Puno and has been living in the city of Salvación for fifteen years.

Daniel is a civil engineer and is self employed.  He has a small engineering office where they make plans for buildings and other things.  He has been in this business for several years and it is doing well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.

On this occasion, Daniel needs a loan to buy stationery supplies such as paper, pencils, maps, ink and other products.

Daniel is grateful for this loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies such as paper, pencils, maps, ink,etc

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa es socia del banco comunal Bellavista del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Se dedica a la venta D. comida, esta actividad la realiza por las noches en el patio D. su casa, como vive en una calle concurrida tiene muchos clientes que acuden a saborear sus potajes, cuenta con la ayuda D. una señora que se encarga D. los asados en la parrilla.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 7 planchas D. calaminas, 1 kilo D. clavos, 5 listones, pago mano D. obra del carpintero, todo este préstamo lo utilizará en la elaboración D. un techo D. calaminas para protegerse D. las lluvias, D. lo contrario, en días D. lluvia no pueD. salir a trabajar.
Esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por darle los préstamos que solicita a pesar D. su edad, necesita trabajar porque es parte D. su vida, lo hizo todo el tiempo para poder criar a sus hijos
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the Bellavista community bank, which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 63 years old, married, and has five children.

Tomasa's business is selling food.  She carries out this business in the evenings, from the courtyard area outsiD. her home.  She lives in a busy street and so has a lot of customers who come to savor her stews.  She has the help of a lady who takes care of barbecuing food on the grill.

With this new loan for 1,300 soles, Tomasa will buy seven sheets of corrugated metal, one kilo of nails and five units of lumber.  She will also pay a carpenter for his services.  She will use her loan to have a metal roof built which will protect her from the rain.  Without this, she is unable to go out and work on rainy days.

Tomasa is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her loans which she requests, in spite of her age.  She needs to work because it is part of her life.  She worked all the time in order to be able to raise her children.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Nueva Esperanza Hualtaco III Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. Wilfredo vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y aún no cuenta con  servicios básicos.

Wilfredo se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, a los cuales cría y engorda y una vez con peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en mercado local a los negociantes que visitan el lugar con frecuencia. Su padre se dedica a la agricultura y lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza.  Existe una buena relación familiar, lo cual impulsa el crecimiento de su negocio, ya que existe un apoyo mutuo entre todos. 
 
Wilfredo desea comprar alimentos balanceados para su ganado, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo  y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  Es por ello, que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 38, single, and has no children. He lives in his parents' home, located in the hamlet of Nueva Esperanza Hualtaco III, Tambogrande district, belonging to the Piura region, four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department.
Wilfredo lives in a rural area and his home does not have basic services.
Wilfredo raises sheep and barnyard birds. He fattens them until they have reached an ideal size and weight, and then he sells him in the local market to the businesspeople who frequent the area. His father works in agriculture and Wilfredo supports him. The family has a good relationship, which propels their businesses' growth, because they support each other mutually.
Wilfredo wants to buy balanced feed for his animals. This investment will allow him to continue expanding his business and to improve his quality of life. So, in order to reach his objective, he has decided to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his animals in order to improve their health and productivity.

loans.name: Mahsudjon

texts.ru: Махсудчон парень 33 лет, женат имеет троих детей, жена домохозяйка. Он производит сахар-рафинад на дому. Сейчас под Новый год на рынке идет оживленная торговля. Махсудчон планирует на полученный кредит закупить партию сахара-песка, для расширения  своего производства. Кроме этого Махсудчон является также мастером по отделке квартир, в летний сезон он занимается своим любимым делом, ремонтом квартир. Имея все эти доходы Махсудчон содержит свою немаленькую семью. Можно с уверенностью сказать, что получив кредит Махсудчон увеличит производство и без проблем может оплатить взятый кредит.
texts.en: Mahsudjon is a 33 year-old young man, who is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He produces refined sugar at home.  Sales at a market are high now, prior to the New Year's holiday.  Mahsudjon plans to use this loan to purchase an inventory of granulated sugar in order to expand his production.  Besides this business, Mahsudjon is also an apartment interior decorator and is involved in his favorite business of repairing apartments during the summer season.

loans.use: to purchase granulated sugar

loans.name: Naty

texts.en: Naty, 61 years old, is married and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Naty has operated a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 7 years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, coffee, canned goods, spices, etc. Naty has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future Naty would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
Né  en Mai 1971 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Fousseyni est marié et père de trois  enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment aux stockage et commercialisation des céréales, il y a maintenant dix années, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son cinquième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients.
Il compte avec ce cinquième prêt  acheter 20 sacs de maïs, 10 sacs de riz et 25 sacs de mil en provenance dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin afin d’être revendues en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de détaillants et de chefs de famille. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Born in May 1971 in Sikasso, Fousseyni is married and is a father of 3. He lives with his wife and children in a large traditional family in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
He never got a chance to go to school and, after a few unsuccessful enterprises, he quickly turned to commercial activites, especially storing and selling cereals, about 10 years ago. He has quite a reputation and gets lots of orders, but he does not have the resources to meet this demand. So, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program through which he is applying for a 5th loan. This loan will enable him to increase his working capital in order to better meet the needs of his customers.
With this 5th loan, he plans on buying 20 bags of corn, 10 bags of rice, and 25 bags of millet from the surrounding communities of Sikasso. These goods are first stored in his store to be sold in wholesale and retail to a clientele of retailers and heads of households.
With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 270 000 FCFA. With the profits, he plans on meeting most of his financial needs and that of his family, paying back his loan, and investing the rest in his main activity.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Raja

texts.en: Raja is a 44 year old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD so that she can buy new doors for her home. She would like to do this so that she can improve the condition of her house. Raja prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita started selling fruit about 5 years ago. She only had $10 worth of products and a table outside of her home when she started. Slowly but surely her business grew, today she runs a small market from a section she prepared in her house.

She needs the loan because she is seeking to buy in bulk at better prices. She wants to invest a larger variety of the fruits she sells as well. Margarita is 41 years old and has 2 children. Her oldest son who is 18 years old helps her with the business. Thanks to this business Margarita has been able to provide her children with an education, food on the table and a roof over their heads.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in fruits

loans.name: Banko

texts.en: Banko I. is 43 years old and and was a military man for more than twenty years. After retiring from the army he set up a small farm on which he breeds cows, goats, sheep and some pigs. He runs this farm with the active support of his wife and kids. Each year the farm increases the amount of lambs for export so Banko I. needs to build a special shelter for lamb breeding. The loan amount is $1200.

loans.use: To build a special shelter for lamb breeding

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Like many entrepreneurs in Ukraine, Elena’s dream was to be self-employed. With help and encouragement from her mother-in-law, almost a year ago Elena was able to open a kiosk where she sells clothing and various household items at the small market in Vasilievka. She has seen positive growth in her business and would like to see it continue to develop and bring higher returns to support her family. Elena’s business is the main income generator for her family.

Elena’s entrepreneurial spirit and diligence in her work help attract repeat customers to her kiosk. She is pleased to meet the demand of customers and strives to weekly update her product selection.

Elena is requesting a loan for $500 to purchase a variety of household goods that she will be able to offer her clients. She has proven to be a strong and reliable client though her partnership with Nadiya Ukraine, and we are looking forward to seeing how her business will continue to develop.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mr Chin K. is 48 and lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. He is a driver and earn around 5 dollars per day. He has 5 children. His wife wants to sell rice and khmer foods at home. Therefore, they need tools to implement this new business. In the future, they would like to own a big shop where they could sell a wide variety of khmer food.

loans.use: To purchase tools to sell khmer foods.

loans.name: Meresaini

texts.en: Meresaini is from Samusu and they have lived there for more than 5 years. Her family lived on a taro plantation, which was their main source of income. She is married with one child and she is living with her mother and three family relatives. Meresaini's husband is very hard working, and from Meresaini's first loan they managed to install water pipes inside the plantation. Meresaini is planning to grow her plantation bigger and hopefully in the future she will be able to export her taros overseas.

loans.use: To assist with her plantation

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Almaz is 42 years old. She is a refugee from the Aghdam region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now part of the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  She and her family fled to Baku in 1992 and right now she lives with her family of two children in the Binagadi settlement, in the southern suburbs of Baku.  Her husband has died.  She started her business of food trade in 1993, right after being relocated because she had to earn a living for her family.  At the beginning, she applied to Normicro Baku branch and borrowed her first loan to start her business.  She has borrowed seven loans before and she is one of the best clients.  She hasn't had any late payments.  Now she wants to buy a small freezer to store ice cream, meat and diary products.  To do this, she has applied for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy a small freezer to grow her business

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
"I sell fried chicken at my business. My husband and I opened it one year ago and it has gone very well for us. Right now we would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise and to obtain more profits since this is what sustains our family." I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo en mi negocio vendo pollo frito, lo abrimos mi esposo y yo hace 1 año y nos ha ido bien, pero en esta temporada nos gustaría invertir en la compra de más mercancía Y así obtener más ganancias ya que es el sustento de nuestra familia”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Lita K. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with six children, aged 5,7,9,13,15, and 18. In 2005 Lita established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Mugunza A(V) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Teopista Akwase. She currently sells used clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for sale. Teopista is 33 years old and is married; her husband is a conductor . She has 6 children ranging in age from 1 to 20 years and five of them go to school. Each week, Teopista makes approximately UGX 50000 (US$30.00) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to pay school fees for the children. Teopista has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 (US$118.00) to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Teopista is joined in her small group by Jane A., Jane A. and Lilian T.. Jane A. sells milk and wants to buy more milk cans. Jane A. sells dry foods and wants a loan to increase her stock. Lilian T. sells maize flour and wants to expand her business with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Marry's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Marry is a married woman with 4 children, aged 23, 18, 15, and 10. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, aged 80. Marry owns a small food vending store, which she started in 1994. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Marry now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending, cloth selling, and soap selling.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Sles

texts.en: Mrs. Sles L. and her husband, Hou Sun, earn $10 per day sewing fishing nets in the Eslam Village, Pursat Province. They have four children, all of whom are married. They seek a $300 loan to purchase more supplies for their net-sewing business. They feel this loan will help support their business and improve their living conditions. L., Sun, and their children are in the photo

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for their net-sewing business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva B. A. is a thirty-one year old business woman. She is married with three children who are in school. Eva owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, etc. She is also an interior decorator with skills in room and business decoration. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, etc. to expand her business. She believes that with the increased income, she can build a shop for her decoration business. She belongs to the community group called Steadfast Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk etc.

loans.name: Nancy 2012-9 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine P.. She is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Christine is 30 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately 100 Sudanese Pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Christine is joined in her small group by Eva K., Victoria J., Jenifa M., and Akong R.. Eva K. has a business selling tea at the restaurant and wants to expand her business. Victoria J. is currently operating a business selling fried eggs and meat at the hotel and wants a loan to build houses for rent. Jenifa M. operates a business selling local brew and wants to build an internet café for internet facilities. Akong R. currently sells ice cream and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Click this link to view Dionisia's first loan.

Dionisia belongs to the Aleli Village Bank. She lives with her husband, is 33 and has five children. She and her husband have a joiner’s workshop at home in the Olives association. They do all sorts of furniture according to their clients’ requests, but they especially produce cages for livestock farming. Then they sell their products in the San Juan market on Sundays.

Dionisa needs a 1000 soles ($US350) loan to purchase wood.

She dreams about expanding her shop, equipping it with more machines and improving her house.

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Thi Thanh's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Thanh, MS 11040008, is 48 years of age. Every day she and her husband (who also work for hire), raises, breed and sell cattles. Her family average daily income is about 100.000 vnd/day. She has been a part of this organization for quite some time and has been good with repaying past loans. Presently, she is asking for a loan of 2.912000 vnd to buy food supplies for her livestocks. The following people are members of her group:

  • Ms. N. Thi Hao, MS 11040028, is seeking a loan of 2006000vnd to buy marketing supplies.
  • Ms. N. Thi Dinh, MS 11040013, is seeking a loan of 3.808000vnd for convenience store business.
  • Ms. T. thi Minh, MS 11040019, is seeking a loan of 3.808000vnd to buy livestock food supplies.
  • Ms. T. Thi Vui, MS 11040016, is seeking a loan of 1.534000vnd to buy marketing supplies.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn thị Thanh MS 11040008 năm nay chị 48 tuổi,hàng ngày chị và chồng đi làm thuê, chăn nuôi lợn giống để bán,mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình mỗi ngày từ 100.000VND/ngày.Chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình qua một chu kỳ và trả vốn rất tốt. Nay chị tiếp tục đăng ký vay 2.912000 VND để mua cám lợn. Các thành viên trong nhóm chị :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Hảo MS 11040028 vay mức 2006000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Định MS 11040013 vay mức 3.808000 VND để kinh doanh
  • chị Trần thị Minh MS 11040019 vay mức 3.808000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Trần thị Vui MS 11040016 vay mức 1.534000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ

loans.use: làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàn tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương năm 1995. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ hoàn cảnh gia đình chị rất khó khăn do đông con và thu nhập chỉ trông vào đồng ruộng.Vào quỹ chị xin vay 300000đ để mua 2 con lợn giống để nuôi. Sau 4 tháng dự án cho thu nhập  500.000đ. Thấy dự án chăn nuôi có hiệu quả anh chị đã tiếp tục vay thêm vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Năm 2004 chồng chị tham gia lớp tập huấn về chuyển đổi mô hình chăn nuôi theo trang trại, kết thúc khóa học vận dụng những kiến thức đã học được và kinh nghiệm đã được tích lũy anh chị quyết định mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi theo trang trại để phát triển kinh tế gia đình, Sau 4 năm thực hiện dự án hiện tại gia đình chị đang là chủ trang trại khá quy mô với nhiều loại cây ăn quả, 100 con lợn và 1000 con gà. Anh chị mong muốn được vay thêm vốn để đầu tư vào trang trại của gia đình. 
Mức vốn xin vay 19000000đ
texts.en:
Mrs. H. joined the TYM Fund since 1995. Before becoming a member of the Fund, she faced a lot of difficulties because of having many children and her income came mainly from her farming. She borrowed 20 USD to buy 2 pigs. After 4 months of membership, she earned 40 USD. Seeing that her project was productive, she decided to borrow more to invest in raising animals. In 2004, her husband joined the class about farming and farming projects. After the course, he applied his knowledge and expanded the farm to improve family economy. After 4 years of operation, Mrs. H. and her husband is having a well-equipped farm with a variety of plants, 100 pigs and 1000 chickens. This time, she and her husband want to borrow 1150 USD to invest more in the farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 36 años de edad, por muchos años ella se dedico a tejer ropa típica para mujer (güipiles), pero esta actividad no le dejaba muchas ganancias, y tomaba mucho tiempo recuperar su inversión.  Desde hace cuatro años, su negocio es la fabricación y venta de ropa o trajes de lana para niños, este negocio si le deja mejores ganancias y gracias a Dios ha ayudado a salir adelante.  Ella lamentablemente no pudo estudiar, pero esta conciente de la importancia de que sus hijos puedan estudiar y superarse en el futuro, en la actualidad tiene 6 hijos.   Su sueño es mejorar su situación económica, mejora la condición de su vivienda, y ayudar económicamente a su esposo quien se dedica a la actividad de agricultura.
texts.en:
Patricia is 36 years old. For many years she was dedicated to sewing typical women clothing ("güipiles"), but this activity did not leave her with many earnings and it took her a long time to recover her investment. Since four years ago her business has been making and selling wool clothes and pants for children. This business gives her better earnings and, thanks to God, has helped her improve her life. She unfortunately could not study but she is aware of how important it is for her kids to be able to study and succeed in the future. Presently, she has six children. Her dream is to improve their economic situation, improve their living conditions, and economically assist her husband, who works in agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make wool clothing

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Doncellas”, ubicado en la calle 22 Mz. 22 Lt. 16 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 1 mayor de edad y 3 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una Motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. 

En la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio y también a la venta de lencería “ropa interior”. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes a repartir sus productos y a confeccionar la ropa interior para vender a sus clientes. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara 10 metros de tela algodón de diferentes colores y productos de belleza.

Gracias a Menuela Ramos su negocio ha mejorado y ahora podrá darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to the "Las Doncellas" Communal Bank, located on the 22nd street Mz. 22 Lt. 16 AA.HH Primavera Second Stage, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 39 years old, is the mother of 4 children, 1 grown-up and 3 that still depend on her. She is married and her husband drives a motocar. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), Lidia decided to invest in selling beauty products.

Currently, she continues with this business and also sells lingerie and underwear. In the mornings, she is dedicated to her household chores and in the afternoons, she delivers her products and makes the lingerie to sell to her customers. With this loan of 2000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid back in 5 months, Lidia will buy 10 meters of cotton fabrics in different colors and beauty products.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business has improved and now she will be able to provide her children with a better education


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy fabrics and beauty products

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto es una persona muy trabajadora tiene su propio negocio de soldadura llamado "Servicios M." el esta solicitando este credito para realizar unos pagos a proveedores y para compra de material para que su negocio siga creciendo y darles a sus clientes mejor calidad en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto M. is a very hard-working person who has his own welding business called “Servicios M..” He is requesting this loan in order to pay his suppliers and purchase materials so that his business can continue to grow and he can offer his customers better work quality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay suppliers and purchase materials

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y su hija. Ella vende cosméticos desde hace más de un año, los reparte al crédito a sus amistades y personas que considera de confianza, sus clientes son principalmente profesionales de la salud que laboran en los hospitales, después los busca en su centro de trabajo periódicamente para cobrarles, de esta manera logra un ingreso más en su hogar. Su esposo también trabaja, pero muchas veces el sueldo no es suficiente. Mercedes actualmente está embarazada, y no puede caminar mucho, sin embargo, para no perder sus ventas está siendo apoyada por algunos familiares. Es la primera vez que Mercedes solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal por ser una persona responsable. Con esta cantidad de dinero podrá invertir en la compra de más cosméticos para aprovechar esta fiesta navideña.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 39 years old and she lives with her husband and her daughter. She has been selling cosmetics for over a year. She distributes them on credit to her friends and to people she considers reliable. Her clients are mainly health professionals who work in the hospitals, and afterward she periodically meets them in their workplace to collect payment. This is how she generates more income for her household. Her husband also works, but oftentimes his salary is not enough. Mercedes is pregnant right now and she cannot walk much; nevertheless, in order not to lose out on sales, her relatives are helping to support her. This is the first time that Mercedes is requesting a loan with MFP. She was invited to become part of her communal bank because she is a responsible person. With this amount of money, she will be able to invest in buying more cosmetics in order to take advantage of the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Allakhshukur

texts.en:
Allakhshukur K. is a 48-year-old barber who runs his own barber shop in the small village of Sabirabad. He is married with two adorable children. His job is the only financial source for his family, and that’s why Allakhshukur spends most of his day in the barber shop. He comes to work at 8 and finishes at 11 at night. Most of his clientele are males from age 3 to 70.

Allakhshukur dreams of opening his own big barber shop with several master barbers in it and of being the leading master barber in the whole city. For the first step he would like to improve conditions in his shop and for this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. With this loan he will purchase new modern barber tools and will make a small repair to his barber shop.

loans.use: purchase modern barber tools and improve conditions in his barber shop

loans.name: Sognon Hermine

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
D. Sognon Hermine s’est mariée avec KEHOUNDE Mathias et ils ont deux enfants qui s’appellent Aurore et Landry, tous les deux scolarisés. Hermine vend le divers depuis 9 ans et elle a ajouté les cartes de recharges. Le revenu de ses derniers crédits lui a permis d’acheter les biens durables et les pagnes, des vêtement traditionnelle béninoise, et aussi les accessoires de ses activités. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait commencer par vendre les cartes de recharges en gros.
texts.en:
Sognon Hermine D. is married to Mathias KEHOUNDE, and they have two children named Aurore and Landry, both in school. Hermine has been selling various goods for 9 years, and she has added rechargeable phone cards to her array. The income generated from her previous loans allowed her to buy durable goods, pagnes (traditional Beninese clothing), and also accessories for her business. In the future, she would like to begin selling rechargeable phone cards in bulk. The meaning of ALIDE in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a path for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500. ALIDE offers special zero-interest loans to highly vulnerable people, and it is part of a group that will soon launch a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell various goods

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: Carmela tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y su hija quien es madre soltera, ellos viven en su casa propia. La señora Carmela es una mujer multifacética laboralmente porque se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, bebidas heladas, condimentos al por menor y a la confección de prendas de vestir, actividades que realiza desde hace 6 años atrás, pero ella no trabaja sola ya que en su negocio la ayudan su pareja y su hija, quienes son los encargados de ir a dejar los productos que ella vende a los clientes que lo solicitan en un mercado cerca de su casa. Lo que le gusta a Carmela de la diversidad de trabajos que posee es que la hacen sentir muy útil, además que lo considera muy rentable ya que tiene ingresos a diario. Ella tiene planes de seguir trabajando y posteriormente quiere poner un minimarket donde pueda ofrecer gran cantidad de productos y así satisfacer todas las necesidades de su clientela. Ella ha tenido 6 préstamos en MFP y ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, además le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal, ya que ha hecho muy buenas amigas ahí. Carmela  quiere comprar abarrotes en lo cual gastara 500 soles, además de telas para la confección de ropas lo que costará otros 500 soles  y lo que sobre lo invertirá para el arreglo de su casa.
texts.en:
Carmela is 45 years old, lives with her partner and her daughter who is a single mother; they live together in their own home. Carmela is a multifaceted worker because she sells groceries, cold beverages, condiments at retail and makes items of clothing, which she has been doing for 6 years. But she doesn’t work alone in her business, her partner and daughter are in charge of delivering the products that she sells to her customers in a market near their home. What Carmela likes is the diversity of the jobs that she has because they make her feel useful, in addition profitable as she has daily income. She has plans to continue working and then wants to open a minimarket where she can offer a great variety of products and in this way satisfy all her customer’s needs. She has had 6 loans with MFP and has been very punctual with her payments; in addition she likes to work with the communal bank and has made very good friends there. Carmela wants to buy groceries which will cost 500 soles, in addition to fabric to make clothing that will cost another 500 soles and the remaining she will invest in repairing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин еще не женат, но молодой и полон сил и энергии. Он торгует  продуктами питаниями: сахар, соль спички, и другими хозяйственными товарами. Товар ему привозит отец, он помогает ему со снабжением товара. В бизнесе ему также помог родственник. Он взял его в качестве помощники продавца. Со временем и его отец решил что он может и сам работать с торговлей. Так он и  получил очередной кредит  и продолжает свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Kamoliddin is still single, but he is young and full of strength and energy. He sells grocery products, such as sugar, salt, matches and other household products. His father delivers the goods and helps Kamoliddin with the goods supply. Another relative also helps Kamoliddin with the business. Kamoliddin hired him to be a sales assistant. Soon his father too decided that he can work in sales. He received his next loan and continues to build his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
K. Mahbuba is a school teacher by professional background but she had to start her business because a teacher’s salary is too low. Mahbuba is engaged in street selling (sunflower seed, packages, etc.).

Mahbuba wants to earn money in order to start a serious business opening a national restaurant, so she is ready to work hard. She knows many people who, thanks to their hard work, were able to open a serious business.

Today Mahbuba applies to Kiva for business financial support in the loan of 2,000 STJ to purchase ice-cream and drinks for the coming season. She thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To purchase ice-cream and drinks for resale

loans.name: Maame Aba

texts.en:
Since 2002 Maame Aba W. has worked as a trader selling oil at Sekondi Tadi near Shama Junction. She is married with three children and has received no formal education. While she works as a trader, her husband is employed as a farmer. Maame Aba is responsible for helping assist her husband with the family’s various expenses and with the upkeep of the household.

Maame Aba’s loan will be used to purchase additional oil for sale and she hopes to start saving the new profits from her expanded business. The containers shown in the photo are what she buys the oil in. She then sell the oil in smaller quantities.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil for sale

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Баракаева  Мукаррам – женщина  53  лет,  замужем,  имеет  5-х  детей. Она  вместе  со  своим  мужем  Ортиковым  Абдугаффором  больше  двух  лет  занимается  продажей  сахара  и  макаронных  изделий  на  продовольственном  рынке  Спитаменского  района.  В  начале  своей  деятельности  она  брала  товар  под  реализацию  у  оптовиков.  Благодаря  нашему  кредиту  она  получила  возможность  ездить  в  город  Худжанд  и  покупать  товар  за  наличность  по  выгодным  ценам.  Два  её  старших  сына  помогают  ей  привозить  товар,  а  старшая  дочь  помогает  ей  по  хозяйству.  Мукаррам  очень  рада  сотрудничеству  с  нами  и  благодарна  нашим  кредиторам  за  помощь  в  осуществлении  её  планов.
texts.en:
Mukarram B. is a 53-year-old woman, who is married and has five children. For more than two years, Mukarram and her husband Abdugaffor Ortikov have sold sugar and pasta at the Spitamen regional food market. In the early days of her business, Mukarram purchased her products from the wholesalers. Thanks to a MicroInvest loan, she was able to travel to the town of Khujand, where she got a good price by paying cash for the products. Her two oldest sons assist her in keeping the shelves stocked, and her oldest daughter helps with the housework. Mukarram is pleased to collaborate with MicroInvest and grateful to the lenders for their assistance in bringing her plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89343&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Rosa Maria es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz
Se dedica   reparto  diario menú, solo trabaja por las mañanas, su clientela ha aumentado, también por las tardes se dedica al  bordando en lentejuelas y al tejido a crochet por las tardes, que le esta generando una entrada mas.
En Finca, aprendió ahorrar pudo, salir de sus deudas que tenia, esta contenta de estar en el Bancomunal.
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de víveres al por mayor para la preparación de su menú, arroz azúcar, aceite. El sueño que tiene Rosa es que su negocio sea propio, donde ella lo pueda administrar
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89343&_tpos=... Rosa Maria is a member of the Maria de la Paz Community Bank. She delivers meals daily. She only does this in the mornings. Her customers have increased. Also, in the afternoons she does embroidery with sequins and crocheted knitwear. This is generating another income. In Finca she has learned to save and get out of the debt she had. She is happy to be in her Community Bank. She needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy wholesale supplies like rice, sugar, and oil to prepare her meals. The dream she has is that the business will be her own, and that she can be the one to run it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies wholesale

loans.name: Sesawi B1 Group

texts.en:
Oktofianus T. is a 35 year old man. He leads SESAWI B1 Group - a group of 8 farmers in Usapi Sonbai Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Oktofianus has been living in this village since he was a child. His parents are only poor farmers who couldn’t afford to send him to the high school. As a result, Oktofianus only has a primary education. 

Oktofianus is a married man with one child aged 10 months. Due to the low level of education that Oktofianus has, he can not get a better permanent job in the city. This is the reason why Oktofianus works as a farmer who plants corn, peanuts and vegetables to pay for his family's needs. The biggest challenge for Oktofianus is the increasing of prices in the market that makes it difficult for him to support his family. His income generated from farming is not enough to cover all of his family's needs. 

The difficulties that Oktofianus faces have motivated him to find another way to support his family. One of the alternatives that has become his preference is to fatten cattle because of the high demand and good price for the fattened cattle. To fatten cattle Oktofianus needs capital to buy the young cattle and he can not afford it as a poor farmer. 

This is the reason why Oktofianus is interested in joining the cattle fattening program with the other group members. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,200,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened for 12 months. Oktofianus hopes that through the cattle fattening program he will be able to cover all of his family needs. The other group members are also requesting a loan as they want to improve their living standard. 
Note: When the group picture was taken, Erny and Fransina were replaced by their family member.

loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danelia del Carmen Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 58 años, habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , ya todos independientes , los tres son docentes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar la vivienda , ella desde hace 20 años tiene a cargo el cafetín del Instituto de Ticuantepe y a la vez le proporciona el alimento a los docentes , ella inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos .  Con el financiamiento va incrementar su inventario en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, productos lácteos, golosinas y otras variedades de productos para atender bien a su cliente. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los préstamos ya que ha logrado permanecer en las ventas. Este es su sexto ciclo y espera seguir trabando y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Danelia del Carmen Rodríguez is 58 years of old. She lives in the neighborhood of Medardo Andino in the town of Ticuantepe. She is married and has three adult children, who are all teachers. Together with her husband, they support each other with the household expenses. She plans to make improvements to her family’s home. For 20 years she has been in charge of the cafeteria at the Instituto de Ticuantepe where she prepares food for the faculty members. She started this business of her own initiative.

She will use her loan to increase her inventory by purchasing basic grains, meats, dairy products, sweets and other varieties of products to serve her customers well. Thanks to the support of her loans from AFODENIC she has managed to maintain her sales. This is her sixth loan and hopes to continue working and strengthening her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meat, and sweets for preparing meals

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 34 year-old married man with five children. Anwar owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by it. Currently he is seeking a loan of 2,500 USD to purchase more inventory so he can increase the variety of goods he offers.

Anwar had some struggles when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all those challenges pretty well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia B. C. es una señora de 40 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Doña Sonia se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a las labores del hogar y también asistiendo a su esposo en agricultura, pero hace poco tiempo tuvo la idea de crear una sala de entretenimiento en su casa para que los vecinos de su comunidad se divirtieran de una forma sana. Desde que inició el proyecto ha tenido muy buena aceptación en su comunidad, ha podido adquirir maquinas de juegos electrónicas, futbolines entre otros.

Debido a que su negocio va tan bien, doña Sonia desea obtener un préstamo por ¢585,000 (quinientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar una máquina más de juegos electrónicos para así aumentar su clientela y ofrecer más variedad . 

Doña Sonia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Sonia B. C. is 40 and lives with her husband and two children in a community called El Saíno de Pital, which is located in the province of Alajuela. The main economic activities here are livestock and agriculture, most notably the production of pineapple. The pineapple is mainly sold to international markets. For this reason, the development of the community has grown in recent years, generating a larger demand for products and services, which helps to mitigate the effect of immigration. Doña Sonia has dedicated a large part of her life to working in her home, and she also helps her husband with agriculture. She recently had the idea of creating an entertainment room in her home so her neighbors could have fun in a healthy way. Since she started this project, it has been very well accepted in her community. She has been able to acquire video game machines, foosball tables, and other things. Since her business is going so well, Sonia hopes to obtain a loan of 585,000 colones to buy more video game machines so she can expand her clientele and offer more variety. Sonia is a member of the communal bank, "Luz del Futuro Saino," one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan, and with it she hopes to continue to grow on a personal and economic level. She also stresses that she is thankful to this type of organization and easier ways to access credit so she can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a video game machine

loans.name: Cecile

texts.fr: Cécile Manga est une femme de 47 ans, elle est célibataire et a 5 enfants en charge. Depuis 8 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ALWAR dont elle est la trésorière. Avec ce prêt elle développe un petit commerce de tissu. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de cette activité lui permettent d'assurer la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants et de leur offrir de meilleures conditions de vie.

loans.use: Renforcer ses capacités d'autofinancement

loans.name: Deng

texts.en:
C. is 24 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the busy local market for more than nine years. She buys the fish from a wholesale supplier and other fishermen. 

C. is married to Sarin, age 29, who sells the water for a profit. He pumps water from wells to sell to his neighbors in the village. Because selling water is a profitable business for family, C. has requested a loan to purchase a small truck with a barrel for her husband's business. He will use the truck to improve the good service that he provides.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck with barrel

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeurn T., who lives in Deum Por village in Takeo Province, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Because she lacks sufficient funds, she is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds for cultivation and more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Ong Nhorn, shown on the left of the photo, helps her on the farming. Mrs. Savoeurn T. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for cultivating.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: A. Cécile est née en 1973 et réside depuis dix ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cécile s’est mariée à YEHO Antonin, un conducteur de taxi- moto. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cécile est une analphabète et s’est très tôt mise dans la vente de grandes cuillères de tous genres. En effet, Cécile vend de façon ambulante depuis trente ans des cuillères à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile achète ces articles à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Cécile a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Pour agrandir son commerce et réaliser plus d’économies, Cécile s’est rapprochée encore une fois de ALIDé pour obtenir un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
A. Cécile is born in 1973 and has been living in the Cadjehoun neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin for ten years. She is married to YEHO Antonin, a moto-taxi driver. The couple has two children, all in school and at their expense. Cécile is an illiterate and she started very early in the sale of various types of large spoons. Infact, Cécile has been selling the spoons from door to door in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, for thirty years. Cécile buys these items at Abomey, the historic town of Benin. Cecile already obtained three loans from ALIDé that she repaid correctly. To grow her trade and make more savings, Cecile once again approached ALIDé to obtain a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking utensils( laddle, various types of spoons, forks, etc)

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a married woman with three children. She has been working as a private nurse since 2000 to provide, along with her husband, better life conditions for her family. She's a very hardworking woman who likes to help people.

Today, Jeanette is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a small car to help her in her work travel and be able to arrive on time to the patients.

loans.use: To buy a small car

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa G. is 49 years old and a resident of Barangay Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is married to Romeo G. who is 50 years old and who is a local laborer in their village. They are blessed with eight grown up children The first four of her children are high school graduates and already married, while the others are still studying. Jesusa hopes that through her business and her husband’s source of income, they will be able to provide all the needs of their children, especially when it comes to their education.

Jesusa is a hog raiser. She wants her hogs to grow healthy so she can sell them at higher prices. Another source of income Jesusa manages is her vending business. She sells vegetables in their village and generates a profit of $38 a month. This is a good business for her because it is where her family gets their daily expenses. She always hopes to further expand her business to provide sufficient support for her family. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP. This amount will assist her in providing the hogs with enough feed for their growth and also be used for her vegetable vending business.

loans.use: additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Oluwaseyi

texts.en: Oluwaseyi is 35 years old and married with 3 children. He sells motor parts in a location which is very favorable for most of his customers. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife is a nurse and they both contribute to supporting the family. With the loan of NGN 100,000, he plans to expand his business of selling motor parts. Most of the challenges he faces in his business are related to capital; he believes that with enough capital he will get a large quantity of good quality goods to help him increase his sales. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married. She is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo where she works in the local mall selling gifts and other retail items. Ganna has been in this business for 10 years. Her venture has grown up to 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory and about 4,000 Grivnyas in monthly profit. 

Ganna is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to diversify assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her outlet. This type of inventory is always in demand, especially during the holiday season. Ganna is hoping to generate additional income to spoil her family this Christmas.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Owadis

texts.en: Owadis is a 30-year-old single man. He has owned a beauty salon since 2005, with 12 years of experience in this field. He caters to a wide range of clientele in his village and its neighborhoods. Today, Owadis wishes to improve the decor of his salon and expand his business. In order to do so, Owadis is requesting $1,200.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his salon and expand his business.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Presently, K. operates her own small handicraft business, mainly weaving rattan baskets and cupboards. She has a son who assists her weaving and selling rattan. K. has requested a loan of US $1000. She will use half of her loan to buy a trailer-motor in order to deliver her products to sell. With the remaining loan, she will buy a small grilling-rice machine to provide a service. 

K., 60 years old, is a good mother blessed with six children. (K. was not available when the photo was taken so her son is shown instead.) Half of her children are married and the remaining three are single. They all work at different occupations. K. was married and her husband died of senility many years ago.

loans.use: To buy a trailer-motor in order to deliver her products

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
D. Trương Thị is a 34-year old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. D. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 2 - Nhóm 04 (Nhóm 04).

D. is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, D. owns and operates a business selling home products. The main source of business income comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. D. has worked in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,200,000 Viet Nam Dong (VND) a month.

D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. D. is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from SEDA. D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Cao Thị H. is a 46-year old woman who is requesting a  5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.
2.  Mẫn Thị T. is a 27-year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her handicraft business.
3.  Trương Thị T. is a 33-year old woman who is requesting a  5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.
4.  Trương Thị H. is a 26-year old woman who is requesting a  5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

D. Trương Thị (20203020013) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 2 - Nhóm 04 (Nhóm 04).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm gia dụng cá nhân cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa pH..  D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND.  D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.
Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Cao Thị H. (20203020014) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

2.  Mẫn Thị T. (20203020016) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

3.  Trương Thị T. (20203020017) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

4.  Trương Thị H. (20203020018) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam.

Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding their businesses.

loans.name: Mrs. Sro Try Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who live in Trapeang Angk village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan. They will use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Sro Try is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer and pig breeder. In her rice farming, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support her field and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food for her pigs.

Her husband, Mr. Tev Neang, is a bicycle rickshaw driver who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sro Try is a mother of three children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and also pig food for her pigs.

loans.name: Kaosara

texts.en: Kaosara is married to a commercial driver and they have a child. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She is determined to excel in her business and family life. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers, who are usually friends and local residents. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Twegate A Tuhirwe Stella Group

texts.en: Stella T. , a 31-year-old hardworking businesswoman, is the married mother of three children, all going to school. For the past two years she has been selling spare bicycle parts and is requesting the loan to purchase additional spare parts from Kampala to sell to her customers. The extra capital will allow her to expand her business and earn better profits, bringing her closer to realizing her dream of fully educating her children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts from Kampala to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.en:
Rosalina S., from the village of Lawis, is the 43-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalina, who is married to a train operator, owns a fishing boat which is operated by her neighbor. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from PMPC, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 48,000 PHP to purchase additional additional fishing equipment and to use as working capital. Rosalina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda C. is from the village of Kalasungay, Valencia City. She is 53 years old. Luzminda is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a specialized retail store selling firewood and charcoal in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily A., aged 39, is from the village of Andarayan North, Solana, Cagayan. She is the group leader of a 26-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Emily is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

Emily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI. Emily is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tukwatilewamu Group, Jinja

texts.en:
To get into her customers good graces, 45 year old N. Zaituni had to improve her customer relationship skills. It was thirteen years ago when she came to terms with this fact. Since then her hotel (restaurant) business has obtained a firm footing in the heart of Jinja.

Before enforcing these measures to give her business a new lease of life, Zaituni’s business was fraught with all sorts of image problems. This was mostly due to the fact that most of the workers she hired had minimal training in good customer care. At length, this married mother of five buoyant children has never lived to regret her decision to train all her workers. Her business has been strengthened as a result.

Zaituni’s journey into business began with a small farming venture that she later dispensed with. Honesty and determination have gotten her far in this business, as she currently makes 100,000 shillings, a week. With this loan, she wants to purchase more foods for her hotel.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for her restaurant

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers who live in a commune of Siem Reap Province. Its leader, Mrs. In S., 55, has been fisH. with her husband for twenty years so they have much experience in this sector. This couple can make their daily income of $4 a day to help solve their family’s financial crisis.

In S. has given birth to four children, two of whom are married while the other two are single and help with their parents' fisH.. In S. requests a loan to buy more fisH. tools which she will use to increase her productivity. 

The other three borrowers also operate fisH. businesses. 
Mrs. H. needs a loan to purchase more tools for fisH..
Mrs. S. is applying for a loan to buy nets and traps for fisH..
Mrs. S. will be using a Kiva loan for capital in order to buy tools for her fisH. activities. 

Note: Mrs. S. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice and sugar

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man Y., 60, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Y. sells chickens and vegetables for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband buys and sells motorbike, earning an income of USD 3 per day. 

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for resale

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Natif de Koutiala, Monsieur Seydou C. est âgé de 30 ans,  mariée et père de 3 enfants. Il est polygame et vit avec ses femmes et ses enfants dans le quartier  Darsalam II de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Il n’a pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, c’est ainsi qu’il embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père depuis son jeune  âge et l’exerce pour lui-même il y a 10 ans.  Il est très bien sollicité par ses clients,  car les friperies sont moins coûteuses et sont de  meilleure qualité très appréciée au Mali. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Monsieur C. a fait recours à   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  premier prêt.  
Avec ce prêt  il compte acheter, 5 balles de friperies au Burkina Faso. Il effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala sous son hangar, à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes essentiellement au comptant. 
Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA  pour subvenir à ses besoins à savoir le remboursement du prêt, satisfaire les charges de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Dans les jours à venir, il envisage agrandir son activité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
A native of Koutiala, Mr. Seydou C. is 30 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He is polygamous and lives with his wives and children in the Darsalam II neighborhood of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). He did not attend school for social reasons. Thus, he took up his father's line of business at a young age and has operated it for himself for 10 years. He is much sought after by his customers because the less costly and better quality second-hand clothing is much appreciated in Mali. In order to satisfy customer demand, Mr. C. turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, where he has his first loan. He plans to buy 5 bales of second-hand clothing at Burkina Faso with this loan. He conducts his sales principally in cash at the large market in Koutiala under his shed roof to a clientele composed of women and men. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA to support himself; namely, to repay the loan, to provide for his family and to invest the rest in his business. In the future, he plans to expand his buiness in order to attract more customers.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Aireen's Group

texts.en:
Aireen T. is from the village of Taboc Sur Oroq. City Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, single, and has 1 infant-aged child. Aireen owns and operates a specialized retail store which sells dry goods in the local community. Aireen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years.

Aireen is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2010, Aireen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aireen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aireen is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to expand her  business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Aireen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Juana Virginia

texts.es: Juana Virginia O. R. de 55 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable, la cual se esfuerza a diario para poder contar con su sustento y todo lo necesario para su hogar. Ella es una persona soltera quien tampoco tiene hijos, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Juana se dedica a la venta de pescado, así mismo elabora tortillas, las cuales comercializa en su casa de habitación. Juana es una persona muy conocida en la zona ya que cuenta con muchos años de dedicarse a este oficio. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, así mismo comprar tambos de gas propano para contar con una pequeña provisión de estos, ya que en muchas ocasiones este escasea durante el año, de esta misma forma ella comprará mayor cantidad de pescado el cual también comercializa en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Juana Virginia O. R., 55, is a very hardworking, responsible woman who struggles daily to earn support for her household. She is single and doesn’t have any children. She lives in Puerto El Triunfo in Usulután Department. Juana sells fish but also makes tortillas that she sells from home. She is very well known in the area because she’s been in this line of work for many years. She is asking for funds to buy a larger amount of corn as well as tanks of propane gas in order to have a small supply of them because often it becomes scarce during the year. She also wants to buy larger amounts of fish which she also sells from home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale and to buy propane gas.

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana lives in Gujranwala which is a well-known industrial city in Pakistan. She is a 40-year-old lady who married A. H. nineteen years ago; she has been living in Gujranwala since her marriage. She is the mother of five daughters and two sons. Four out of seven are receiving an education. It is not possible for Shabana to send all of her children to school with her current financial situation.

Shabana’s eldest son drives a rickshaw. He left his education after completing his 8th standard and decided to work to contribute to the family financially. Shabana supports her family by doing sewing and embroidery work. She deals with good number of clients and receives regular orders.

Shabana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s shoe-making business. With the loan, her husband will buy items such as leather, a shoe polisher and nails in large quantity to fulfill his larger orders on time. He receives orders from different factories and shoe shops.

Shabana is very confident that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and that her family will be able to improve their living standard. This is her 2nd loan.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy required items for his shoe-making business

loans.name: Saada

texts.en: Saada  is a married lady with four children.  For the past ten years, she has been selling fabric.  Her business is located in Kibera slum in Nairobi (capital city of Kenya).  Therefore, most of her customers are low income earners.  Besides fabric, she sells tea leaves.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to set up her current business and she is now getting big orders.  She dreams of importing fabric from the Asian market in the future. She has requested 60,000 Kes to buy fabric and leso (Africa design fabric).

loans.use: To buy fabric and leso (Africa design fabric)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary L. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, two of whom are in school. Mary has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for 3 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Mary sells her products from home, by means of wholesale.

Mary has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chicken feed. She also generates additional income through farming. The main business challenge(s) for Mary include transportation of chicken feed and poultry diseases. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 1000 chickens and also to own a delivery van for transporting chicken feed. Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Kipailoi

texts.en:
