Kipailoi Ole M. is 45-years-old. He is married and a father of four children, aged between three and twenty-three years. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the past twelve years.

Kipailoi learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member in KADET. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend forty thousand KES to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his already growing wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Kipailoi's dream is to do large scale farming, attain financial independence and to improve the living standard of his family. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru: Бобомуротов Джуманазар проживает в районе Кубадиян. Возраст, 51 год. Женат. Имеет 10 детей. Образование среднее. Имеет собственную мастерскую, где ремонтирует DVD и другие аппаратуры. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 20 лет. Джумаразар берет повторный кредит. Целью кредита является закуп новых запчастей аппаратуры.
texts.en: Jumanazar B. lives in Kubadiyan region. He is 51 years old and is married with ten children. Jumanazar has secondary education. He has his own workshop where he repairs DVDs and other electronics. He has been in this business for twenty years. Dzhumarazar is applying for his second loan, which he is planning to use for the a purchase of new spare parts for electronics.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for electronics

loans.name: Irshaad Zubair Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is a caring lady who stays at home to carry out her responsibilities as a housewife. Her husband's name is Z. A. and he operates a dairy business. He runs a shop in the market from where he sells a good quantity of milk everyday and earns a good income.
Irshaad lives in the small city of Okara, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area of Mehoob town. She moved there four months ago with her family. She is a mother of four children but she could not provide them with an education due to limited financial resources.
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially assist her husband in his dairy business. With the loan, he will buy another dairy cow which will increase his milk production, enabling him to serve more customers. Irshaad is hopeful that with the loan investment, her husband will be able to get positive financial results from his business.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Irshaad.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a young Palestinian man from Jenin. He has an auto repair workshop that he has been working in for a long time. Recently, Muhannad started fixing the cross-arm in cars, which connects the engine and the drive wheel. This work turned out to be very rewarding so he decided to start selling this part of the car as well as fixing it.

Muhannad came to FATEN for a loan to finish constructing the warehouse next to his workshop where he wants to keep the cross-arms. Muhannad's idea is the only one in Jenin. Usually people have to purchase the part from other places, such as Israel, which is very expensive.

Muhannad is a father of two daughters and one son and appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To build a warehouse to store car parts

loans.name: Anlly

texts.es: Anlly A. V. es una joven emprendedora que vive con su madre en un kiosco cerca a la cancha de futbol del barrio San Fernando en Cartagena. Allí vende cervezas, gaseosas, agua en bolsa, jugos y pasabocas. El negocio comenzó con un viejo enfriador prestado y algunas bebidas que compró con el préstamo de un familiar. Con las primeras utilidades obtenidas compró el enfriador y acondicionó el kiosco para vivir con alguna comodidad. Este es el segundo préstamo que la microempresaria tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de refrescos y mecatos. Los días de mayores ventas son los sábados, domingos y festivos. En promedio las ventas semanales ascienden a $ 500.000 y el margen de utilidad es del 30%. La señora Anlly dice que se decidió a iniciar el negocio por sugerencia de su mamá y ante el desespero de no conseguir empleo después de haber terminado sus estudios de secundaria. En un futuro desea vender también almuerzos porque sus clientes así se lo han solicitado y desde ya está ahorrando para comprar las sillas, las mesas y los utensilios de cocina que necesitará. Por estar el negocio al lado de una cancha de futbol,  Anlly manifiesta que se ha convertido en una experta asesora de los directores técnicos que visitan su negocio y muchos le piden su consejo para determinar la alineación de los equipos. A ella le encanta el futbol  y no es extraño verla gritar desde su kiosco dándoles instrucciones a los jugadores de su onceno favorito.  Con el fruto de su trabajo y el apoyo de la Fundación, Anlly sueña con tener una casa propia para independizar su negocio del hogar y con el entusiasmo que ésta joven le imprime a todas sus metas, seguro lo logrará.
texts.en:
Anlly A. V. is an enterprising young woman who lives with her mom in a kiosk near a soccer field in San Fernando neighborhood, in Cartagena.  There she sells beer, soda, water, juice and sandwiches.  She started her business with an old, borrowed cooler and some drinks that she bought with a loan from a family member.  She used her first profits to buy the cooler and adapt the kiosk so that she could live with some comfort.

This is Anlly's second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying soft drinks and snacks.  Her best days for sales are Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.  Her average weekly sales rise to 500,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 30%.  Anlly says that she decided to start this business at her mom's suggestion and because she couldn't manage to get a job after she finished high school.

In the future, Anlly would like to sell lunches as well because her customers have requested them.  She is already saving up to buy chairs, tables and the cooking utensils that she will need.  As her business is beside a soccer field, Anlly tells us that she has become an expert advisor to the technical directors who visit her business and many of them seek her advice in determining their team line-ups.  Anlly loves soccer and it isn't unusual to see her shouting from her kiosk, giving the players from her favorite team instructions.  Through her own hard work and the support of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Anlly dreams of having her own home so that she can separate her business from her home and, judging by the enthusiasm that this young woman puts into achieving all her goals, we are sure that she will be successful.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Nesfora

texts.en: To make a living, Nesfora A. owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Dban, Calamba, Mis. Occ. Nesfora has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Nesfora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Nesfora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for a restaurant

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: EL Sr. Eleuterio R. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como conductor de una ambulancia en el municipio desde hace 14 años, cabe mencionar que el Sr. R. también se dedica a la agricultura  en donde cosecha maíz y frijoles en su propia finca ubicada en el municipio. Es casado y con cinco hijos a los que trata de brindarles un mejor nivel de vida. Una de las necesidades que tiene este señor es adquirir insumos necesario para la siembra de granos como maíz y frijoles, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener ingresos gracias a la comercialización de los mismos para darles un mejor nivel de vida a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Eleuterio Ramirez is from the town of El Sauce.  He has worked there as an ambulance driver for 14 years.  Mr. Ramirez is also a crop farmer and grows corn and beans on his own farm located in the town.

He is married with five children for whom he tries to provide the best lifestyle.  He needs to buy seeds for his next corn and bean crops and is therefore requesting his third loan through Ceprodel.  He hopes to raise enough money from the crop sales to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: For personal expenses

loans.name: Susana Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Susana Tomasa H. H. D. S. se dedica a  la venta D. cómida y bebidas hace diez años aproximadamente, la solicitante vive con sus padres y su hijo mayor la cual ayuda con la canasta familiar.
Solicita el crédito por quiere ampliar su negocio comprando más mercadería y otras cosas adicionales para su negocio. Se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales además tiene experiencia acrediticia.
texts.en:
Susana Tomasa H. H. D. S. has been selling food and beverages for approximately ten years.  This loan applicant lives with her parents and her oldest son, who helps her pay the family's bills.

She is applying for the loan because she wants to buy more merchandise and other items for her business in order to expand. It has been decided to grant her the loan because she has good business and personal references and has a good credit history.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alicia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doña Alicia, reside en San Miguel, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su hija de 23 años de edad, el negocio es la venta de pupusas, vende los días de martes a sábado, los domingos los dedica a vender hamacas que es otro negocio al cual le dedica solamente un día a la semana.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería tanto para hacer las pupusas como chicharrón, quesillo, aceite así también hamacas, esto contribuirá para que pueda contar con lo necesario y continuar en el negocio.
El sueño de doña Alicia es algún día a través del negocio pueda comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Doña Alicia, age 43, lives in San Miguel with her 23 year old daughter. She manages a business selling pupusas Tuesday through Saturday. On Sundays, she sells hammocks and manages this business only one day a week.

Alicia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making pupusas such as pork, cheese, and oil. In addition, she will buy hammocks so that she will have the necessary inventory to continue her business.

Through her business, Doña Alicia dreams of someday being able to buy her own home.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making "pupusas" & acquire hammocks to sell for her other business

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Soum L., age 47, is a fish seller in the busy market in Kompong Tom province. For many years she has been selling fish that she gets from her husband or buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen.  She is married to Vain Sophally, age 48, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. Soum L. always uses her old motorbike to pick up the fish to sell. Unfortunately, her existing motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Soum L. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to fix the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To fix her broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es: L. Sra. Margarita tiene 51 años D. edad es conviviente, y tiene 5 hijos, Margarita es integrante D. L. Alcancía Comunal "Somos Impacto 2006", Margarita trabaja desD. hace 20 años en L. confección y venta D. carteras D. tejido, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar y elL. deseaba darles lo mejor, es así que consiguió mayores ingresos trabajando día día sin descansar , se compro maquinas D. tejido y hoy en día cuenta con tres maquinas propias, a su vez a construido su casa. Margarita a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas D. tejer, sabemos que margarita cumplirá sus metas con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y que los prestamos D. D. EDAPROSPO le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Margarita, 51, has a life partner and five children.  She is a member of the “Somos Impacto 2006” (We Are Impact 2006) communal bank.  She has worked for over 20 years making knit purses for sale.  This work arose when her children started school and she wanted to proviD. the best for them so she earned higher income working day to day nonstop.  She bought knitting machines and today owns three; she also built her house.

Margarita is asking for a new loan to proviD. maintenance to her knitting machines.  We know that Margarita will meet her goals with much effort and dedication and that the EDPROSPO loans will help her.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to her knitting machines.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida M. works hard to support 9 children. She is married and has a business venture selling vegetables in the Philippines. Nida requested a loan of PHP 1,800 through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy an Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to reduce the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family. Nida is aware that by using the new cookstove, she will not only be saving money but she will also be helping the environment and reducing the health hazards for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit Cookstove

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria R.  is one of the members of the group Mujeres D. Debora 1 and 2, located in the city of Puerto Plata whose population is maD. up of Dominicans and Haitian migrants. The region's economy is dependent on the rum industry as well as tourism and real estate. 

Maria R. has been operating a business selling pigs for 10 years. She raises them and then sells them at an adult age or to a butcher shop. She raised 5 children while working selling food in her community, saving her profits and helping her husband. She tells us that her most difficult challenge was when her children traveled to Spain; they are still living there, studying with scholarships and working. One of Maria's dreams is to soon visit them in Spain.  

This is Maria's first loan with Esperanza. She is planning to use it to buy 4 young pigs. She also plans to use the income to reinvest in her business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy 4 pigs

loans.name: Hannah Wataku

texts.en:
Hannah Wataku W., 32 years old, has a one child, 14 years old, whom she single-handedly supports. 

She does livestock farming and sells milk for additional income as a secondary business. She has been in this business for 20 years.

She has applied for a loan that she will use to buy a cow to increase milk production. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase a plot where she will be able to expand her farming business. 

Hannah hopes to improve her living standards and become a prominent business lady.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jairo Vinicio

texts.es:
Jairo Vinico tiene 21 años, es soltero vive  con los padres  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar, no tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Jairo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios y ganado.

Le gusta trabajar en la tierra.
texts.en:
Jairo Vinico is 21 years old, single, has no children and lives with his parents in the Chillanes neighborhood, province of Bolívar.

The V.R.C. COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel Communal Bank is located in the Pailaloma area some 60 minutes from the office in the Chillanes neighborhood. The Bank is made up of 13 members who are in agriculture; they grow corn, potatoes and wheat.

Jairo is a farmer; he grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. He buys his products in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month and later sells them in the Sunday market of Chillanes.

He needs the loan to buy materials for his crops as well as fertilizers and manure. The loan will help Jairo economically to meet his needs and increase his production as he fights plagues, diseases and the change in climate that affects his crops.

Jairo's dream is to have his own plots of land and cattle.

He enjoys working the fields.

loans.use: buy materials for his crops as well as fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose owns S. Construction, Inc., a commercial sub-contracting firm specializing in concrete installation.  When Jose started this business three years ago, he was his firm’s only employee.  Now, Jose has 16 full-time employees and the capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously.  Jose began working in construction 17 years ago as a general laborer.  From there, he worked his way up through the construction industry, gaining experience in cost estimating and project management along the way.  

Jose has a degree in civil engineering from the University of Texas at El Paso (UTEP), which he earned while working full-time to support his family.  In the eight years that Jose was a student, he took a variety of odd jobs both within and outside of the construction industry.  Instead of going through the motions as he pursued his goal of becoming a civil engineer, Jose took every job as a learning opportunity and a chance for self-improvement.  For example, Jose credits working at Wal-Mart with building the customer service skills he uses daily as a small business owner.  

Recently, UTEP began offering graduate studies in construction management.  Jose wants to return to school part-time so that he can learn more about the financial side of project management.  He says that his educational and work experience to this point prepared him to design and implement projects, but that management and finance courses will make him a better business owner.

Jose is using this loan as operating capital for his business.  The construction industry in El Paso was really slow during the first few months of 2011.  In order to support himself and his employees, Jose says he rolled the dice in taking projects with several general contractors he otherwise wouldn’t.  The decision backfired when they didn’t pay on time, and Jose’s cash flow diminished to the point that it threatened his ability to pay upcoming bills.  As someone who stakes his reputation on punctuality, Jose decided to take out a small loan for operating capital until business picked up.  In addition to supplying Jose’s business with needed cash, it allows Jose to build his business’ credit.

Within the next two to three years, Jose wants to become a general contractor.  To do so, he says the business will need to expand its services and add expertise, which will take time.  In the meantime, Jose believes that there is enough demand for concrete installation that his business can continue expanding its presence as a subcontractor.  

S. Construction, Inc. is a family owned and operated business.   Jose employs his dad, who has 37 years of experience in the construction industry, as his chief superintendent of projects.  Jose’s wife, Monica, manages the business’ administrative work and finances.  For the time being, they run the business out of their home to keep operating costs low, though Jose anticipates needing to open an office if business continues growing.  Jose and Monica have three children.

loans.use: to make payroll until his next project and to build company's credit.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Lucia has operated a retail shop selling snacks, beverages and canned goods for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more of these items. Lucia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Karla Gabriela

texts.es: Karla Gabriela tiene 35 años. Ella es una joven con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Su ubicación es en su vivienda, en donde ya la conocen ciertos clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa, perfumes, electrodomésticos  entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que el día de mañana sus hijos puedan tener algo.
texts.en:
Karla Gabriela is 35 years old.  She’s a young woman with a great enterprising spirit.  Her economic activity is general merchandise sales.  She’s been in his humble business for over 8 years.  It’s located in her home where certain customers already know about her.  

The loan is for working capital, to buy footwear, clothing, perfume and home appliances, among other things.  Her dream is to do some home improvements so that her children can have something some day in the future.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothing, perfume and home applieances.

loans.name: Vevian

texts.en: Vevian is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Vevian has a computer shop that provides encoding, printing and repair of computers. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools needed for the repair services. Vevian is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Vevian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the repair services

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Carlota has been in this business for 27 years. Carlota earns more income from farming rice.

Carlota has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farming supplies.

loans.name: Torgom

texts.en:
Torgom lives in the Shirak region of Armenia, in the town of Artik.  He is married with two daughters (three and five years old).  He is a dentist and has been practicing for the past eight years.  In addition to supporting his family he takes care of his parents.  

Torgom hopes to open a separate dental practice.  He is looking for a loan to purchase new dental equipment.  He is pleased with the prices and customer service of microfinance.  He expects his business investment to increase his clients and income by fifteen percent.  He is proud of living in Artik and the friendly atmosphere of the town.

loans.use: to purchase dental equipment

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is fifty years old and married with three children aged fourteen to 25. He also takes care of two relatives.

For the past twenty years John has run a business in Kissy, a neighborhood in Freetown, where he rents and sells movie discs and tapes. He also earns income from renting out a house. John’s main challenge to his business is price inflation.

John has requested this 4,000,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more movie discs and tapes to sell. He says that the extra income will help him increase his savings massively.

In the future John would like to import movie discs and tapes.

loans.use: to purchase more movie discs and tapes to sell.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry is a single person. Gerry is 30 years old and lives in Katipunan,Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur.
Gerry has an abaca  (palm leaf) plantation and earns approximately PHP 6000 each month. He has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase farm inputs for his abaca plantation.PHP

Gerry has been a member of PMPC for almost eight months.In the future,Gerry hopes to earn more than PHP 6000 a month.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for his abaca plantation

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 50 years old, married and has 12 children, 5 of whom are in school.

Judith is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells Kenkeya, made from corn.  She is a single parent who takes care of 7 children.  Adjoa is responsible for the well-being of her home. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of corn.  Adjoa hopes to use the new profits to buy additional bags of corn to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 50-year-old man. He is married and has five sons. He has a store for clothing sales, which is the only source of income for the family. Mahmoud wants to purchase winter clothes in bulk to have a larger collection for sale, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. He needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Mahmoud gets the loan, he will be able to pay for the bulk purchase of winter clothes, so he will have a better collection to compete with others and sell more. His income will increase and he will have the ability to offer better living conditions for his family. 

Mahmoud is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es: Mariano, ha recibido un buen servicio crediticio, tiene la confianza de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su taller, ya que necesita un compresor, pues el que utilizaba se le fundió, dejándolo sin recursos para continuar funcionando en su taller. Estos préstamos le han ayudado para tener los recursos económicos y comprar lo necesario para llevar a cabo los trabajos que solicitan los clientes.
texts.en: Mariano has received good loan facilities and is confident in asking for a new loan to invest in his workshop. He needs a compressor as the one he used is broken leaving him without the necessary resources to continue running his workshop. These loans have helped him have economic resources and make the purchases needed to carry out the work requested by his customers.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Alma Yudith

texts.es:
señora Alma Yudith es madre soltera, tiene una hija, viven con sus padres, Alma se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, pan, paletas y comida, sus clientes son los niños del centro básico, maestros y vecinos de la zona, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo en las mañanas y las tardes. 
Doña Alma es una mujer luchadora y madre soltera que le ha tocado duro salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas, azucar, paletas, sorizantes, maiz, leña, harina y agua.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su hija.
texts.en: Alma Yudith is the single mother of a daughter, and she lives with her parents.  Alma has a business making tortillas, bread, popsicles and food.  Her customers are the children from a youth center, teachers, and neighbors from the area.  She makes her sales every day in the mornings and afternoons.  Alma is a tenacious woman and single mother who has had a tough time trying to get ahead.  She will use this loan to buy fruit, sugar, popsicles, flavorings, corn, firewood, flour and water.  She needs the earnings from this business to provide for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, popsicles, flavorings, corn, firewood, flour and water

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de entusiasta y amable, es separada, vive en compañía de su madre, padre y sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, a los que quiere mucho, instalados cómodamente en la casa de sus padres. 

La actividad que  realiza Gaby, es la repostería, preparación de tortas, pasteles, kekes, para eso instaló su negocio en la casa de sus padres, oficio que aprendió en un centro de capacitación en la ciudad de Lima. es así que se inicio con un capital propio, atendiendo pedidos, buffets, aniversario, quinceaños y demás actividades, contando con muy buena aceptación por la calidad de sus productos, ganándose la preferencias de sus clientes, negocio que lo tiene desde hace 7 años. 

Asimismo cuenta con la ayuda provisional de 5 personas en la preparación y atención de pedidos, a los que paga por día trabajado. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, incluso logrando comprarse algunos artefactos electrodomésticos, viendo la buena acogida, tiene planes de ampliar y hacer crecer su negocio.

Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, está agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio, y tener acceso a más créditos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal porque los considera buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios de repostería en cantidades como pisos acrílicos, moldes individuales que están de moda en los quinceaños y otras.
texts.en:
Gaby, 30 years-old, is a hardworking woman in addition to being enthusiastic and kind. She is separated and lives with her mother, father, and two children who are 10 and 8 years-old whom she loves very much and who are comfortably settled into her parent's home.

The activity that Gaby performs is confectionery, cake preparation, and making pies and cakes. Due to this she set up her business in her parent's home, a trade she learned in a training center in Lima. Like this she began with her own capital, taking orders, buffets, birthdays, girls' 15th birthdays, and other activities, and having very good success due to the quality of her products and winning her client's preference. She has had this business for seven years.

She also has the provisional help of five people in making and taking orders whom she pays daily for their work. What she likes about her activity is having a financial income to pay the household expenses, her children's education, and even managing to buy some electronic household devices. Seeing the good reception, she plans to expand and grow her business.

This will be the third loan with the MFP institution. She is thankful for the opportunity to rely on a line of credit to advance her business. For this reason she is committed to fulfilling the payments of her installments in order to have a good credit record and have access to more credit. Additionally she says that she feels good about her communal bank because she considers them to be good people. WIth the amount of 2000 PEN, she will invest in pastry accessories, such as acrylic layers and individual molds that are in demand for 15th birthdays and other events.

With the requested total of 2000 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying a lot of confectionery accessories like acrylic layers, individual molds that are fashionable for girls' 15th birthdays, and other things.

loans.use: to buy acrylic layers, individual molds, and other accessories for cakes.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe is 39 years old and an industrious father of three children. He is very enthusiastic to support his family through his farming business. With this kind of occupation, he is able to provide for his family's basic necessities, but is not be able to save for the education of his children. So, he is requesting a loan of P25,000 to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. He hopes to protect his business with his loan, earn sufficient income to educate his children, and improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated an oyster farm in the Philippines for 5 years. She earns additional income from selling dried fish. Marilou is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo, binders and other materials to repair her oyster farm.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo, binders and other materials to repair her oyster farm.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is applying for another loan through Yehu to expand her current business. She will use this 45,000 KES loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. In the future, Beatrice aspires to continue improving her business.

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Beatrice has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Madeleine Kohonou

texts.fr: Âgée de 39 ans, Madeleine Kohonou n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Madeleine Kohonou est mariée à un maçon du nom de Félicien. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Madeleine Kohonou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Madeleine Kohonou vend du riz et du sucre à son domicile depuis environ treize ans. De façon secondaire, Madeleine Kohonou vend des assiettes et de l'huile d'arachide ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Madeleine Kohonou s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Madeleine Kohonou devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Madeleine Kohonou sollicite pour la sixième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile d'arachide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys wants to buy bananas, mangoes oranges, Kales, cabbages, spinach and red peppers

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with three kids. She runs her own business selling children’s clothing in one of the local city markets in Zaporoshye. Tatyana has been in this trade for two years. Presently, she has about $3,000 of working capital and her monthly profit amounts to $600. There is a lot of competition from similar businesses in the market where Tatyana has her kiosk. However, her competitive prices and client-friendly service give her an advantage in comparison with many of the other typical businesses. Her integrity and determination have helped her enterprise to grow and be successful. Tatyana realizes that access to loans is important for her business. She is requesting $1,200 to increase her clothing inventory. A good array of child-oriented products will help Tatyana better serve the needs of her clients and increase her sales. Additional income will allow her to invest more in her family’s well-being and provide a better living for them which is her first priority in life.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї троє дітей. Вона займається бізнесом з продажу дитячого одягу на одному з місцевих ринків в місті Запоріжжі. Тетяна займається торгівлею вже два роки. Зараз в неї приблизно 3000 доларів робочого капіталу, її щомісячний прибуток складає 600 доларів. На ринку, де торгує Тетяна, працює багато таких підприємців. Однак, її невисокі ціни та привітне обслуговування вигідно виділять її з-поміж інших торговців. Порядність та наполегливість Тетяни допомагають її бізнесу зростати та процвітати. Тетяна розуміє, що кредитні послуги дуже допомагають її бізнесу. Вона просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів. Широкий вибір товарів для дітей допоможе Тетяні краще задовольняти попит клієнтів та збільшити обсяги продажів. Додатковий прибуток забезпечить статок її родини та покращить рівень їхнього життя, а для Тетяни нема нічого важливішого, ніж її родина.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married, she has a son of 9 years old and a little daughter of 4 years old. Ten years ago, when she and her husband saved money to get married, she started her business selling clothes. She did very well with her customers. Once married, she decided to continue her business because it provided a good income for later, to offer a better quality of living for her children.

Now, Susana is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to offer a better seasonal assortment to her customers, as this will increase her service to them. She commits to paying back the loan in 3 to 6 months.

Please become a part of Susana's accomplishments. She thanks you for your trust and your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana es casada y tiene un hijo de 9 años y una pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Hace diez años, cuando ella y su actual esposo ahorraban para poder casarse, ella inició su negocio con la venta de ropa, y le fue muy bien entre sus clientes, una vez casada decidió continuar porque recibía un buen ingreso que necesitaría después para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora Susana solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer más variedad de esta temporada a sus clientes y dar un mejor servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en los logros de Susana, ella agradece tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Gonzales, 55 years old, separated from her husband, has four children of which only one who is 14 years old lives with her and is in high school, the other children are already independent. Some years ago she had a well equipped hairdresser's shop, which she sold to go to Buenos Aires, Argentina, in search of better working conditions and to elevate her level of life. She did not complete her expectations and returned to her city, San Ignacio, to exert once more the work she had done before. Her business functions in her own home and the loan will be destined for the purchase of modern hairdressing equipment.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María G. de 55 años, separada de su marido, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales sólo una de 14 años vive con ella y que está cursando la secundaria, los demás hijos ya son independientes. Unos años atrás tenía una peluquería bien equipada, la que vendió para ir a Buenos Aires, Argentina, en busca de mejores condiciones laborales y elevar su nivel de vida. No se cumplió sus expectativas y volvió a su ciudad, San Ignacio, a ejercer nuevamente la labor que realizaba anteriormente. Su negocio funciona en su mismo domicilio y el crédito destinará para la compra de un moderno equipo de peluquería.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdressing equipment - Compra de equipos de peluquería

loans.name: Nengah Juli Sudarmi

texts.id:
Raising pigs is a hobby and a source of additional income for the young mother of two. 27 years old Juli, the name she goes by, began pig farming after dropping off from school. Even though she only finished elementary school, the wife of Made Ardika, a Java-bound truck driver, is very energetic and experienced on raising pigs, from feeding the stocks, cleaning the pen to caring the piglets. From two sows Juli can produce 40 piglets per year. One piglet is sold for 170,000 IDR (1USD ~ 9,000 IDR). She could earn a gross margin of 6,800,000 IDR per year. With one additional sow from DINARI loan, Juli could still manage to multi-task as a homemaker and as a member of her village community. Their house is owned by her in-law, which motivates Juli to work even harder so she could save enough money to reach her dream to own her small house and to pay for her children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Memelihara babi merupakan hobi dan sumber pendapatan tambahan dari ibu muda yg telah dikaruniai 2 orang anak ini. Diusianya yang ke 27 tahun Juli begitu panggilan akrabnya mulai menekuni usaha beternak babi sejak masih muda, setelah putus sekolah karna faktor ekonomi keluarga. Meskipun hanya tamatan SD istri dari Made Ardika yang kesehariannya bekerja sebagai sopir truk Ke Jawa itu sangat gesit dan berpengalaman lebih –lebih dalam hal beternak, hampir separuh waktu yg dimilikinya di pergunakan untuk mengurus ternak-ternak yg dimiliki. Mulai dari memberi makan babi membersihkan kandang hingga merawat anak babi. Dengan 2 ekor induk babi Juli bisa meghasilkan 40 ekor anak (bibit) dalam satu tahunnya. Satu ekor bibit babi dijual Rp.170.000,- .Keuntungan kotor bisa didapatkannya sebesar Rp. 6.800.000, pertahunnya. Dengan tambahan 1 ekor Induk lagi dari pinjaman DINARI, Juli masih merasakan cukup waktu untuk mengerjakan pekerjaan lainya baik itu selaku Ibu Rumah tangga maupun kegiatan lain di desanya. Rumah yang mereka tempati merupakan rumah milik mertuanya yang sangat mendorong Juli bekerja lebih giat untuk bisa menabung dan mewujudkan impiannya untuk memiliki sebuah rumah kecil dan membiayai pendidikan anaknya.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif K. is an Internally Displaced Person from Khojavend city of Azerbaijan. Now he has settled in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is 42 years old is married and has 3 children. Arif is a taxi driver and would like a loan of $900.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en:
Shukur was born in 1968.  He has 10 years of experience in the farming business.  He is married and has 3 children.
 H.'s family lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village.  He wants to improve his business and to do this, he has applied for a loan of $1200.

loans.use: to improve his farming business

loans.name: Shodimurod

texts.ru:
Shodimurod B. is 45years old, he finished high school, has a wife and 9 children. Shodimurod raises cattle. He has been active in this field for 3 years. With his credit Shodimurod wants to purchase several young calves for feeding and resale. He plans to sell them every 40-45 days. He will then purchase more young calves with the money he receives from sales. Shodimurod will use his profit to support his family. After repaying the loan, he should end up with 2 calves as profit.

The client plans to repay the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобиев Шодимурод, возраст – 45 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 9-х детей. Шодимурод занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение нескольких бычков и корма для них. Он планирует продавать их каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги приобретать молодых бычков и корма для них. Полученную прибыль он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи. После выплаты кредита ему в качестве прибыли должно остаться 2 бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Cattle purchase for raising and resale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 32 year old father of 3. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in Tyre. Hassan owns a bakery and is doing the best he can with the bakery  to provide for his wife and children. Ali needs a loan to buy new materials to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy new materials for his bakery

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, aged 15 and 13. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, aged 60. Fatuma owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2002. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Rem

texts.en: Mrs. Rem S. lives in Thom village, an area in which most people are engaged in farming. She is 35 years old and is a subsistence farmer. As for her family life, she lives with her husband, Chanthorn En; further, she is the mother of two children, one of whom is working, while the other is studying at a local school. Her husband is a motorbike taxi-driver yet he earns very little income. To improve her and her family's living conditions, Mrs. Rem S. would like to expand her crop yield, so she is hereby requesting a loan to buy more vegetable seeds to cultivate on her field.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, and three are currently in school. Mary is industrious and her motivation is to support her children’s education, which will provide them with a better life in the future. She sells groundnut, pepper, onion, okro, and corn dough from a table top in the community market. Corn dough is a milled maize grain mixed with water and it used to make local meals like banku and porridge. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, baskets of pepper, onion, groundnut and okro to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, baskets of pepper, onions, groundnut and okro.

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children. She is 30 years old. Her husband is a cameraman. He started this business 5 years ago. Sevindj is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and has settled in the Fuzuli region. Now Aliyev's family requests a loan of $975 to buy to buy photo equipment for improving their business.  She promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: To buy photo equipment for improving his business.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou B. is 55 years old, married with 12 chlildren and her grandchildren in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Peyrissac for 3 years. She would like to buy vegetables and fishing line to pass on to her fisherman husband, who has a pirogue. Her husband is in charge of managing the lines and returning the catch, and will give her the fishing revenues. She will also sell dried fish and vegetables. She wants to strengthen her business to improve her family's living conditions. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Bintou B., 55 ans, mariée avec 12 enfants dont des petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 3 ans. Elle veut acheter des légumes et des filets de pêche pour remettre à son mari pêcheur qui a une pirogue. Son mari est chargé de la gestion des filets et au retour de la pêche, il lui versera les recettes du poisson. Elle fera aussi la vente de poissons secs et des légumes. Elle veut renforcer son activité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy fishing lines and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Daisy Nabukalu's Group

texts.en:
Daisy N. is the leader of a group of four women.  She is 46 and single with four children.  All of her children are in school.  Daisy lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Daisy has a small retail shop in Mpererwe. The market for her business is fair.  She plans to use this loan to add more stock to her business which will help her to pay her children's school fees and sustain her current living standards.

Daisy has successfully repaid four loans since she began working with MCDT.  She hopes to one day own her own house.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Senija

texts.en: Senija was born in 1952 and she is married. She does the agriculture and with this loan she intends to upgrade her greenhouse and to buy a water pump for it in order to ease the work and to improve the yield of her vegetables. This is her second loan, in the amount of 1000 KM ($US750), and she will repay it in 12 months.

loans.use: Upgrading her greenhouse.

loans.name: Leisy

texts.es: Se dedica a la venta de muebles, lo hace por sus 3 pequeños hijos quienes estudian el nivel primario, Leisy de 33 años de edad, es una madre muy proactiva, anteriormente se dedicó a varias actividades, pero ahora vio factible quedarse con la venta de muebles, tiene el apoyo de su esposo Rolando quien es el encargado de fabricar dichos muebles para que ella los venda, también brindan servicios de carpintería.Ahora quiere implementar, y sobre todo ampliar y mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, para ello requiere de un capital para cumplir con su objetivo. Con tu ayuda la señora Leisy logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leisy sells furniture to provide for her three young children, who are in elementary school. She is 33 years old and a very proactive mother. She has had different jobs in the past, but now she thinks that continuing selling furniture is feasible for her. She has the support of her husband Rolando, who is in charge of making the furniture that she sells. They also offers carpentry services to their clients. Now she wants to set up, and above all improve and expand her business’ facilities. Her goal requires capital. With your help, Mrs. Leisy will achieve her goal in very little time.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business, and improving her business' facilities.

loans.name: Nelly De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Aguarico Nº 299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijas menores de edad que aún dependen de ella y es viuda. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en el arreglo de su motokar.

En la actualidad trabaja de enfermera en el Hospital Regional de Pucallpa y cuenta con su motokar que lo trabaja todos los días. Acostumbra a levantarse muy temprano para ir a trabajar y por las tardes dedicarse a sus pequeñas hijas.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará Llantas, foco, tapizar los asientos, arreglo de motor, etc. 

Nelly manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que saben trabajar y está deseosa de tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Nelly belongs to the "Neighbors United" Communal Bank located at Jr. Aguarico Nº 299 in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 36 years old, the mother of two young daughters, and a widow. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in repairing her motocar. Currently, she works as a nurse at the Pucallpa Regional Hospital and relies on her motokar to work every day. She is accustomed to getting up very early to go to work and in the afternoons dedicates herself to her young daughters. With this loan of $400, which she will repay in four months, she will buy tires, lights, upholstered seats, motor repair, etc. Nelly says that Manuela Ramos is a help for all women that know how to work and want a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires, lights, upholstered seats, motor repairs, etc.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokchea C. is a 38-year-old widow and lives in the Trapaing Thmor village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a duck breeder. Since her business is doing well, she would like to expand and is now requesting a loan to buy more ducks and ducklings. She hopes the expansion of her business will increase her income and improve her living conditions. She has three children, one of whom is a driver for a company and the two others attend the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and ducklings to expand her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 28 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con su pequeño Jhon Anibal de 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de productos domésticos variados, más conocidos como “chiflaría”, desde hace 7 años, para lograr cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella comienza la venta desde muy temprano en la mañana para terminar a las 6 o 7 de la noche. Las ventas son buenas y Julia espera seguir prosperando por el bienestar de hijo, al cual espera darle una buena educación. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tener que permanecer durante casi todo el día, sin poder pasar más tiempo con su pequeño hijo, pero aún así, ve el lado positivo de su trabajo, que es que puede realizarlo con total tranquilidad y es su propia jefa. Julia se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para venderlos y también incursionar en la venta de artículos navideños.
texts.en:
Julia is 28 years old, she is separated from her husband and lives with her son Jhon Anibal, 8. For the past 7 years she has worked selling a variety of household products to pay for household expenses. She begins selling very early in the morning and finishes by 6 or 7 p.m. Sales are good and Julia hopes to continue her success for the well-being of her son. She wants to give him a good education. The hardest part of her job is being away from her son the whole day, but she still sees the positive side—that she is her own boss. This is Julia’s second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very punctual with her payments. With the loan money she will buy more products to sell and also begin to sell Christmas and holiday products.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married with no children. She sells women's clothing at the city market. She uses a tent to cover her goods from snow and rain. Elena brings all the inventory and the tent to the market every work day.  Besides the clothing business, Elena also sells tea and coffee at the market to increase her profits.
Elena would like to get a loan of $475. She needs more money to purchase clothing for sale and to increase her inventory. Even though this time is difficult for her, she believes that consistency and hard work are the key factors to success in business.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Neema Kimara Group

texts.en:
Eribarik P., age 29, is single. He has a catering business. He started this business in 2006 and works daily from 8am until midnight. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 177.

This will be Eribarik’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to build his private house and has repaid the loans successfully. He now hopes for the fifth loan to buy a good stock of food for his business.

Eribarik will share this loan with his loan group "Neema Kimara", which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Eribarik is in the middle, front row, in a white T-shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock of food for food service

loans.name: Salma Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is a 51-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Salma baji is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. She is married to a man whose name is N. A. and he is a painter. He performs his duties when people make a call to him to paint their houses. Salma baji is the mother of two sons. Her elder son is also a painter and her younger son works in Saudi Arabia.

Salma baji is an older lady so she keeps herself busy with household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more paint to expand their painting business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Khalida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint for their painting business

loans.name: Ayaba Gloria

texts.fr:
Madame K. Ayaba Gloria est une jeune fille célibataire qui a tellement de passion pour l’exercice de la couture. Elle a ouvert son propre atelier depuis 2005 après avoir suivi une formation de 3 ans au près d’une femme dynamique. Aujourd’hui, travaillant pour son propre compte, elle met tous les moyens en œuvre pour la réussite de sa petite entreprise.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des pagnes et tissus afin de pouvoir confectionner des habits et vendre. Ainsi avec le revenu de son activité, elle pourra subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Ayaba Gloria K. is a young single woman with a real passion for dress-making. She opened her own studio in 2005 after training for 3 years under the instruction of a dynamic woman. Now, working for herself, she works in every possible way to ensure the success of her small business. She is asking for this first loan in order to buy ‘pagnes’ (coloured West African cloth) and fabric so that she can make and sell clothes. With the income from this business, she will be able to support herself.


Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coloured cloth and fabric for dress-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing food ingredients and upgrading her bar

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 54 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijas, las cuales se dedican a la elaboración  y venta de artesanías, siendo una familia muy unida. Él se dedica a la refacción de autos, realiza el planchado y pintado de ellos para dejarlos óptimos y puedan transitar por las calles, aprendió desde muy joven a realizar este oficio, el cual dejó de lado por un tiempo para dedicarse al locutorio que puso en su propia vivienda. Debido a que sus hijas empezaron a realizar artesanías en su casa, tuvieron la idea de que ellas podrían atender el locutorio mientras su papá retomaba en su oficio para obtener ingresos adicionales. Para Pedro, esta actividad, más que un trabajo es un pasatiempo que le gusta realizar, claro que esto no significa que sea fácil, ya que demanda de mucho esfuerzo físico, el cual está acostumbrado a realizar. Para el futuro espera implementar su propio taller de planchado y pintado de autos y así dedicarse de neto a ello. Es la primera vez Pedro tiene un préstamo con MFP, y promete ser muy puntual en toda las cancelaciones de sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará algunas herramientas que le están haciendo falta para desarrollar mejor su trabajo, y la otra parte la invertirá en el negocio de sus hijas para comprar materiales (mostacillas, hilos, alambres, etc.) para ayudarlas con la producción de sus artículos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters, who make and sell handicrafts. They are a very close family. Pedro restores cars, repairing dents and repainting so that they are in optimal condition for the road. He learned this trade from a young age, but he left it for a while to run a telephone booth in his home. When his daughters began making crafts at home they had the idea to take over the management of the phone booth so that their father could return to working with cars and make more money.

For Pedro, his work is more than a job, but an activity that he really enjoys. The work is not easy, as it demands a lot of physical exertion, but he is used to the effort. In the future, he would like to have his own auto body repair shop and devote himself completely to it.

This is Pedro's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he promises to be punctual with his payments. He will use the money to purchase tools he needs to develop his business. He will also invest in his daughters' business by purchasing items they need to create their products (beads, string, wire, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and invest in his daughters' business

loans.name: Avliekul

texts.ru: Авлиекул Рахмонкулов в возрасте 39 лет, живет в районе Хурусон. Женат, имеет четверых детей. Авлиекул работал учителем 6 лет, т.к. заработная плата не хватало на содержании семьи, клиент решил заняться земледелием. этим видом деятельности он занимается более 8 лет. Клиент обратился к нам за кредитом, чтобы купить удобрение и собрать благоприятный посев пшеницы.
texts.en:
Avliekul R. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 39 years old, married and has four children. Avliekul worked as a teacher for 6 years, but, because his salary could not support his family, he decided to become involved in agriculture. He has been in this business over 8 years. Avliekul requested this loan in order to buy fertilizer and to harvest a good wheat crop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Marixsa Dominga

texts.es: Marixsa Dominga Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Marixsa tiene 2 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos y venta de repuestos electrónicos. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Marixsa no es una mujer de edad avanzada por lo que esto no le impidió salir adelante, y por este negocio es que sus hijos lograron estudiar y formarse en la vida. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo siempre destinado para su negocio en la compra de azúcar, leche, un poco de granos básicos. Su sueño es de salir adelante para que su negocio no fracase.
texts.en:
Marixsa Dominga G., 59, is married. Dona Marixsa has 2 children and works independently. She operates a business selling dairy products and electronic parts. She's operated the business for more than 13 years. Marixsa isn't that old so her age isn't an impediment to getting ahead and the business is for her children, to help them finish school and prepare for life. The loan is for working capital and, ultimately, for buying products such as sugar, milk, some basic grains for resale. What she most wants is that her business doesn't fail.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda J. is from the village of Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 49 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Melinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mujeres Sinceras Group

texts.en:
Ruth R. is a cheerful single mother and the coordinator for a new microfinance group of fifteen entrepreneurs. Her four children, Andelie, Danielle, Avel, and Ruth are 13, 11, 9, and 1 years old, respectively. They live together with her mother in Villa Isabela, a small village west of Puerta Plata. On days when her children aren’t in school, they enjoy playing baseball with other kids from the neighborhood. Although Mrs. R. says she has very little time for fun, she enjoys playing with her one-year-old child and listening to Shakira and Juanes.

Recently, Mrs. R. has been working to expand her hair salon. A friend told her about Esperanza and she recognized the opportunity to increase her income. She intends to use her increased capital to buy a new hair salon, which she believes will pay back the loan and significantly improve her life.

Mrs. R. works mainly for her children. She hopes to provide them all with a college education and wants to secure a future for them in the Dominican Republic. Like many of the other women in the group, she sees her first loan from Esperanza as the beginning of a more secure, more fruitful lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a new hair salon

loans.name: Joe-Alen

texts.en:
Joe-alen S. is from the village of Danao. At a young age of 22, he is already married, and has an infant child.

Joe-alen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Joe-alen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Joe-alen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his 2nd from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 41 years old. She is married and is blessed with two children who are in school. She has been sewing for sixteen years. She specializes in women's clothing. Her skills and designs are refined. She sews various styles that give her customers a new look, such as children's school uniforms, church attire, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, and the kaba and slit, which is a tailored top and long skirt.. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing supplies, such as linen, threads, and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She has three apprentices who are learning skills for their future.

loans.use: To buy sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Teegaluo Group

texts.en:
Teegaluo is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Forkpa L., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Forkpa is married with 2 children, ages 3 and10.  The older child is in the 1st grade because school was interrupted during the war.  Forkpa is 26 years old, with an 11th grade education, and he lives in Borkeza Town.  

Forkpa’s business is selling rice retail, which he buys wholesale, in Bokeza town. He has been running his business for 3 years.   He’s taking a loan to increase his inventory so he can serve more customers.  With the profits he dreams of building a more permanent shop, investing in the future of his kids, especially in education since he was unable to complete school.

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice to increase inventory

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena dreams of providing a progressive life for her family. She wants her children to have a better future life, so she and her husband are working very hard. She is married to Lorenzo Jr. and they are aiming to improve their poor living conditions for the benefit of their three children. 

Her husband is operating a tricycle transport business while Lucena sells frozen foods. She started with a small capital amounting to PHP 2,000 and she is thankful that she has been able to maintain her enterprise. She is hoping for business growth but she needs additional capital. This is the reason why she is asking for a financial capital of PHP5, 000.00. With her efforts and sacrifices in the business, she believes that she can reach her dreams.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Rosa Jazmina

texts.es: La joven Rosa S. de 29 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua,, trabaja en venta en una tienda  del uno dos tres donde venden variedad de productos, tiene dos años de laborar y su mayor deseo es poder hacer un cuarto y tener sus propias cosas para un futuro, el cual en unos meses será madre aunque sea madre soltera hará lo posible para que no le falte nada. Vive con sus padres los cuales siempre la apoyan. Este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y otros para hacer su cuarto y poder estar en mejores condiciones cuando nazca su bebe. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de hacer posible su sueño de poder tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The Young Rosa S. is 29 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She works in a shop where she sells a variety of products. She has worked this way for 2 years and her biggest desire is to be able to make a room and have her own things for the future. She will be a mother in a few months and being a single mother she will do everything possible so that her child won’t lack anything. She lives with her parents who always support her. This is her second loan with Afodenic in which she will buy construction materials such as: stone, cement, iron, and other products to make her room and be able to be in better conditions when her baby is born. She is thankful to the institution for the opportunity to make possible her dream of having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera. (To purchase a dairy cow)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is married and has one child. She has no educational background. Sarah sells foodstuffs such as garden eggs, onions, tomatoes, raw fresh pepper, palm oil, palm kernel oil, smoked fish, and so on, at Elmina near Bantama. She has been engaged in this activity since 1990. Her husband is a fisherman. Sarah uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Sarah will use the loan to purchase more foodstuff for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 39 years old and married to William. Her husband helps her buy and sell junk materials. They are blessed with six children.  She buys scrap materials in her village and sells those materials in big junk shops. She also sells cosmetics products. 

Yolanda would like to borrow PHP6,000 to purchase more products for her customers and to buy more scrap.  The additional capital will help her growth her business.  She would be thankful if KIVA lenders loan her the money.

loans.use: Capital for business development.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah N. is 25 years old and has three school-aged children. She is married to John Mathege, and she and her husband are both in business. Hannah runs a general store. This is her first loan from KADET. She has never borrowed from any micro-finance institution before, but was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. Hannah will use this loan to acquire more inventory to sell from her store, including bread, flour and soap. These purchases will allow her to meet the high demand during the Christmas season. Her dream and aspiration is to own a major wholesale shop.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to her general store

loans.name: Abimbola Flora

texts.en: Flora is 43 years old and married to a contractor. They have four children. Flora is a hairstylist; she creates different styles of hair and sells hair accessories such as hair creams, hair extensions, nails etc. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance.  Having been in LAPO for over two years now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 170,000 to expand her hair clinic by purchasing more hair accessories to sell and for styling hair.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions and hair accessories to sell

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Moussa has been working as a builder since 1998. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. He also had some financial issues. Moussa is special in his work because he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Febelita

texts.en:
Febelita B. was born in the town of Tanay, Rizal, in the Philippines. She is 46 years old and is married to a fisherman, Edgardo. She and her husband have three children: two in college and one in high school.

Febelita and her husband come from very poor families. They realize that their lack of education has led to their poverty, and they want a better life for their children. The couple has a strong belief not to be affected by poverty; instead they are inspired to work hard for their children.

Febelita joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap Inc.), a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1995; since then, she has grown to love the organization. ASHI helped her in the start-up of a business, enabling her to support her husband in their daily expenditures.

Febelita and her husband have been in the fishing business for more than ten years. She now proposes that her eighth loan of Php 25,000 be used to continue their fishing business with the support of her husband. She will purchase assorted equipment for her fishing business like fishing net, rope, and bamboo. The remaining loan will be use to pay for a cow for additional income.

Febelita hopes that this business will be the source of income to finance the needs of her family and to provide a comfortable house to live in. She is very thankful to all members of ASHI for educating her, especially in dealing with other people, generating an ability to accept new challenges in her life, and helping her to achieve her dreams and improve their standard of living.

Febelita is grateful to the ASHI-Kiva partnership for supporting people like her who want to get out of poverty and get ahead. She hopes that the partnership continues this way for a long time and helps many poor families.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her fishing business and to buy a cow for additional income

loans.name: Tạ's Group

texts.en:
N. Tạ Thị (20203020020) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


N. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  N. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
